title: Data Analyst
description: At Precise Solutions, we are looking for top talent consultants to bring on as employees of our organization and service our clients in the various Life Sciences Industries. We are much more than a consulting firm! Precise Solutions provides competitive compensation packages with great salaries, benefits, health insurance, paid time off and employer-based 401k contributions.<p><br></p><strong><u>We Currently Have An Immediate Need For The Following</u></strong><p><br></p>Job Title: Data Analyst<p><br></p>Location: Lake County, IL USA<p><br></p>Compensation: $54.00 per hour, Paid Time off, Company 401k contributions, Health, dental, and vision insurance. Total Annual Compensation including benefits is $125,000.00<p><br></p>Resume Requirements<p><br></p>The following resume requirements must be met for resume to be considered<p><br></p><ul><li>Candidates first and last name (legal spelling) must be at the top of the resume </li><li>Valid email address must be at the top of the resume. LinkedIn links will not be accepted it must be a valid email address so our recruiters can respond to your resume </li><li>Please refrain from submitting resumes with candidates photo they will not be considered</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Data Analyst Job Description</u></strong><p><br></p>The Business Data Analyst will be responsible for data modeling, Power BI dashboard creation and maintenance, ETL automation, ad-hoc reporting, and long term analytical and statistical projects. The Business Data Analyst will support cross-functional stakeholders and work with multiple sources and a wide range of data technologies and systems (e.g. SQL, Power BI, Hive, etc..)<p><br></p>Data Analyst Years of Experience/education and/or certifcations required <ul><li>BA/BS in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Finance </li><li>5+yrs most recent experience as a Data Analyst </li><li>Demonstrated strength in SQL, data modeling, ETL development, and data warehousing </li><li>3+ yrs Experience with Power BI </li><li>Experience creating PowerPoints and Dashboards for leadership</li></ul><p><br></p>Data Analyst Primary Duties and Responsibilities <ul><li>Creating and maintaining data dictionaries, use cases, functional and non-functional requirements documents, test plans and other project documents </li><li>Assisting with requirements facilitation and KPI definition/alignment </li><li>Assisting with user acceptance testing </li><li>Assisting with dashboard demos and feedback gathering </li><li>Think strategically and analytically about business and technical challenges, with the ability to work cross functionally </li><li>Ability to distill problem definitions, models, and constraints from informal business requirements </li><li>Demonstrate deep understanding of source data from various internal/external systems </li><li>Support key business systems and applications </li><li>Further establish the newly implemented change management process </li><li>Communicate and present findings to stakeholders </li><li>Work in an ambiguous environment, drawing out and developing business requirements to meet changing needs </li><li>Working with technical teams to capture data driven metrics</li></ul><p><br></p>Data Analyst Qualifications <ul><li>BA/BS in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Finance, or relevant work experience </li><li>Demonstrated strength in SQL, data modeling, ETL development, and data warehousing </li><li>Advanced experience in Power BI </li><li>Experience with Power BI, Tableau, or other similar BI tools </li><li>The ideal candidate will have extensive experience with development of metrics and business analytics, and have the aptitude to incorporate new approaches and methodologies, and a strong understanding of Data Warehouse (DW) concepts, while dealing with ambiguity </li><li>Excellent business and communication skills are a must to develop and define key business questions and to build data sets that answer those questions </li><li>Should be able to work cohesively with stakeholders to understand business requirements and implement reporting solutions</li></ul><p><br></p>Data Analyst Top Skills REQUIRED: <ul><li>Demonstrated strength in SQL, data modeling, ETL development, and data warehousing </li><li>3+ yrs Experience with Power BI </li><li>Demonstrate deep understanding of source data from various internal/external systems. </li><li>Communicate and present findings to stakeholders </li><li>Excellent business and communication skills are a must to develop and define key business questions and to build data sets that answer those questions </li><li>Experience creating PowerPoints and Dashboards for leadership </li><li>The ideal candidate will have extensive experience with development of metrics and business analytics, and have the aptitude to incorporate new approaches and methodologies, and a strong understanding of Data Warehouse (DW) concepts, while dealing with ambiguity </li><li>Should be able to work cohesively with stakeholders to understand business requirements and implement reporting solutions</li></ul><p><br></p>Data Analyst Nice To Have Skills <ul><li>Experience using HIVE </li></ul><p><br></p>Powered by JazzHR

title: Data Analyst (T)
description: Max Bill rate is ***/hour<br> This position is onsite in IL<br> <br> This role requires the individual to have experience with collecting, organizing, and analyzing data from various resources. Primary tasks of this position are compilation and analysis of data definitions, meaning, usage, labelling standards and other source system information to produce IT consumable information. They may be required to take on other tasks as needed such as but not limited to: technical expertise with automatic data collection and reporting systems, including a capacity for program troubleshooting and system security measures<br> <br> Job Requirements<br> Bachelor Degree in Math or Data Information Systems OR 4 years experience in data analysis/reporting.<br> * 2 years experience in data analysis and/or preparing database reports.<br> * 2 years experience in MS Access and MS Excel.<br> * Experience analyzing and preparing recommendations on process improvement.<br> * Project management experience.<br> * Systems database testing experience.<br> * Verbal and written communications skills to interact with internal customers, management and vendors.<br> * Analytical, organizational and planning skills.<br> <br> PREFERRED JOB REQUIREMENTS:<br> * Experience in the managed care environment.<br> * Knowledge of medical terminology.<br>          Contingent Reason for Request         External Worker Needed        If Contract to Hire, Please Enter Expected Salary         N/A        Worker Type         T        Please list any other Client locations that the contractor can work from, if applicable         (No Value)        Required Qualification(s)         Bachelor Degree in Math or Data Information Systems OR 4 years experience in data analysis/reporting        Preferred Qualification(s)         * Experience in the managed care environment. * Knowledge of medical terminology.

title: Data Analyst (19-22/hr)
description: <ul><li>Looking for:* *-Proficient in Excel (Highly proficient skills: create spreadsheets, formulas, Vlook ups and pivot tables is a plus)* *-2-4 years of data heavy position* *-HS Diploma or GED*</li><li>Hours:* Monday through Friday</li><li>8am to 5pm* 2 days in office, 3 days remote</li><li>Description:* The new business job family roles will be responsible for the retrieval, validation, and processing of all worksite and group benefit enrollment files and manual production submissions inclusive of file balancing and audits. The team will be responsible for accurate processing of new enrollments, routing of benefit changes, and handling of termination notifications. Job responsibilities:</li><li>Ability to work with large data sets and run simple formula (VLOOKUP and logic functions are a plus)</li><li>Perform quality assurance and testing to ensure accuracy of setup and ability to process new business</li><li>Retrieve data files from various enrollment platforms and secure server transmissions; validate format and completeness of information received based upon product requirements, and prepare to load into administrative system</li><li>Review state and product compliance requirements, ensure appropriate approvals have been received</li><li>Provide support to field sales, brokers, and employer groups to resolve issues, collect missing information, and ensure accuracy of information received</li><li>Investigate errors that occur on assigned employer groups, research issue and follow through to resolution partnering with internal stakeholders</li><li>Escalate errors and risks as appropriate to bring to resolution and management intervention</li><li>Meet or exceed department established production and quality goals, ensuring service levels are met</li><li>Provide superior customer support to internal and external customers<br><br></li></ul>About Aston Carter:<br><br>Please Note: Scammers are posing as Aston Carter. We'll never contact you via Gmail, Telegram, or WhatsApp and we'll never solicit money from you.<br><br>At Aston Carter, we’re dedicated to expanding career opportunities for the skilled professionals who power our business. Our success is driven by the talented, motivated people who join our team across a range of positions – from recruiting, sales and delivery to corporate roles. As part of our team, employees have the opportunity for long-term career success, where hard work is rewarded and the potential for growth is limitless. Established in 1997, Aston Carter is a leading staffing and consulting firm, providing high-caliber talent and premium services to more than 7,000 companies across North America. Spanning four continents and more than 200 offices, we extend our clients’ capabilities by seeking solvers and delivering solutions to address today’s workforce challenges. For organizations looking for innovative solutions shaped by critical-thinking professionals, visit [AstonCarter.com.](AstonCarter.com) Aston Carter is a company within Allegis Group, a global leader in talent solutions. The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law. If you would like to request a reasonable accommodation, such as the modification or adjustment of the job application process or interviewing process due to a disability, please call 888-237-6835 or email [astoncarteraccommodation@astoncarter.com](mailto:%20astoncarteraccommodation@astoncarter.com) for other accommodation options. However, if you have questions about this position, please contact the Recruiter located at the bottom of the job posting. The Recruiter is the sole point of contact for questions about this position.

title: Data-Analytics Sales Specialist - Financial Services
description: <strong>Job Description<br><br></strong>Oracle is leading the digital revolution. We are empowering nearly half a million businesses across the globe to turn untapped potential into real business value. You will connect the biggest enterprises of today with the tools to compete in the digital economy of tomorrow.<br><br><strong>Oracle’s modern data platform transforms decision-making and turns data into action.<br><br></strong><strong>Overview<br><br></strong>Are you passionate about helping Enterprise customers achieve their business goals through better data and analytics? We are looking for a Data-Analytics &amp; AI Sales Solutions Specialist who will be a trusted advisor to our most valuable customers. You will work within an Enterprise Industry-Vertical to bring your deep and broad expertise in Data-Integration, Data-Management &amp; Modernization, Analytics, and AI/ML, with use cases relevant to the customer's industry. You will collaborate with technical and partner resources to develop and advance the sales process and exceed quarterly revenue targets in your assigned accounts. Come and join us!<br><br><strong>Job Description<br><br></strong>As a Data-Analytics Solution Specialist, you will be responsible for growing the Oracle Analytics, Data-platform &amp; AI/M footprint with your customers and initiating and discovering new opportunities within enterprise accounts.<br><br>You will act as an inspiring leader to define your customers' Oracle Data, Analytics, &amp; AI strategy within your industry, with solutions aligned to your customer's business goals.<br><br>You will engage with customers across the breadth of an organization, building relationships multi-functionally and at all levels, and forming high-value partnerships with your customer's c-suite and decision-makers, helping them create an Oracle Data-Analytics, AI/ML vision and journey.<br><br>You will drive Data design, Analytic environments, and AI/ML capabilities within our enterprise targets to help them deliver on their customer's desired transformation. You will also promote Oracle Data Analytics capabilities across the Oracle Tech/Cloud Enterprise GTM. In addition, you will drive industry-defining customer success stories, highlighting business transformation initiatives that positively impact your customer's business, including sustainability. You will build compelling customer references to showcase Analytics, Data, and AI/ML capabilities on the Oracle platform.<br><br><strong>Team Collaboration Goals:<br></strong><ul><li>You will collaborate with Enterprise Sales, Technical, and Consulting teams across the Oracle Tech/Cloud Enterprise to identify and develop opportunities. You will work in a diverse, multi-functional remote team, orchestrating multiple projects.<br><br></li></ul><strong>What You’ll Bring<br></strong><ul><li>Experience in enterprise sales in Cloud and On-Premises high-tech business environments or account management.</li><li>Prior sales experience in a data and analytics sales position, working with analytics solutions, Data Warehouse, Data Lake, Predictive Analytics, and Machine Learning.</li><li>Experience in developing and maintaining strategic CxOs relationships.</li><li>Consistent track record in coordinating multiple sales opportunities simultaneously.</li><li>Experience working in a diverse, multi-functional remote team.</li><li>Bachelor’s degree in business, computer science, or similar information technology.<br><br></li></ul>What You’ll Do<br><ul><li>You will understand what motivates customers to buy and what drives the industry to grow faster and know how to tap into those needs in an effective way</li><li>You will be responsible for encouraging long-term strategic relationships within select high profile enterprise accounts</li><li>You will develop a robust qualified pipeline and handle strategic and customer centric account planning, crafting, owning and forecasting</li><li>You will be the trusted advisor and influencer in winning customer decisions to buy, architect and adopt Oracle solutions</li><li>You will work across the Oracle ecosystems and our technology partners to transform customer organizations and build enduring capabilities.</li><li>Nurture client relationships by building trust, partnership and an emotional connection to the Oracle brand and team</li><li>Gain access and build relationships with key executives, C-level leaders and decision makers.</li><li>Master and share the “why Oracle story” that represents the value we deliver to customers with our unified, multi-pillar offerings.</li><li>Build and complete key sales and business development initiatives to improve awareness of Oracle OCI and increase sales pipeline.</li><li>Successfully prospect into your assigned accounts to discover and develop viable selling opportunities.</li><li>Initiate and manage sophisticated sales cycles, using the support and strengths of key internal partners (Pre-Sales, Product Management, Executives and Industry Global Business Units to name a few).</li><li>Travel as required, as this role may be a virtual position.<br><br></li></ul>A career at Oracle is defined by you. We give you the freedom—and the skills—to write your own success story. Whatever avenue you go down, you’ll gain priceless learning experiences and be supported to do your best work. If this sounds like you, we hope to meet you!<br><br><strong>Apply Now</strong> Create the future with us. Apply now.<br><br>Visit oracle.com/careers and search for Job #/Title or contact diana.montague@oracle.com to apply.<br><br><strong>Responsibilities<br><br></strong>Primary job duty is to sell technology software products and related services in a defined territory. Identifies, qualifies and closes new opportunities. Manages accounts including the entire sales process from business development prospecting and specifications through contract negotiations, signing, and post-sales support. Leverages the Oracle sales model to maximize revenue growth and increase local market share. Builds and expands business partner revenue and self sufficiency.<br><br><strong>About Us<br><br></strong>An Oracle career can span industries, roles, Countries and cultures, giving you the opportunity to flourish in new roles and innovate, while blending work life in. Oracle has thrived through 40+ years of change by innovating and operating with integrity while delivering for the top companies in almost every industry.<br><br>In order to nurture the talent that makes this happen, we are committed to an inclusive culture that celebrates and values diverse insights and perspectives, a workforce that inspires thought leadership and innovation.<br><br>Oracle offers a highly competitive suite of Employee Benefits designed on the principles of parity, consistency, and affordability. The overall package includes certain core elements such as Medical, Life Insurance, access to Retirement Planning, and much more. We also encourage our employees to engage in the culture of giving back to the communities where we live and do business.<br><br>At Oracle, we believe that innovation starts with diversity and inclusion and to create the future we need talent from various backgrounds, perspectives, and abilities. We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to successfully participate in the job application, interview process, and in potential roles. to perform crucial job functions.<br><br>That’s why we’re committed to creating a workforce where all individuals can do their best work. It’s when everyone’s voice is heard and valued that we’re inspired to go beyond what’s been done before.<br><br>Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer<strong>*</strong>. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans’ status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Oracle will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records pursuant to applicable law.<br><ul><li> Which includes being a United States Affirmative Action Employer<br><br></li></ul><strong>Compensation: <br><br></strong>California Pay Range: from $113,000 to $209,200 per annum. May be eligible for equity. Eligible for commission with an estimated pay mix of 45/55.<br><br>Colorado Pay Range: from $110,000 to $209,200 per annum. May be eligible for equity. Eligible for commission with an estimated pay mix of 45/55.<br><br>New York City Pay Range: from $113,000 to $209,200 per annum. May be eligible for equity. Eligible for commission with an estimated pay mix of 45/55.<br><br>Washington Pay Range: from $113,000 to $209,200 per annum. May be eligible for equity. Eligible for commission with an estimated pay mix of 45/55.

Builds and expands business partner revenue and self sufficiency.<br><br><strong>About Us<br><br></strong>An Oracle career can span industries, roles, Countries and cultures, giving you the opportunity to flourish in new roles and innovate, while blending work life in. Oracle has thrived through 40+ years of change by innovating and operating with integrity while delivering for the top companies in almost every industry.<br><br>In order to nurture the talent that makes this happen, we are committed to an inclusive culture that celebrates and values diverse insights and perspectives, a workforce that inspires thought leadership and innovation.<br><br>Oracle offers a highly competitive suite of Employee Benefits designed on the principles of parity, consistency, and affordability. The overall package includes certain core elements such as Medical, Life Insurance, access to Retirement Planning, and much more. We also encourage our employees to engage in the culture of giving back to the communities where we live and do business.<br><br>At Oracle, we believe that innovation starts with diversity and inclusion and to create the future we need talent from various backgrounds, perspectives, and abilities. We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to successfully participate in the job application, interview process, and in potential roles. to perform crucial job functions.<br><br>That’s why we’re committed to creating a workforce where all individuals can do their best work. It’s when everyone’s voice is heard and valued that we’re inspired to go beyond what’s been done before.<br><br>Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer<strong>*</strong>. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans’ status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Oracle will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records pursuant to applicable law.<br><ul><li> Which includes being a United States Affirmative Action Employer<br><br></li></ul><strong>Compensation: <br><br></strong>California Pay Range: from $113,000 to $209,200 per annum. May be eligible for equity. Eligible for commission with an estimated pay mix of 45/55.<br><br>Colorado Pay Range: from $110,000 to $209,200 per annum. May be eligible for equity. Eligible for commission with an estimated pay mix of 45/55.<br><br>New York City Pay Range: from $113,000 to $209,200 per annum. May be eligible for equity. Eligible for commission with an estimated pay mix of 45/55.<br><br>Washington Pay Range: from $113,000 to $209,200 per annum. May be eligible for equity. Eligible for commission with an estimated pay mix of 45/55.

title: Data Engineer
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p><strong>What You’ll Do</strong><p><br></p><strong>As part of our </strong><strong>Enterprise Data Management team</strong><strong>, you’ll:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Develop data-driven solutions with current and next generation technologies to meet evolving business needs. </li><li>Provide technical design and develop Extract/Transform/Load (ETL) applications that interface with all key Discover applications. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>How You’ll Do It</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Design and develop data-ingestion frameworks, real-time processing solutions, and data processing and transformation frameworks.  </li><li>Deploy and provide support for application codes and analytical models. </li><li>Provide senior-level technical consulting to peer data engineers during design and development for highly complex and critical data projects. </li><li>Create and enhance data solutions that enable seamless integration and flow of data across the data ecosystem.  </li><li>Provide business analysis and develop ETL code and scripting to meet all technical specifications and business requirements according to the established designs.  </li><li>Develop real-time data ingestion and stream-analytic solutions leveraging technologies such as Kafka, Apache Spark, Python and AWS-based solutions.  </li><li>Work extensively within the Cloud ecosystem and migrate data from Teradata to AWS-based platform.  </li><li>Utilize multiple development languages/tools such as Python, SPARK, Hive, Java to build prototypes and evaluate results for effectiveness and feasibility.  </li><li>Develop application systems that comply with the standard system development methodology and concepts for design, programming, backup, and recovery to deliver solutions that have superior performance and integrity.   </li><li>Contribute to determining programming approach, tools, and techniques that best meet the business requirements.  </li><li>Provide subject matter expertise in the analysis, preparation of specifications and plans for the development of data processes.  </li><li>Offer system support as part of a support rotation with other team members.  </li><li>Operationalize open source data-analytic tools for enterprise use.  </li><li>Ensure data governance policies are followed by implementing or validating data lineage, quality checks, and data classification.  </li><li>Understand and follow the company development lifecycle to develop, deploy and deliver the solutions.    </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications You’ll Need</strong><p><br></p><strong>The Basics:</strong><strong> </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in computer science, or related field  </li><li>4+ years of experience in data platform administration/engineering  </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Bonus Points If You Have</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>6+ years of experience in data platform administration/engineering  </li><li>Knowledge and experience using query languages (SQL, Cypher) for relational and graph databases  </li><li>Willingness to continuously learn &amp; share learnings with others  </li><li>Capability to collaborate with stakeholders and project leaders to understand requirements, deliverables, and set expectations on tasks that you will be responsible for </li><li>Ability to work in a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment </li><li>Experience working in an agile and collaborative team environment  </li><li>Design and develop AtScale models based on data modeling of business requirements and entities </li><li>Great understanding of OLAP and dimensional modeling</li><li>Working knowledge in building multi-dimensional cubes, creating dimensions, facts, measures etc</li><li>Proficient in MDX and DAX</li><li>Experience with one or more of the following OLAP tools Microsoft SSAS, MicroStrategy, IBM Cognos etc</li><li>Experience with one or more of the following BI tools Tableau, PowerBI etc</li><li>Experience in solution delivery roles for business intelligence and data analytics</li><li>Experience in working with cloud databases and architectures such as Snowflake, AWS or Azure is a nice to </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $84,500.00 to $142,500.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)<p><br></p>

title: Analyst, gt.school (Remote) - $60,000/year USD
description: Position Name: Systems Engineer<p><br></p>Reports to: Client Technology Manager<p><br></p>Location/Type: Chicago, IL/Hybrid<p><br></p>Atlas Technica's mission is to shoulder IT management, user support, and cybersecurity for our clients, who are hedge funds and other investment firms. Founded in 2016, we have grown 100% year over year through our uncompromising focus on service.<p><br></p>We value ownership, execution, growth, intelligence, and camaraderie. We are looking for people who share our Core Values (https://atlastechnica.com/core-values), thrive, and contribute to this environment while putting the customer first. At Atlas Technica, we offer a competitive salary, comprehensive benefits, and great perks to our global Team. We strive to maintain a professional yet friendly environment while promoting professional and career development for our Team Members. Join Atlas Technica now!<p><br></p>We are seeking a Systems Engineer to join our rapidly growing organization. This is a highly technical role providing excellent career development opportunities for the successful candidate. You will be working with other Systems Engineers and Sr. Systems Engineers in a very collaborative environment which allows for very quick technical growth.<p><br></p>This position is classified as hybrid, the bulk of work being remote, but with a requirement to make occasional onsite visits to client and Atlas facilities as need arises. Onsite requirement is, on average, 20%. A qualified candidate will be able to commute to our clients and Atlas facilities in the region of Chicago, Illinois.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Perform IT Support services to users onsite</li><li>Use of a ticketing system to manage support queries</li><li>Maintain documentation and comply with rules and guidelines of the organization</li><li>Adherence to strict change control procedures</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>At least 2 years of IT Experience (Desktop Support, Systems Engineering, Systems Administration) </li><li>End User Support / Desktop Support: Microsoft Windows, Microsoft Office, desktop, and mobile device troubleshooting</li><li>Strong verbal and written communication skills</li><li>Support of primarily Microsoft 365 stack (Exchange Online, SharePoint Online, Intune, Azure AD)</li><li>Systems Administration: Knowledge of Microsoft Windows Server Platforms as well as Active Directory, Group Policy, good if you are familiar with Citrix XenApp</li><li>Support of Sophos or similar product for endpoint threat management</li><li>Basic understanding of virtualization platforms such as VMware or Hyper-V</li><li>Understanding of networking: TCP/IP, LAN / DMZ / WAN, DHCP, DNS, Routing, Switching and Firewalls</li><li>Experience working in an MSP environment</li><li>The candidate must be able to complete all physical requirements of the job, which include but are not limited to, the following; must be able to lift and/or carry up to 50 lbs; stand/sit for extended periods of time; push/pull; climb stairs; stoop, kneel or crouch; use fingers/hands to handle or feel; reach above head or below knee level; and the ability to work around machinery and material handling equipment.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Desirable Qualities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Financial industry experience including familiarity with market vendor applications: Bloomberg, Thompson Reuters, FactSet, CapIQ</li><li>Significant experience in an MSP environment, particularly utilizing the ConnectWise suite of products</li><li>Exposure to/ability to support workloads in Azure or AWS</li><li>Experience with vendors such as Google Workspace, Box, Dropbox, Duo, Okta, AirWatch</li><li>Experience with and ability to support Citrix XenApp or similar products</li><li>Experience with cybersecurity solutions such as Carbon Black, Cylance, Crowdstrike, Cyberhat</li><li>Experience with Mimecast or other mail security gateway solutions such as IronPort or Proofpoint</li><li>More than basic understanding of Storage and Virtualization platforms such as Nimble, Pure Storage, NetApp, EMC, VMware, Hyper-V, XenServer</li></ul><p><br></p>Atlas Technica is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

title: Finacle Developer
description: <p>Our financial services client is looking for an Operations Associate <span>to join their Chicago team on a contract basis. Ideal candidates be highly professional and organized must have 1+ years of related experience and have worked within the financial services space.</span></p><p><br></p><p><strong>Location: </strong>Chicago, IL</p><p><strong>Contract Pay:</strong> $25hr- $28hr (pay based on experience)</p><p><strong>Additional Details:</strong> Hybrid </p><p><br></p><p>In collaboration with internal and external stakeholders, the Benefits Analyst will act as a subject matter expert and point of contact in the fulfillment of the Pension Department’s efficient and effective pension administration, data analytics and system requirements. The Benefits Analyst will provide technical and analytical support to end users while collaborating with other interdepartmental teams and external stakeholders to ensure system is appropriately configured and maintained and all user and system requirements are successfully gathered, communicated, documented, and achieved in alignment with plan provisions, IRS requirements and ERISA rules and regulations under the direction of the Pension Manager. This position will also assess, identify, and resolve processing, and reporting issues, while ensuring all data reporting and analytical needs of the Pension Department are met.</p><p><br></p><p><strong><u>Key Duties and Responsibilities </u></strong></p><ul><li>Partner with cross-discipline team members to support collaboration and promote a positive client experience</li><li>CAS / COBD Review</li><li>Check for data integrity and discrepancies within an advisor team’s client agreement record in our Client Agreement System including necessary approvals or rejections.</li><li>Verify information between CAS records and client-signed Change of Broker-Dealer Documents.</li><li>Advisor Carrier Appointments</li><li>Assist advisor teams with becoming appointed/licensed to sell and service policies held at a multitude of varying insurance or annuity vendors/carriers.</li><li>Help advisors connect to and work with our Brokerage General Agents to assist with processing appointments outside of our direct selling agreement.</li><li>Clear Support Queue</li><li>Assist advisor teams with various issues that they may face, such as policy changes, CAS troubleshooting, document requests, and general questions surrounding I&amp;A business.</li><li>Maintaining Carrier Information</li><li>Stay up to date with carrier/vendor requirements and general information, such as E-signature acceptability, policy change guidelines, and contact information.</li><li>Appointments</li><li>Maintain the appointment tracker, to assist newly integrating teams be able to service and sell policies under Hightower</li><li>CAS (Client Agreement System)</li><li>Provide training and troubleshooting to newly integrating teams for CAS as well as assist in the creation of CAS Records</li><li>COBD (Change of Broker/Dealer) / COAR (Change of Agent of Record)</li><li>Assist teams in processing documentation to transition their existing book of business under Hightower or to transition from one agent to another.</li></ul><p></p>
description_json: <p>Our financial services client is looking for an Operations Associate <span>to join their Chicago team on a contract basis. Ideal candidates be highly professional and organized must have 1+ years of related experience and have worked within the financial services space.</span></p><p><br></p><p><strong>Location: </strong>Chicago, IL</p><p><strong>Contract Pay:</strong> $25hr- $28hr (pay based on experience)</p><p><strong>Additional Details:</strong> Hybrid </p><p><br></p><p>In collaboration with internal and external stakeholders, the Benefits Analyst will act as a subject matter expert and point of contact in the fulfillment of the Pension Department’s efficient and effective pension administration, data analytics and system requirements. The Benefits Analyst will provide technical and analytical support to end users while collaborating with other interdepartmental teams and external stakeholders to ensure system is appropriately configured and maintained and all user and system requirements are successfully gathered, communicated, documented, and achieved in alignment with plan provisions, IRS requirements and ERISA rules and regulations under the direction of the Pension Manager. This position will also assess, identify, and resolve processing, and reporting issues, while ensuring all data reporting and analytical needs of the Pension Department are met.</p><p><br></p><p><strong><u>Key Duties and Responsibilities </u></strong></p><ul><li>Partner with cross-discipline team members to support collaboration and promote a positive client experience</li><li>CAS / COBD Review</li><li>Check for data integrity and discrepancies within an advisor team’s client agreement record in our Client Agreement System including necessary approvals or rejections.</li><li>Verify information between CAS records and client-signed Change of Broker-Dealer Documents.</li><li>Advisor Carrier Appointments</li><li>Assist advisor teams with becoming appointed/licensed to sell and service policies held at a multitude of varying insurance or annuity vendors/carriers.</li><li>Help advisors connect to and work with our Brokerage General Agents to assist with processing appointments outside of our direct selling agreement.</li><li>Clear Support Queue</li><li>Assist advisor teams with various issues that they may face, such as policy changes, CAS troubleshooting, document requests, and general questions surrounding I&amp;A business.</li><li>Maintaining Carrier Information</li><li>Stay up to date with carrier/vendor requirements and general information, such as E-signature acceptability, policy change guidelines, and contact information.</li><li>Appointments</li><li>Maintain the appointment tracker, to assist newly integrating teams be able to service and sell policies under Hightower</li><li>CAS (Client Agreement System)</li><li>Provide training and troubleshooting to newly integrating teams for CAS as well as assist in the creation of CAS Records</li><li>COBD (Change of Broker/Dealer) / COAR (Change of Agent of Record)</li><li>Assist teams in processing documentation to transition their existing book of business under Hightower or to transition from one agent to another.</li></ul><p></p>

title: Operations Associate
description: <strong><u>Description<br><br></u></strong>There’s never been a more exciting time to join United Airlines. We’re on a path towards becoming the best airline in the history of aviation. Our shared purpose – Connecting People, Uniting the World – is about more than getting people from one place to another. It also means that as a global company that operates in hundreds of locations around the world with millions of customers and tens of thousands of employees, we have a unique responsibility to uplift and provide opportunities in the places where we work, live and fly, and we can only do that with a truly diverse and inclusive workforce. And we’re growing – in the years ahead, we’ll hire tens of thousands of people across every area of the airline. Our careers include a competitive benefits package aimed at keeping you happy, healthy and well-traveled. From employee-run "Business Resource Group" communities to world-class benefits like parental leave, 401k and privileges like space available travel, United is truly a one-of-a-kind place to work. Are you ready to travel the world?<br><br>We believe that inclusion propels innovation and is the foundation of all that we do. United's Digital Technology team spans the globe and is made up of diverse individuals all working together with cutting-edge technology to build the best airline in the history of aviation. Our team designs, develops and maintains massively scaling technology solutions brought to life with innovative architectures, data analytics, and digital solutions.<br><br><strong><u>Key Responsibilities<br><br></u></strong>The IT Field Services Engineer is responsible for managing logistics aspects of small to large size projects that are diverse, and moderately complex. Help coordinate project planning, training, execution, timing, functionality, quality, and cost. Required to interact with vendors and contractors. Will have to possess excellent organization &amp; communication skills, You will have to possess excellent customer service skills. Have a strong background in project management, has a strong understanding in Telecommunications Standards &amp; practices. Candidate will insure United's IT Critical Infrastructure standards are followed. The role is ensures functionality and quality of solution, is involved in project’s LAN "Local Area Network" WAN "Wide Area Network" VOIP "Voice Over IP"CCTV "Closed Circuit Television", Mobility platforms and infrastructure activities that comply with United’s IT critical infrastructure standards. The role will be the interface between Field Services and internal/external business partners.<br><ul><li>Support regional airports, customer service centers, contact centers and all United facilities. Duties include Walkthroughs, (DT) Digital Technology Equipment, preventative maintenance, mobility product support, (DT) Digital Technology infrastructure support, operational equipment and communication rooms, base location inventory management and supply storage</li><li>System maintenance/ administration, diagnostics, automated imaging of PC equipment/IT Infrastructure, installation and removal of PC equipment, assist end users with troubleshooting of device performance issue</li><li>Monitoring regional (DT) Digital Technology stock levels and maintaining a clean and organized work environment.</li><li>Attends regional project meetings and provides project tracking and analysis.</li><li>Supports the integration of vendor tasks and tracks and reviews vendor deliverables. </li><li>Coordinate activities with internal/external technology owners/service providers.</li><li>Network Engineering, WAN Engineering, WiFi Engineering, mobility Engineering. </li><li>Ensures The Main Distribution Frame (MDF) room and intermediate distribution frame (IDF) conform to established enterprise/industry standards (BICSI) Building Industry Consulting Service International, (EIA) Electronic Industries Alliance, (TIA) Telecommunications Industry association<br></li></ul>United values diverse experiences, perspectives, and we encourage everyone who meets the minimum qualifications to apply. While having the “desired” qualifications make for a stronger candidate, we encourage applicants who may not feel they check ALL of those boxes! We are always looking for individuals who will bring something new to the table!<br><br><strong><u>Qualifications<br><br></u></strong>What’s needed to succeed (Minimum Qualifications):<br><ul><li>Associate’s or Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science or equivalent IT experience</li><li>Minimum of 3 years of IT experience. (IT Field Services)</li><li>End user deployment support experience </li><li>Must be able to work a flexible 7x24x365 schedule and able to travel 50% of the time</li><li>Ability to work onsite at Chicago O'Hare airport</li><li>Mobility IOS/Android, Windows, LAN room and (DT) Digital technology Infrastructure experience (Copper, fiber optic)</li><li>Strong level of poise in high-pressure environments</li><li>Ability to communicate solutions to both technical and non-technical audiences</li><li>Must be legally authorized to work in the United States for any employer without sponsorship<br></li></ul>What will help you propel from the pack (Preferred Qualifications):<br><ul><li>Knowledge of Digital Technology infrastructure (copper, fiber optic)</li><li>Experience with rack and stack</li><li>Airline experience <br></li></ul>United Airlines is an equal opportunity employer. United Airlines recruits, employs, trains, compensates and promotes regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, gender identity, sexual orientation, physical ability, age, veteran status and other protected status as required by applicable law. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform crucial job functions. Please contact JobAccommodations@united.com to request accommodation.<br><br>Equal Opportunity Employer - Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled/LGBT <strong>ORD00002751</strong>

title: Systems Engineer
description: <strong>Overview<br><br></strong>We’re looking for a full-time <strong>Salesforce Developer</strong> to join our Corporate IT Team at GCG. In this role, you will assist with the full development life-cycle from technical design to development, testing, and deployment. You will work with the Salesforce project team and GCG clients to gather requirements and configure the Salesforce application based on business needs with robust documentation. This is a <strong>hybrid</strong> role based in our <strong>Chicago, IL</strong> headquarters.<br><br>The ideal candidate will primarily be focused on executing against a defined product backlog and driving further utilization, facilitating adoption and improved operations. You will be an integral member of our platform team who will help move the company along its digital transformation journey. Additionally, you will become a subject matter expert in business processes and intuitively understand how to identify waste in the system and drive process improvement to drive accuracy across the business.<br><br><strong>What You’ll Do<br></strong><ul><li> Lead the complete development process from requirement analysis to deployment independently, as well as lead the work of external consultants </li><li> Collaborate with the team for code review and unit testing </li><li> Manage post-deployment activities including knowledge transfer, process documentation, and application bug fixes </li><li> Own, support, and maintain all Salesforce applications </li><li> Design, develop, test, document, and deploy Salesforce solutions </li><li> Manage Salesforce configuration including user interface with all relevant choices </li><li> Conduct Application development and integration with backend ERP as well as analytics portals </li><li> Design a business portal </li><li> Requirements gathering, create solutions, and/or deploy solutions to end users </li><li> Leverage excellent technical project management experience </li><li> Ensure complex customer workflows into Salesforce specific outputs </li><li> Create technical approaches and plans to encompass all needed procedures </li><li> Collaborate with the pre-sales support and solutions architecture team on integrations and solution deployment </li><li> Communicate with project teams regarding status, technical issues, and creative solutions </li><li> Meet with project managers to determine CRM needs </li><li> Develop customized solutions within the Salesforce platform </li><li> Design, code, and implement Salesforce applications </li><li> Create timelines and development goals </li><li> Develop end to end Salesforce solutions using Configuration and Customization - APEX Class, Triggers, Visualforce pages, Lightning components, etc. </li><li> Automate business processes using Salesforce automation tools, such as Process Builder, Workflows, Formulas, Flow, Assignment Rules and email Alerts </li><li> Build integrations between Salesforce and external applications using REST, SOAP APIs, oAuth and Single Sign-On </li><li> Migrate changes from development to test to production </li><li> Perform data updates / migration using Data Loader and other similar tools </li><li> Participate in scrum meetings, analyze assign user stories, identify/resolve gaps in functional user stories/business requirements </li><li> Adhere to defined coding standards and develop well-structured, maintainable and easy to understand code </li><li> Perform independent code reviews and write unit/integration test cases to achieve 85% test coverage </li><li> Debug and resolve issues and/or defects which may be reported as a result of faults in the production system <br><br></li></ul><strong>What y Ou’ll Bring<br></strong><ul><li> 3+ years of experience configuring and building Salesforce.com solutions </li><li> Advanced business analysis and functional experience, including requirements gathering, creating solutions, and/or deploying solutions to end users </li><li> Technical project management experience </li><li> Excellent attention to detail and problem - solving skills </li><li> Excellent verbal and written communication and data presentation skills, including an ability to effectively communicate with both business and technical teams </li><li> Extensive experience building enterprise scale applications on Service and Community Clouds </li><li> Extensive development experience in custom development with Salesforce Lightning </li><li> Extensive experience with Apex development and Visualforce Page development </li><li> Advanced understanding of Salesforce architecture and development best practices </li><li> Highly skilled in building custom integrations on Salesforce platform </li><li> Working knowledge of web services development using REST, SOAP, etc </li><li> Ability to work independently and as part of a cross-functional team in a fast-paced environment </li><li> Ability to communicate and present to technical and non-technical audiences <br><br></li></ul><strong> What we o </strong><strong> ffer <br></strong><ul><li> Competitive compensation </li><li> Robust and affordable benefits options, including medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short and long-term disability insurance, and more </li><li> An employee-centric company that values and truly appreciates our most important asset: You! <br><br></li></ul><strong>About GCG<br><br></strong>At GCG, <strong>We Make Connections Possible</strong> through a nationwide network of facilities providing the wire, cable, automation and associated products that ensure connections among families and friends, co-workers and customers, and the industrial equipment used across the county. Serving a wide variety of industries, our experienced teams are <strong>Service-Oriented, Responsive, and Values-Focused</strong>.<br><br>Genuine Cable Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.<br><br>These duties and responsibilities are judged to be "essential functions" in terms of the Americans With Disabilities Act, or ADA. To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed above are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.<br><br>The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by a person in this position. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all duties that may be performed by such a person.<br><br>

title: Engineer - IT Systems Field Services
description: CoinFlip is a leading fintech company powered by cryptocurrency. Believing everyone deserves to participate in the new digital economy, the company operates one of the world’s largest networks of cryptocurrency ATMs — with over 4,000 active kiosks — as well as an over-the-counter trading desk. In 2022, CoinFlip became an international company by expanding into Canada , and launched CoinFlip Ventures , a new initiative designed to support start-up companies.<p><br></p>CoinFlip placed No. 60 on the 2021 Inc. 5000 list of the nation’s fastest-growing private companies. CoinFlip was also named the 2021 and 2022 #1 fastest-growing company in Chicago by Crain’s Business.<p><br></p>As our growth trajectory continues, we’re looking to quickly expand all of our teams. It’s an exciting time to join CoinFlip as we’re pursuing additional business lines and continued international expansion to further cement us as a leading financial technology company.<p><br></p>We're currently seeking a talented and experienced Salesforce Admin &amp; Developer with a robust background in SalesCloud and ServiceCloud deployments in a global theatre. As a member of the IT team, you will have a mix of technical but also business understanding, providing high quality solutions to our business stakeholders. The ideal individual must have demonstrated capabilities with third-party integrations (e.g., Docusign, JIRA, Netsuite) and effective communication and collaboration skills to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will be the subject matter expert working closely with all functions and business teams to optimize, customize, and develop our Salesforce platform to meet the evolving needs of our business, including global expansion.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Design, implement, and maintain Salesforce ServiceCloud configurations, customizations, and integrations, ensuring optimal system performance and data quality.</li><li>Collaborate with sales, operations, and IT partners to gather and analyze requirements, translating them into actionable solutions that enhance the Salesforce platform and support business objectives.</li><li>Develop, test, and deploy third-party integrations, including Docusign, to streamline processes, improve efficiency, and automate workflows.</li><li>Utilize JIRA for effective project management, issue tracking, and communication with internal stakeholders and external vendors.</li><li>Provide Salesforce administration support, including user management, security, roles, profiles, permission sets, and data management.</li><li>Develop custom objects, fields, validation rules, workflows, process builder, and Apex code to accommodate unique business requirements.</li><li>Monitor system performance and resolve issues proactively, ensuring minimal disruption to end-users.</li><li>Create and maintain comprehensive documentation related to Salesforce configurations, customizations, and integrations.</li><li>Offer ongoing training and support to end-users, ensuring a smooth and efficient user experience.</li><li>Stay current on Salesforce platform updates, features, and best practices, applying this knowledge to drive continuous improvement.</li><li>Ensures data backup and data retention requirements are met.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.</li><li>Salesforce Certified Administrator and Salesforce Certified Platform Developer credentials required.</li><li>3+ years of experience in Salesforce administration and development, with a strong focus on ServiceCloud.</li><li>Strong emphasis on data security and familiarity with multi-region requirements (e.g., GDPR)</li><li>Demonstrated experience with third-party integrations, including DocuSign.</li><li>Proficiency in JIRA for project management and issue tracking.</li><li>Solid understanding of Apex, Visualforce, Lightning Web Components, and Salesforce APIs.</li><li>Experience with agile methodologies and version control systems (e.g., Git).</li><li>Strong analytical, problem-solving, and organizational skills.</li><li>Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Nice To Have</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>General passion and knowledge of fintech and crypto</li><li>Experience with working in a start up</li><li>Experience with Oracle NetSuite</li></ul><p><br></p>Working at CoinFlip means collaborating with experienced and innovative leaders who share a clear vision and a track record of success. We offer a collaborative and positive working environment where we encourage employees to balance productivity with time to recharge. Compensation is above and beyond a typical “startup” — we offer competitive salaries, performance-based incentives, and competitive benefits for full-time employees.<p><br></p>CoinFlip values diversity in the workplace and is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing an inclusive and accessible work environment. We thank all candidates who apply, but only those selected for an interview will be contacted.<p><br></p>By applying to this role, you give express consent to CoinFlip to send you informational text (SMS) messages regarding this role and the application process. You can cancel the SMS service at any time by replying "STOP" to the text message you received. If at any time you forget what keywords are supported, just reply "HELP." Message and data rates apply. If you require a special accommodation, please let us know and we’ll work with you to meet your needs.
industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Technology, Information and Internet, and Financial Services

administration support, including user management, security, roles, profiles, permission sets, and data management.</li><li>Develop custom objects, fields, validation rules, workflows, process builder, and Apex code to accommodate unique business requirements.</li><li>Monitor system performance and resolve issues proactively, ensuring minimal disruption to end-users.</li><li>Create and maintain comprehensive documentation related to Salesforce configurations, customizations, and integrations.</li><li>Offer ongoing training and support to end-users, ensuring a smooth and efficient user experience.</li><li>Stay current on Salesforce platform updates, features, and best practices, applying this knowledge to drive continuous improvement.</li><li>Ensures data backup and data retention requirements are met.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.</li><li>Salesforce Certified Administrator and Salesforce Certified Platform Developer credentials required.</li><li>3+ years of experience in Salesforce administration and development, with a strong focus on ServiceCloud.</li><li>Strong emphasis on data security and familiarity with multi-region requirements (e.g., GDPR)</li><li>Demonstrated experience with third-party integrations, including DocuSign.</li><li>Proficiency in JIRA for project management and issue tracking.</li><li>Solid understanding of Apex, Visualforce, Lightning Web Components, and Salesforce APIs.</li><li>Experience with agile methodologies and version control systems (e.g., Git).</li><li>Strong analytical, problem-solving, and organizational skills.</li><li>Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Nice To Have</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>General passion and knowledge of fintech and crypto</li><li>Experience with working in a start up</li><li>Experience with Oracle NetSuite</li></ul><p><br></p>Working at CoinFlip means collaborating with experienced and innovative leaders who share a clear vision and a track record of success. We offer a collaborative and positive working environment where we encourage employees to balance productivity with time to recharge. Compensation is above and beyond a typical “startup” — we offer competitive salaries, performance-based incentives, and competitive benefits for full-time employees.<p><br></p>CoinFlip values diversity in the workplace and is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing an inclusive and accessible work environment. We thank all candidates who apply, but only those selected for an interview will be contacted.<p><br></p>By applying to this role, you give express consent to CoinFlip to send you informational text (SMS) messages regarding this role and the application process. You can cancel the SMS service at any time by replying "STOP" to the text message you received. If at any time you forget what keywords are supported, just reply "HELP." Message and data rates apply. If you require a special accommodation, please let us know and we’ll work with you to meet your needs.

title: Salesforce Developer - Hybrid
description: <strong>Must be a resident of Illinois or willing to relocate. Flexible scheduling is available, upon completion of a six-month probationary period. </strong><p><br></p>Illinois Housing Development Authority (IHDA), one of the Nation’s preeminent Housing Finance Agencies and one of the State’s ten largest financial institutions, is currently seeking an IT System Engineer to build upon their 50+ year leadership in housing finance.<p><br></p><strong> Summary: </strong><p><br></p>Responsible for designing, organizing, modifying, and supporting the Authority’s data center. Performs maintenance and administration of systems related to Windows servers including support of hardware and software and user interaction. Requires knowledge of system administration and management along with the ability to work with minimal supervision.<p><br></p><strong> Essential Functions: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Perform Windows Server Day to day administration and planning, including monitoring, performance analysis, tuning, disaster recovery planning and capacity planning in a Hyper-V Virtual Server environment. </li><li> Perform routine daily operations; perform routing equipment maintenance; apply security updates and patches and maintain system backups. Use Microsoft System Center Tools for monitoring and managing system infrastructure. </li><li> Work with SQL Server databases and related systems to provide application support and maintenance. </li><li> Monitor networks to ensure security and availability to specific users. Evaluate and modify systems performance. Perform network address assignment including DNS and DHCP. Assist in administering routers, switches, firewalls, smartphones, and software deployment. </li><li> Provides troubleshooting support for end user reported problems as a second-tier resource to the Help Desk staff. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong> EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE and SKILLS REQUIREMENTS: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Undergraduate degree or equivalent experienced required. Three years experienced in a system administration role on Windows Server networks and excellent communication skills. Exchange 2013 Server Administration preferred. Microsoft Hyper-V Virtualization preferred. </li></ul><p><br></p>Excellent benefits package, including 401(k); immediate vesting.<p><br></p>EOE

title: Salesforce Admin & Developer
description: <strong><u>Description<br><br></u></strong>There’s never been a more exciting time to join United Airlines. We’re on a path towards becoming the best airline in the history of aviation. Our shared purpose – Connecting People, Uniting the World – is about more than getting people from one place to another. It also means that as a global company that operates in hundreds of locations around the world with millions of customers and tens of thousands of employees, we have a unique responsibility to uplift and provide opportunities in the places where we work, live and fly, and we can only do that with a truly diverse and inclusive workforce. And we’re growing – in the years ahead, we’ll hire tens of thousands of people across every area of the airline. Our careers include a competitive benefits package aimed at keeping you happy, healthy and well-traveled. From employee-run "Business Resource Group" communities to world-class benefits like parental leave, 401k and privileges like space available travel, United is truly a one-of-a-kind place to work. Are you ready to travel the world?<br><br>We believe that inclusion propels innovation and is the foundation of all that we do. United's Digital Technology team spans the globe and is made up of diverse individuals all working together with cutting-edge technology to build the best airline in the history of aviation. Our team designs, develops and maintains massively scaling technology solutions brought to life with innovative architectures, data analytics, and digital solutions.<br><br><strong><u>Key Responsibilities<br><br></u></strong>The Facilities Engineer provides operational integrity of the data center electrical, mechanical and fire safety systems. Ensures that data center problems are identified and resolved quickly and with quality. Responsible for performing preventative maintenance in accordance with established schedule and in compliance with all codes, industry, and company standards. Responsible to develop infrastructure improvements and serve as subject matter expert (SME) in assigned area or specialty (e.g., cooling, electrical, mechanical and facilities related interior and exterior infrastructure).<br><ul><li>Daily checks to determine operational functionality of hyper scale electrical and mechanical systems and NFPA70e and OSHA Regulations that pertain to data centers and triage failing systems, moving such systems off-line and implement redundant systems as needed</li><li>Performs preventative and corrective maintenance for mechanical, electrical, plumbing, and other infrastructure systems</li><li>Monitoring of all automation systems of the building</li><li>Responsible for the safe, professional, and operationally sound manipulation of electrical. Ensure the MOPS that support systems in high-availability, high-risk, or high-reliability environments are built, reviewed and applied to support the manipulation of the IT production loads</li><li>Responds quickly to emergency situations that impact the operations and coordinates with other critical facilities professionals to perform corrective repairs</li><li>Ability to read and interpret fire system, electrical system and mechanical system drawings and schematics to implement system triage as needed</li><li>Complete documentation which follows all federal, state, and local regulations for operations and work safety to include knowledge of safety procedures and equipment, procedures, and established techniques<br></li></ul>United values diverse experiences, perspectives, and we encourage everyone who meets the minimum qualifications to apply. While having the “desired” qualifications make for a stronger candidate, we encourage applicants who may not feel they check ALL of those boxes! We are always looking for individuals who will bring something new to the table!<br><br><strong><u>Qualifications<br><br></u></strong>What’s needed to succeed (Minimum Qualifications):<br><ul><li>High school diploma or equivalent</li><li>2+ years of experience in a related field</li><li>Prior building automation experience</li><li>Data Center Facilities systems experience</li><li>Experience working in facilities environment with exposure to electrical, mechanical, plumbing and refrigeration type equipment</li><li>Well versed in NEC and NFPA-75 rules and regulations</li><li>Ability to sit, stand, bend, stoop, push, pull, reach and lift as required, on a continuous basis, with items that can weigh up to 75lbs</li><li>Ability to work extended hours within a Data Center Environment and typically within a heat range of 60 degrees Fahrenheit upwards of 110 degrees Fahrenheit while following OSHA driven work rest cycles</li><li>Requires ability to climb and use a ladder varying in types from A-Frame to extension ladders at various heights</li><li>Understands the implications of work to make sound recommendations for solutions</li><li>Consistently demonstrate and follow established procedures for assigned activities and collaborate multi-functional with teams as well as vendors and suppliers to achieve goals</li><li>Must be legally authorized to work in the United States for any employer without sponsorship</li><li>Successful completion of interview required to meet job qualification</li><li>Reliable, punctual attendance is an essential function of the position<br></li></ul>What will help you propel from the pack (Preferred Qualifications):<br><ul><li>Associate degree in Mechanical Engineering or Electrical Engineering or 2 years of relevant work experience</li><li>4+ years of experience in a related field<br></li></ul>United Airlines is an equal opportunity employer. United Airlines recruits, employs, trains, compensates and promotes regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, gender identity, sexual orientation, physical ability, age, veteran status and other protected status as required by applicable law. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform crucial job functions. Please contact JobAccommodations@united.com to request accommodation.<br><br>Equal Opportunity Employer - Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled/LGBT <strong>WHQ00022209</strong>

title: System Engineer
description: <strong>Description<br><br></strong><strong>Work. Serve. Thrive.<br><br></strong>Imagine a place where your talent can make a meaningful difference in peoples' lives. Working at Feeding America is a uniquely rewarding experience in which our employees work together as vital parts of a much larger mission. We are innovative, mission-focused, diverse, collaborative, values-driven and focused on results.<br><br>Feeding America is the nation’s second largest charity and the leading domestic hunger-relief charity in the United States. Our mission is to feed America's hungry through a nationwide network of member food banks and engage our country in the fight to end hunger.<br><br>Learn more about Feeding America <u>here</u> .<br><br>This position is a fully remote position.<br><br><strong>The Opportunity<br><br></strong>The Salesforce Developer will be the primary technical developer and heavily involved in maintaining applications deployed within Feeding America’s donor management CRM (NGO Connect, based on Salesforce platform). This individual will coordinate specifications and deliverables with business partners plus design, assess, code, configure and troubleshoot NGOC (Salesforce). They will participate in system testing to ensure successful delivery to the business in a timely and accurate fashion. Additionally, they will participate in Salesforce development activities during our on-going system migration.<br><br><strong>Salary Range</strong><strong>: $80,000 to $100,000+ Based on Experience<br><br></strong><strong>Responsibilities:<br><br></strong><ul><li> Design, develop and maintain features and configurations within Feeding America’s Salesforce Orgs, in conjunction with internal staff and external partners, with attention to long-term organizational needs. </li><li> Participate in all aspects of Salesforce releases, including feature review and impact analysis, planning, designing, building, testing, deploying, supporting, and documenting. </li><li> Develop bug fixes and functionality for FANO’s main donor management Salesforce system (NGOC), as well as related Salesforce applications, such as Drawloop (Nintex), Rollup Helper, FormAssembly and others. </li><li> Troubleshoot issues, provide recommendations, and implement solutions and best practices in the areas of data integrity standards, data quality and overall Salesforce system usage. </li><li> Assist Salesforce administrators with the configuration and support of the Salesforce Orgs, as well as related Salesforce applications. </li><li> Develop in-code test procedures to provide adequate test coverage within Salesforce org; Collaborate </li><li> with testers and end-users during QA and UAT. </li><li> Support users regarding system functionality, enhancements, system configuration and best practices. </li><li> Assist in managing live production activity and participate in efforts to resolve production incidents. </li><li> Take positive action and accountability for assigned work. </li><li> Contribute to internal technical change management best practices in CRM applications, as needed. <br><br></li></ul> <strong>Required Experience and Qualifications:</strong><ul><li> 5+ years Salesforce Developer experience</li><ul><li> C lear understanding of declarative tools available within Salesforce – validation rules, approval processes, workflows </li><li> Well versed with Profiles, Permission Sets and Role Hierarchy </li><li> Working experience with Apex </li><li> Well versed with Visualforce (Page, Component &amp; Controllers), Apex Triggers, Batch Apex, Apex Classes, Apex Test Classes </li></ul><li> Salesforce Certified Advanced Administrator and/or Certified Developer a plus </li><li> Experience with complex Salesforce implementations and integrations </li><li> Working understanding of business tools and platforms (familiarity with NetSuite, Informatica, SharePoint, and/or Tableau a plus) </li><li> Experience working within SDLC, including Waterfall and Agile methodologies </li><li> Extensive hands-on software troubleshooting experience </li><li> Experience at working effectively both independently and in a team-oriented, collaborative environment </li><li> Preferred experience:</li><ul><li> Java, HTML, XML, CSS, Javascript </li><li> Familiarity with NGO Connect (NGOC) </li><li> Experience with online fundraising platforms (EveryAction) </li><li> Understanding of nonprofit organizations <br><br></li></ul></ul> <strong>Foundational Requirements<br><br></strong><ul><li> Mission Focused: Demonstrates a commitment to Feeding America’s mission through work and action. Is committed to people keep people facing hunger at the center of our work and strives to translate this commitment into action on a daily basis. Willing to advocate for people facing hunger and serve as an ambassador for Feeding America inside and outside of work. </li><li> Embraces Equity, Diversity and Inclusion: Demonstrates a personal commitment to valuing different background and life experiences through word and action. Takes personal actions to build an inclusive culture that ensures everyone can fully contribute based on their unique talents, skills and perspectives and feels welcomed and valued. Commits to driving equitable solutions to address root cause issues by incorporating an equity framework in their daily work. Committed to continuous personal EDI development. <br><br></li></ul> <strong>Required Leadership Competencies:<br><br></strong><ul><li> Leverages Functional Expertise : Uses advanced functional knowledge to shape decisions and plans. Takes initiative to stay current and apply knowledge of own field, including to improve processes, practices, and policies. Regularly offers to share functional expertise with others to help them succeed. </li><li> Collaborates Internally and Externally: Forms and sustains effective working relationships that accelerate goal achievement by reaching out to and engaging people from other functions or from outside the organization. Coordinates projects and plans with others within and outside of own area to ensure the work goes smoothly. Pursues networking opportunities and encourages others to form new relationships that benefit all parties. Handles conflict directly and adeptly, respecting all points of view, and resolves issues to create a united path forward. </li><li> Continuously Improves: Develops solutions that incorporate new ideas and best practices from other departments or outside the organization. Leverages continuous improvement tools and mindset when designing and implementing projects and processes. Shares and applies learning from both successful and unsuccessful ideas to inspire creative thinking. </li><li> Communicates Effectively: Conveys clear and effective messages using verbal and written communication within individual, small group, and formal presentation settings. Communicates project/operating priorities and updates to key stakeholder audiences that may include staff, network food bank members, donors, and other groups. Responds positively to requests to share information while maintaining confidentiality of sensitive content. Adjusts message and content based on feedback provided. </li><li> Manages for Results/Delegates Effectively : Holds self and others accountable for meeting measurable goals and performance expectations. Identifies multiple ways to achieve results, takes decisive action, and brings projects to completion in the timeline expected. Establishes regular status checks to maintain and report progress toward goals. Provides helpful, supportive feedback to others. Engages those closest to a situation to make decisions or recommendations. <br><br></li></ul><strong> Feeding America recognizes and values diversity. Our goal is to attract, develop, retain, and promote a talented diverse workforce where all employees feel a sense of belonging and contribute to a culture that values differences, ideas, and experiences. We intentionally seek out diverse perspectives and skills on our teams, knowing that it makes us stronger as an organization and better equipped to serve our neighbors in need. We encourage individuals from historically under-represented communities and individuals with lived experience of hunger to apply.</strong>
