title: Engineer - IT Facilities
description: We are seeking talented individuals that are motivated to kickstart their technology career. No prior professional experience required.<br><br>Revature is the largest and fastest growing employer of emerging technology talent across the U.S. Come join us! As a <strong>Revature Entry Level Software Engineer</strong> you will receive on-the-job-training to become an experienced software engineer.<br><br><strong>Remote interviews are starting now!<br><br></strong><strong><u>Benefits For Entry Level Software Engineer<br></u></strong><ul><li>Launch a software engineering career with no prior experience </li><li>Learn to code on the job. that's right: we pay you to learn. </li><li>Competitive salary </li><li>Relocation assistance</li><li>Paid time off </li><li>Industry Certifications - title: Salesforce Developer (Remote)
description: <p>Upwork has partnered with one of their enterprise client who is a global provider of Information Technology and Business Process Services and Solutions. They are expert in consulting, design, engineering, and operations helps them to provide innovative technology services, positioning them as a technology partner of choice.<br><br></p><p> <br><br></p><p>To continue with their mission, they are currently looking for a remote <strong>Coveo Developer.<br><br></strong></p><p> <br><br></p><ul><li><span>Setting up pipeline and machine learning for Coveo Search engine.<br></span></li><li><span>Create search pages Using a WYSIWYG Editor provided by Coveo.</span></li><li><span>Technically lead the UI team to ensure the error free, performant, mobile first code.</span></li><li><span>Involvement in Analysis, Estimation, Coding, Implementation, Bug fixing and troubleshooting the fixes of the existing application.</span></li><li><span>Participate in Agile Development Process and all SDLC layers.</span></li></ul><p> <br><br></p><ul><li>At least 10 years of hands-on IT experience.</li><li>Good understanding of DB structures and proficient with complex SQL queries, XML, JSON parsing</li><li>Good understanding of different mechanism of indexing like Coveo push AP.</li><li>Should work independently without supervision and deliver timely high-quality deliverables.</li><li>Should have excellent verbal and written communication skills with excellent professional attitude.</li><li>Must be amenable to work for 40 hours per week within Central business hours. </li></ul>

title: Entry Level Software Engineer
description: Description <br><br>Design, implement and operate security controls for various services in the Microsoft and Amazon cloud, with a primary focus in Azure AD. -Design and implement access control policies within Azure AD and MDM. -Analyze requirements and apply knowledge of business needs and security risks to determine appropriate course of action. -Collaborate with different areas of IT in order to provide security and business technology solutions for the Bank. -Development of security policy, standard, procedure and design documents. -Design, engineer, and deploy technologies for application integrations for using SAML, Open ID, or OAuth -Act as a point of escalation for issues relating to security controls or tools, including (but not limited to) SSO, MFA, certificates. -Design, implement and operate security controls for various services in Office 365, with an emphasis on Azure AD identity -Understanding of OAuth and assist with the interface with Azure API’s -Occasionally provide support off-hours when business critical problems arise. Software Requirements - Active Directory (On-Prem) - Azure Active Directory -Azure AD Conditional Access -Windows Servers (2016 and newer) -Azure AD Seamless SSO Preferred: - CyberArk (Preferred) - Azure B2C (preferred) - Azure Application Proxy (preferred) Additional Responsibilities: o Scripting/automation experience such as Python, PowerShell and API integrations o Contribute to design and execute delivery for technologies that improve overall security posture or technology service delivery within the organization. o Analyze requirements and apply knowledge of business needs and security risks to determine appropriate course of action. o Develop security standards and procedures to ensure appropriate controls throughout the technology environment. o Collaborate with different areas of IT in order to provide security and business technology solutions for the bank.<br><br> Skills <br><br>Azure AD, Authorization, Conditional Access, SSO<br><br> Top Skills Details <br><br>Azure AD,Authorization,Conditional Access,SSO<br><br> Additional Skills &amp; Qualifications <br><br>Ability to work with a team Able to go onsite two days a week<br><br> Experience Level <br><br>Expert Level<br><br> About TEKsystems <br><br>We're partners in transformation. We help clients activate ideas and solutions to take advantage of a new world of opportunity. We are a team of 80,000 strong, working with over 6,000 clients, including 80% of the Fortune 500, across North America, Europe and Asia. As an industry leader in Full-Stack Technology Services, Talent Services, and real-world application, we work with progressive leaders to drive change. That's the power of true partnership. TEKsystems is an Allegis Group company.<br><br>The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

title: Remote Coveo Developer
description: Cerebra Consulting Inc is a System Integrator and IT Services Solution provider with a focus on Big Data, Business Analytics, Cloud Solutions, Amazon Web Services, Salesforce, Oracle EBS, Peoplesoft, Hyperion, Oracle Configurator, Oracle CPQ, Oracle PLM and Custom Application Development. Utilizing solid business experience, industry-specific expertise, and proven methodologies, we consistently deliver measurable results for our customers. Cerebra has partnered with leading enterprise software companies and cloud providers such as Oracle, Salesforce, Amazon and able to leverage these partner relationships to deliver high-quality, end-to-end customer solutions that are targeted to the needs of each customer.<br><br>Hello<br><br>Hope you are doing good. We are currently working on the following job requirement<br><ul><li>Net Web Developer - (W2) <br></li></ul><strong>Onsite East Chicago , IN <br><br></strong>Support existing Commercial &amp; Planning Applications, including SOI, EOR, Queue, Legacy Order Entry. These applications are business critical as they are all related to Order Fulfillment. THIS POSITION IS REQUIRED TO BE ONSITE<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br><br></u></strong>Develop, support, modify, test &amp; implement various web and windows project and change requests. Individual needs to be an expert in the technology in order to complete the programming work quickly and cost effectively. Experience in the entire SDLC will be required as they will be working directly with business departments for requirements gathering and will create their own functional and technical specs and then continue on to the development, testing, implementation, and support. Daily activities will include being assigned maintenance change requests, working with the business areas to further refine the specifications for the request, creation of functional &amp; technical specs, testing (unit and business approval), implementing, and supporting the changes. There is a possibility to do new development/project work as well. They will design and implement a Microsoft Dev Ops solution in the web and windows area.<br><br><strong><u>Minimum Requirements<br></u></strong><ul><li>Extensive experience in the Microsoft Development stack: ASP.net, ASP.net Core, ASP.net Core Identity Security, MVC, SQL, C#, Bootstrap, Entity Framework, LINQ, JQuery, MS Visual Studio, JS, AJAX, TFS. </li><li>Excellent SQL Server skills including experience with SQL Server 2012, 2016 and 2019. </li><li>Deep understanding of T-SQL, complex Joins, Stored Procedures, and Triggers. </li><li>Deep understanding of the fundamental technologies of the web: HTTP, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and JSON. </li><li>Understanding of common Object-Oriented programing concepts. </li><li>Experience and understanding of the full SDLC including gathering business requirements, designing solutions, and working with stakeholders to test and implement the solutions you build. </li><li>Experience working on large enterprise applications. </li><li>Ability to work independently </li><li>Participation in at least two enterprise development projects </li><li>Office 365 Microsoft tools </li><li>Strong verbal and written communication skills </li><li>Experience designing and implementing Dev Ops in a production environment (at least 1 significant project). <br></li></ul><strong><u>Preferred Requirements<br></u></strong><ul><li>SSAS, Bootstrap, Classic ASP, VB6 </li><li>Two years or more project lead experience or direct business contact. </li><li>Experience with SQL Server Reporting Services, SQL Server Integration Services and Microsoft Power BI. </li><li>Microsoft Certified Professional with 8+ years of web/windows development experience </li><li>Manufacturing or Steel experience </li><li>Understanding of SAP S/4 HANA (1709 or higher) <br></li></ul><strong><u>Education Requirements<br></u></strong><ul><li>Relevant 4 year degree or equivalent experience <br></li></ul><strong><u>Required Skills<br><br></u></strong>MVC,ASP.NET,VB.NET,SDLC,C#,SQL<br><br>Thanks,<br><br>satish pochampally<br><br>US IT Recruiter<br><br>Ph: 18148312402 (Ext :- 165)<br><br>Cerebra Consulting Inc, 270 Lancaster Ave, Suite-D2, Malvern, PA 19355<br><br>Email - satish.pochapally@cerebra-consulting.com<br><br>Website| www.cerebra-consulting.com<br><br>PARTNERS| Oracle | Amazon | Salesforce | Hortonworks | Cloudera | MapR<br><br>AWARDS| Philadelphia 100 | INC5000 | CIO Top 10 Oracle Providers 2018

title: Azure AD Security Engineer
description: At Iron Galaxy Studios, our teams support a healthy work-life balance, promote continuous improvement, and champion a diverse people-focused culture. We encourage Engineers from every heritage, lifestyle, or background to apply.<br><br>This is a full-time hybrid position in Orlando (FL), Chicago (IL), Nashville (TN), or Austin (TX) with relocation options for out-of-state applicants.<br><br>Iron Galaxy Studios is seeking Rendering Engineers to join our world-class engineering team. Engineers at Iron Galaxy have contributed in many ways to our diverse portfolio of high-profile projects. This has included leading the development of new rendering features on Microsoft’s Killer Instinct, optimizing ambitious ports to the Nintendo Switch with Diablo 3 and Skyrim, tackling the challenges of virtual reality with Skyrim VR, and collaborating with our team of talented artists to develop great-looking content across all our internal projects.<br><br>We need a new teammate who can help us continue to develop cutting-edge graphics features, techniques, and effects on both internal and external projects. Responsibilities vary based on the project, and we will also aim to place you on projects that play to your strengths while also giving you room to grow. Here are some examples of what an Engineer might be expected to do.<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li>Develop cutting edge rendering features and special effects to support the needs of our internal projects and external clients</li><li>Support our art and design departments with the best technology available to help them realize their visions</li><li>Analyze performance and implement optimizations at both a high and low level.</li><li>Work with our multi-disciplinary development team to help set the direction of rendering technology at Iron Galaxy<br></li></ul><strong><u>Desired Skills<br></u></strong><ul><li>Comfortable navigating and modifying very large C++ game engines</li><li>Stays up to date with developing trends and novel techniques in real-time rendering</li><li>Understands modern hardware rendering pipelines</li><li>Has reasonable math skills, as required to reason about modern 3D graphics techniques</li><li>Is able to adapt to multiple rendering engines and graphics hardware</li><li>Is a dependable teammate who is able to communicate with all development disciplines<br></li></ul><strong><u>Bonus Skills<br></u></strong><ul><li>Deep knowledge of at least one low-level shading language and graphics API</li><li>Proficiency using at least one high-quality graphics debugger (e.g., RenderDoc, PIX)</li><li>Meaningful experience working on modern console hardware</li><li>Experience with a current commercial-scale game engine<br></li></ul>ABOUT US: Iron Galaxy is one of the world’s largest independent video game developers with 60+ shipped titles. Our people combine their talents to create amazing ports, epic remasters, and new experiences from the ground up. We partner with the top companies in the gaming industry to co-develop and support AAA game creation at the highest level. See why we have been certified by Great Place to Work (https://www.greatplacetowork.com/certified-company/7027205) and GamesIndustry.biz (https://www.gamesindustry.biz/articles/2021-07-22-best-places-to-work-awards-winner-iron-galaxy) .<br><br>Iron Galaxy Studios is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We believe that a diverse workforce and an inclusive work environment are essential to making quality games. Our teams actively support equal access to career opportunities for all people regardless of age, race, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, veteran status, national origin, and any other characteristic protected by applicable law.<br><br>We prohibit retaliation against individuals who present discrimination complaints to Iron Galaxy management or relevant government agencies. We strongly encourage women, people of color, individuals with disabilities, and veterans to apply.<br><br>Powered by JazzHR

title: Immediate interview for .Net Web Developer - Onsite – East Chicago , IN
description: <strong>What We're Building And Why We're Building It.<br><br></strong>There's a reason Fetch is ranked top 10 in Shopping in the App Store. Every day, millions of people earn Fetch Points buying brands they love. From the grocery aisle to the drive-through, Fetch makes saving money fun. We're more than just a build-first tech unicorn. We're a revolutionary shopping platform where brands and consumers come together for a loyalty-driving, points-exploding, money-saving party.<br><br>Join a fast-growing, founder-led technology company that's still only in its early innings. Ranked one of America's Best Startup Employers by Forbes two years in a row, Fetch is building a people-first culture rooted in trust and accountability. How do we do it? By empowering employees to think big, challenge ideas, and find new ways to bring the fun to Fetch. So what are you waiting for? Apply to join our rocketship today!<br><br><em>Fetch is an equal employment opportunity employer.<br><br></em><strong>The Role:<br><br></strong>Fetch's next step in evolving the shopping experience will require a <strong>Backend Engineer</strong>. You will build highly performant backend services to integrate seamlessly with our data stores, message queues, mobile and web platforms, and other systems. You'll be working on a small, multi-functional team that may include other engineers, a designer, product manager, data scientist and other roles. Success in this role requires the ability to take on challenging problems and design &amp; develop an amazing solution with little to no assistance.<br><br><strong>Scope of Responsibilities:<br></strong><ul><li>A deep understanding of functional and object-oriented programming</li><li>Ability to plan and implement complex data models</li><li>Ability to optimize poorly performing code, data queries, and network requests</li><li>Understanding of the complexity and failure domains of micro-services and distributed architectures</li><li>Ability to troubleshoot large scale production systems and explain both short and long-term solutions with trade-offs</li><li>Effective communication, including the ability to translate and explain technical issues to non-technical team members<br><br></li></ul><strong>The ideal candidate</strong>:<br><ul><li>High-level languages (Go)</li><li>Relational and eventually consistent databases (MongoDB, Postgres, MySQL)</li><li>In-memory data stores and caches (Redis, Memcache)</li><li>Version control system (Git)</li><li>Test writing and quality assurance</li><li>Service-oriented architecture</li><li>Full-stack development (Kotlin, Javascript, React, Swift)</li><li>Messages queue and event streaming (Kafka, Kinesis, Redis Streams)</li><li>Continuous development</li><li>Undergraduate or graduate degree in computer science, engineering or mathematics<br><br></li></ul><strong>At Fetch, we'll give you the tools to feel healthy, happy and secure through:<br></strong><ul><li>Stock Options for everyone</li><li>401k Match: Dollar-for-dollar match up to 4%. </li><li>Benefits for humans and pets: We offer comprehensive medical, dental and vision plans for everyone including your pets. </li><li>Continuing Education: Fetch provides Ten Thousand per year in education reimbursement. </li><li>Employee Resource Groups: Take part in employee-led groups that are centered around fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace through events, dialogue and advocacy. The ERGs participate in our Inclusion Council with members of executive leadership. </li><li>Paid Time Off: On top of our flexible PTO, Fetch observes 9 paid holidays, including Juneteenth and Indigenous People's Day, as well as our year-end week-long break. </li><li>Robust Leave Policies: 18 weeks of paid parental leave for primary caregivers, 12 weeks for secondary caregivers, and a flexible return to work schedule. </li><li>Hybrid Work Environment: Collaborate with your team in one of our stunning offices in Madison, Birmingham, or Chicago. We'll ensure you are equally equipped with the hardware and software you need to get your job done in the comfort of your home.</li></ul>

title: Rendering Engineer
description: <strong>Address: </strong>USA-IL-Chicago-300 South Riverside Plaza<br><br><strong>Store Code: </strong>Infrastructure-Network (5118718)<br><br>Retail Business Services, ranked No. 25 on Fast Company’s 2022 100 Best Workplaces for Innovators, is the services company of leading grocery retail group Ahold Delhaize USA, which includes Food Lion, Giant Food, The GIANT Company, Hannaford and Stop &amp; Shop.<br><br><strong>Primary Purpose:<br><br></strong>A Platform Engineer will provide expertise and leadership in the design, configuration, and management of all corporate, distribution center and retail digital media devices and associated supporting services. They are expected to work in a fast-paced and challenging environment leveraging forward-thinking technical engineering expertise in the media device and services area of the enterprise.<br><br><strong>Duties and Responsibilities:<br></strong><ul><li> Provide subject matter expertise in the analysis, design and preparation of technology solutions to meet business needs</li><li> Recommends components for solutions that will work well together across business domains, partner with domain architect or act as the domain architect to ensure adherence to the architectural roadmap</li><li> Accountable for projects/applications/infrastructure meeting business needs are delivered in a timely, cost-effective manner considering all budget aspects including total cost of ownership.</li><li> Ensures project artifacts are developed as required, this includes working with support organizations and suppliers to ensure proper documentation is created and stored in the procedure’s manual or document repository.</li><li> Facilitates/completes the creation of communication plans, ensuring that appropriate information is exchanged among key stakeholders.</li><li> Develops complete and robust test plans, cases, and scripts, ensures defects are properly resolved and user acceptance is obtained. Ensures the test scripts and defects are entered and tracked in our department tools.</li><li> Acts as communication point keeping the supplier and business partners informed of infrastructure changes, application changes, data changes or upcoming implementations and ensures business specific impacts are addressed.</li><li> Ensures integration and consideration of assigned business areas against critical business processing, freeze periods, schedule changes, weather events and significant refresh activities.</li><li> Thorough understanding of the business strategy, operations, markets, and key stakeholders.</li><li> Review’s business processes to understand capability gaps and opportunities</li><li> Recommends Innovations and business processes /systems simplifications</li><li> Builds close relationships with the function heads and their teams. Advise these teams on how technology can be used to match or outpace competitor performance.</li><li> Works as 3rd level support to help resolve issues within area of responsibility</li><li> Maintains a high level of individual contribution, professional growth, and ability to function effectively and independently, challenges others to do the same<br><br></li></ul><strong>Qualifications: <br></strong><ul><li> Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or Technical field and master's degree in Technology and/or Business-related field</li><li> equivalent trainings/certifications/experience equivalency will be considered</li><li> 5 or more years of equivalent experience in relevant job or field of technology.</li><li> 2 or more years of equivalent experience in an advanced role or technical capacity, leading teams directly or indirectly.</li><li> 2 or more years' experience directly responsible for guiding, training or onboarding team members in relevant technologies, capabilities or skills<br><br></li></ul><strong>Preferred Qualifications:<br></strong><ul><li> Post graduate degree advanced training and or certifications in relevant field/s of study preferred.</li><li> 3 or more years experience in Agile teams and Product/Platform based operating model.</li><li> 3 or more years of experience in leading teams or advancing technical capability in teams.</li><li> Experience in retail or grocery preferred.<br><br></li></ul>#DICEJobs<br><br>Retail Business Services currently provides services to five omnichannel grocery brands, including Food Lion, Giant Food, The GIANT Company, Hannaford and Stop &amp; Shop. Retail Business Services leverages the scale of the local brands to drive synergies and provide industry-leading expertise, insights and analytics to local brands to support their strategies. We are committed to diversity, equity and inclusion and we foster a community of belonging where everyone is valued.<br><br>Retail Business Services is an equal opportunity employer. We comply with all applicable federal, state and local laws. Qualified applicants are considered without regard to sex, race, color, ancestry, national origin, citizenship status, religion, age, marital status (including civil unions), military service, veteran status, pregnancy (including childbirth and related medical conditions), genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, legally recognized disability, domestic violence victim status or any other characteristic protected by law. We provide reasonable accommodations to applicants and employees with disabilities. As important as what we do is how we do it. Our team embodies our values of Courage, Care, Teamwork, Integrity and Humor in everything that they do. We have a culture of care that values and celebrates the qualities and perspectives that make us all unique.<br><br>If you have a disability and require assistance in the application process, please contact our Talent Acquisition Department at tad@retailbusinessservices.com.<br><br>For more information, visit https://www.retailbusinessservices.com.<br><br>Job Requisition: 313850_external_USA-IL-Chicago_5242023<br><br>

They are expected to work in a fast-paced and challenging environment leveraging forward-thinking technical engineering expertise in the media device and services area of the enterprise.<br><br><strong>Duties and Responsibilities; <br></strong><ul><li> Provide subject matter expertise in the analysis, design and preparation of technology solutions to meet business needs</li><li> Recommends components for solutions that will work well together across business domains, partner with domain architect or act as the domain architect to ensure adherence to the architectural roadmap</li><li> Accountable for projects/applications/infrastructure meeting business needs are delivered in a timely, cost-effective manner considering all budget aspects including total cost of ownership.</li><li> Ensures project artifacts are developed as required, this includes working with support organizations and suppliers to ensure proper documentation is created and stored in the procedure’s manual or document repository.</li><li> Facilitates/completes the creation of communication plans, ensuring that appropriate information is exchanged among key stakeholders.</li><li> Develops complete and robust test plans, cases, and scripts, ensures defects are properly resolved and user acceptance is obtained. Ensures the test scripts and defects are entered and tracked in our department tools.</li><li> Acts as communication point keeping the supplier and business partners informed of infrastructure changes, application changes, data changes or upcoming implementations and ensures business specific impacts are addressed.</li><li> Ensures integration and consideration of assigned business areas against critical business processing, freeze periods, schedule changes, weather events and significant refresh activities.</li><li> Thorough understanding of the business strategy, operations, markets, and key stakeholders.</li><li> Review business processes to understand the capability gaps and opportunities</li><li> Recommends Innovations and business processes /systems simplifications</li><li> Builds close relationships with the function heads and their teams. Advise these teams on how technology can be used to match or outpace competitor performance.</li><li> Works as 3rd level support to help resolve issues within area of responsibility</li><li> Maintains a high level of individual contribution, professional growth, and ability to function effectively and independently, challenges others to do the same.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Qualifications: <br></strong><ul><li> Master's Degree in Computer Science or Technical field.</li><li> Equivalent training/certifications/experience equivalency will be considered.</li><li> 5 or more years of equivalent experience in relevant job or field of technology.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Preferred Qualifications: <br></strong><ul><li> Post graduate degree advanced training and or certifications in relevant field/s of study preferred.</li><li> Experience in retail or grocery preferred.<br><br></li></ul>#DICEJobs<br><br>Retail Business Services currently provides services to five omnichannel grocery brands, including Food Lion, Giant Food, The GIANT Company, Hannaford and Stop &amp; Shop. Retail Business Services leverages the scale of the local brands to drive synergies and provide industry-leading expertise, insights and analytics to local brands to support their strategies. We are committed to diversity, equity and inclusion and we foster a community of belonging where everyone is valued.<br><br>Retail Business Services is an equal opportunity employer. We comply with all applicable federal, state and local laws. Qualified applicants are considered without regard to sex, race, color, ancestry, national origin, citizenship status, religion, age, marital status (including civil unions), military service, veteran status, pregnancy (including childbirth and related medical conditions), genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, legally recognized disability, domestic violence victim status or any other characteristic protected by law. We provide reasonable accommodations to applicants and employees with disabilities. As important as what we do is how we do it. Our team embodies our values of Courage, Care, Teamwork, Integrity and Humor in everything that they do. We have a culture of care that values and celebrates the qualities and perspectives that make us all unique.<br><br>If you have a disability and require assistance in the application process, please contact our Talent Acquisition Department at tad@retailbusinessservices.com.<br><br>For more information, visit https://www.retailbusinessservices.com.<br><br>Job Requisition: 307895_external_USA-IL-Chicago_5242023<br><br>

that address clients' most complex digital transformation needs.<p><br></p>We leverage our holistic portfolio of capabilities in consulting, design, engineering, operations, and emerging technologies to help clients realize their boldest ambitions and build future-ready, sustainable businesses.<p><br></p>A company recognized globally for its comprehensive portfolio of services, strong commitment to sustainability and good corporate citizenship, we have over 250,000 dedicated employees serving clients across 66 countries.<p><br></p>We deliver on the promise of helping our customers, title: IT Engineer Platform
description: <strong>Are you looking for limit-less career opportunities? Do you have a growth mindset, and like to take initiative?</strong> If yes, then Ntiva is the right place for you! At Ntiva, we have a saying – “We exist to grow each other.” Our focus is helping each other, our clients and our families grow both personally and professionally. Sound like something you could get in to? Because as one of the fastest-growing Managed Services Companies in the country, we’re looking to fuel our team with powerhouse talent. With strategic locations across the U.S., and still led by our original founder Steven Freidkin, we specialize in in helping organizations solve their complex IT challenges no matter where they are located. Definitely a fast-paced environment where we collectively battle escalating cyber attacks and stay on top of fast changing technologies! Come explore one of our many opportunities!<p><br></p><strong>How you will make an impact</strong>As the Systems Engineer (SE) you will be working with other highly skilled Engineers and customers throughout the Chicagoland area setting up networks, cloud environments, servers, and switches. This is performed at our office or at client sites making sure they have the right solution to run their business!<p><br></p><strong>Summary of Location and Hours</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Hybrid Position – 50% remote / 50% client visits within the Chicagoland area</li><li>Monday-Friday approximately 8am-5pm, afterhours work required as needed, some on call work may be necessary</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What You’ll Be Doing</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Design, implementation, and support for:</li><li>Network Switching including but not limited to trunking, VLAN’s, Spanning Tree Protocol, stacking, fiber interconnects, Subnetting</li><li>Understanding and configuration of Cisco Meraki, Aruba, and Watchguard devices, including troubleshooting utilizing the dashboard to analyze what is happening and troubleshoot accurately</li><li>Understand, support and implement virtualization technologies: VMware and Microsoft Hyperv.</li><li>Understand, support and Implement Microsoft server technologies and correlated service technologies, SMTP, IIS, File and storage, DHCP, DNS, AD.</li><li>Standard security technologies such as multi-factor authentication, endpoint encryption, spam filtering, DNS filtering.</li><li>Customer premise and cloud solutions especially Azure, Nerdio, WVD, and AWS, using technologies that meet customer requirements respectively</li><li>Ability to improve customer service, value, and satisfaction Clearly communicate problem/resolution process to customers or management</li><li>Advanced Troubleshooting and Systems Recovery</li><li>Regular time tracking and billable hour allocation</li><li>Additional travel up to 5% </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>You’ll be successful in this role if you have experience in/with</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>At least 3 to 5 years of experience that is directly related to the duties and responsibilities specified</li><li>Ability to create and document technical information to both technical and non-technical personnel</li><li>This position requires a high level of independence and strong client service skills. Organizational ability is important to keep track of all tasks, because the job requires a great deal of multi-tasking. We also require accurate and timely tracking of client work, service calls, and related documentation including timesheets and expense reporting.</li><li>Ability to travel to client premises as needed </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Bonus Points for</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related discipline</li><li>Certifications including: CCNP, CCNA, CompTIA N+, Meraki CCMP, VMware VCP, Security +, MCSA, CWNA, Azure Administrator, Azure Solutions Architect, CCA, ITIL Foundation</li><li>Experience with ConnectWise, SCCM, LabTech or similar service management system</li><li>Subject matter expert for specific technologies (e.g. Microsoft, VMware, Citrix, Cisco/Meraki, Datto etc.) </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Physical Requirements / Working Conditions</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Must be able to lift up to 75 pounds rarely</li><li>Must be able to perform occasional bending, kneeling, squatting, and turning.</li><li>Must be able to perform occasional reaching over shoulder height, waist level and from floor.</li><li>Must be able to work in a fast-paced environment.</li><li>Must be able to work in an unsupervised environment.</li><li>Must be able to drive / sit for extended periods of time.</li><li>Fast Paced Environment with competing priorities</li><li>Must have a valid driver’s license in the state you reside and access to an insured vehicle for travel to client sites / office.</li><li>Ability to work in an office environment while sitting at a desk for extended periods of time. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Benefits And Perks</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Medical, Dental and Vision coverage for employee and family</li><li>401k + company matched contributions 4% match on 5% contribution – Employee and Company contribute after 90 days – no vesting period!)</li><li>Group Term Life and Accidental Death and Dismemberment coverage (company provided)</li><li>Short-Term (voluntary enrollment) and Long-Term Disability coverage (company provided)</li><li>Health Savings Account (HSA) Options / PPO Options</li><li>Paid Personal Time Off (PTO) + 2 Floating Holidays</li><li>Bonus plans</li><li>Tuition Reimbursement Program</li><li>Employee Assistance Program</li><li>Generous Employee Referral Program – the more you refer the more you earn!</li><li>Dynamic Recognition and Rewards</li><li>Work with Industry-Leading Talent</li><li>Clear Promotion and Advancement Tracks </li></ul><p><br></p>At Ntiva, we are committed to creating and maintaining a diverse, inclusive, and welcoming work environment for all employees and job applicants. We firmly believe that a diverse workforce fosters a wider range of perspectives, experiences, and ideas that lead to increased creativity, innovation, and problem-solving capabilities. As an equal opportunity employer, we actively seek to recruit and retain a diverse workforce that reflects the communities we serve. We prohibit discrimination of any kind, including but not limited to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and comply with all applicable laws governing nondiscrimination in employment.

title: Developer
description: <p><strong>Job Description: Computer Vision Engineer</strong></p><p>Location: River North, Chicago. Onsite three days a week: Monday, Tuesday, and Thursday. Remote Wednesday and Friday.</p><p><br></p><p><strong>Company Overview:</strong></p><p>Gridlines is an early-stage venture-backed startup focused on improving productivity for financial analysts by utilizing computer vision across a wide number of tasks. We are seeking a talented and versatile Computer Vision Engineer with a strong software engineering background to join our team and lead ongoing projects. We are at an exciting inflection point, and you will work directly with our Founder. This is a unique chance to be part of a dynamic startup, where your contributions will have a significant impact.</p><p><br></p><p><strong>Responsibilities:</strong></p><p>As an early-stage startup, you will have the opportunity to contribute to various aspects of our projects. Your primary focus will be on computer vision, but you will also be involved in other tasks as necessary. Responsibilities include:</p><p><br></p><p><strong>Computer Vision:</strong></p><ul><li>Develop and implement computer vision algorithms and models for various applications, including object recognition, image segmentation, and classification. </li><li>Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in computer vision technologies, including techniques like transformers, and propose innovative approaches to enhance our systems.</li><li>Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including software engineers, to integrate computer vision solutions into larger projects and products</li></ul><p><br></p><p><strong>Data Management:</strong></p><ul><li>Work on ways to optimize the entire data collection process</li><li>Work on methods to improve data quality</li><li>Transfer existing data handling code onto a virtual machine (VM) on Google Cloud Platform (GCP) to ensure continuous and efficient data processing.</li></ul><p><br></p><p><strong>Software engineering:</strong></p><ul><li>Working on touch ups to get the computer vision models to behave well on real world images</li><li>Contribute to the overall software architecture and infrastructure, implementing best practices for scalability, maintainability, and code quality.</li></ul><p><br></p><p><strong>Collaboration and Communication:</strong></p><ul><li>Work closely with team members to understand project requirements, provide technical expertise, and deliver high-quality solutions.</li><li>Participate in regular team meetings and contribute to brainstorming sessions, sharing ideas, and offering constructive feedback.</li><li>Prepare and present reports, findings, and progress updates to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.</li></ul><p><br></p><p><strong>Qualifications:</strong></p><ul><li>Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.</li><li>Solid understanding of computer vision principles, techniques, and algorithms.</li><li>Proficiency in Python.</li><li>Experience with popular computer vision libraries and frameworks, such as OpenCV, TensorFlow, or PyTorch.</li><li>Strong knowledge of data management and preprocessing techniques.</li><li>Familiarity with cloud computing platforms, preferably Google Cloud Platform (GCP), and experience deploying applications on virtual machines (VMs).</li><li>Demonstrated experience in developing and implementing computer vision models and algorithms.</li><li>Proven track record of successfully delivering computer vision projects from conception to deployment.</li><li>Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to think creatively to overcome technical challenges.</li><li>Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to effectively convey complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.</li></ul><p><br></p><p>If you are passionate about computer vision, we would love to hear from you. To apply, please submit your resume, along with a brief cover letter highlighting your relevant experience and why you are interested in joining our team.</p><p><br></p>

title: Systems Engineer
description: Why will you enjoy this new opportunity?<p><br></p>Here at VMware, the Telco Cloud foundation development team is looking for a UI developer to join their distributed team.<p><br></p>This team builds User Interfaces for Telco Cloud products, including Uhana by VMware and the pioneering VMware RAN Intelligent Controller (RIC), which help our customers manage hundreds of thousands of devices and millions of subscribers. Scale and performance are central to everything we do; we use the latest tools and technologies, blending the best of Open Source with home-grown development to build powerful, easy-to-use, robust, and scalable telco-grade software.<p><br></p>The UI development team works closely with the backend and API teams, and with VMware’s world-class User Experience (UX) group, to build clean, modern, and usable user interfaces using the industry-leading VMware Clarity framework.<p><br></p>This position for an early career UI developer in the Telco Cloud foundation development team.<p><br></p>Success in the Role: What are the performance outcomes over the first 6-12 months you will work toward completing?<ul><li>Short-term (1-3 months)</li><ul><li>Establish development and test environments</li><li>Understand and be able to build and deploy the Uhana and RIC products</li><li>Be familiar with tools (JIRA, Confluence, Slack) and development processes, including those for design, coding and testing</li><li>Identify key personnel in the team and know who to go to when you have questions</li><li>Have committed code to resolve a few defects or small features, with guidance from senior team members</li></ul><li>Medium-term (3-6 months)</li><ul><li>Participate in a complete product release cycle</li><li>Help to complete a small project under guidance of a senior team member, including design review and assessment, coding, testing, and delivery</li><li>Actively participate in release and sprint planning activities</li><li>Identify areas of potential specialization</li></ul><li>Long-term (6-12 months)</li><ul><li>Become highly knowledgeable in a specific area of the UI</li><li>Have resolved moderately complex problems</li><li>Help complete a large project, under guidance of senior development staff, including participating in requirements analysis and estimation, through coding, testing, and delivery</li><li>Have established working relationships with senior development staff</li></ul></ul><p><br></p>The Work: What type of work will you be doing? What assignments, requirements, or skills will you be performing on a regular basis?<p><br></p>Key responsibilities include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Assisting senior development staff in requirements analysis, and preparing functional specifications and designs</li><li>Participating in project planning and scoping, and preparing estimates for new features</li><li>Implementing new features in a carrier-grade, scalable software platform, and maintaining existing features and functionality</li><li>Implementing and maintaining test automation suites</li><li>Collaborating with system architects, management, and peers to help drive projects to completion</li><li>Preparing documentation and training materials</li></ul><p><br></p>Skills, qualifications, and experience required:<p><br></p><ul><li>Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related discipline; advanced degree preferred</li><li>2+ years UI development experience</li><li>Highly proficient in TypeScript and JavaScript</li><li>Experience with React; experience with Angular would also be an asset</li><li>Proficient with shell scripting and at least one scripting language such as Python or Groovy</li><li>Experience working with RESTful APIs, and authentication technologies such as JWT, SAML and OAuth preferred</li><li>Basic familiarity with micro-service architectures, Docker, Kubernetes, and one or more public cloud platforms such as AWS or Microsoft Azure</li><li>Comfortable with fast-paced development and rapidly evolving requirements</li><li>Very strong problem solving and debugging skills</li><li>Excellent communication and presentation skills</li><li>Comfortable working with a highly distributed, fully remote team</li><li>Experience with VMware Clarity and Cypress test automation frameworks would be assets</li></ul><p><br></p>What is the leadership like for this role? What is the structure and culture of the team like?<p><br></p>The hiring manager for this role is a Director R&amp;D, leading the Telco Cloud foundation development team from Toronto, Ontario, Canada. This position will report to him. Day-to-day activities for this role will be directed by the UI team lead, who is based in Palo Alto, California.<p><br></p>The Telco Cloud foundation team is primarily located in the United States (65%), with smaller contingents in India (15%), Canada (15%), and the United Kingdom (5%), and embraces a diversity of backgrounds, skills, and experiences. We make heavy use of modern communication tools to stay connected and collaborate, and follow a 'remote first' mindset, where being in the office is the exception rather than the norm.<p><br></p>The team culture is informal and results-oriented; we expect developers to be accountable for their commitments, processes to serve purposes, managers to act as catalysts for high performance, and embrace forthright discussion before committing to a decision. Work-life balance is critical to our success, and we strive to make choices, use technology and processes, and share the load to make balance a reality.<p><br></p>Where is this role located?<p><br></p>Remote: This role is flexible and can work from our Palo Alto office or be fully remote, allowing you the flexibility to work from the location you feel most productive and comfortable. You will be expected to live within 0-4 time zones of the Palo Alto office. Since you will primarily be interacting with staff in the Pacific Time zone, you will be expected to be available to attend meetings as needed during regular Pacific Time working hours (9 am to 5 pm Pacific Time).<p><br></p>What are the benefits and perks of working at VMware?<p><br></p>You and your loved ones will be supported with a competitive and comprehensive benefits package. Below are some highlights, or you can view the complete benefits package by visiting www.benefits.vmware.com.<p><br></p><ul><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li><li>Medical Coverage, Retirement, and Parental Leave Plans for All Family Types</li><li>Generous Time Off Programs</li><li>40 hours of paid time to volunteer in your community</li><li>Rethink's Neurodiversity program to support parents raising children with learning or behavior challenges, or developmental disabilities</li><li>Financial contributions to your ongoing development (conference participation, trainings, course work, etc.)</li><li>Wellness reimbursement and online fitness and wellbeing classes</li></ul><p><br></p>For US based candidates, the annual pay range (OTE for commissioned roles; Salary for other roles) for this position is: $84,000 - $190,000. The actual offer will be based on the role, location, and individual candidate experience. Bonus, commission, and/or equity may be eligible for this position. VMware offers comprehensive benefits including, but not limited to: medical, dental, and vision plans, company paid holidays, paid sick leave, and vacation time. Additional benefits for this position can be found at https://benefits.vmware.com/. Your talent advisor can share more about the specific salary range for your preferred location during the hiring process.<p><br></p>This job may require the candidate to travel and/or work from a facility that requires full vaccination prior to entry.<p><br></p><strong>Category : </strong>Engineering and Technology<p><br></p><strong>Subcategory: </strong>Software Engineering<p><br></p><strong>Experience: </strong>Manager and Professional<p><br></p><strong>Full Time/ Part Time: </strong>Full Time<p><br></p><strong>Posted Date:</strong> 2023-05-23<p><br></p>VMware Company Overview: At VMware, we believe that software has the power to unlock new opportunities for people and our planet. We look beyond the barriers of compromise to engineer new ways to make technologies work together seamlessly. Our cloud, mobility, and security software form a flexible, consistent digital foundation for securely delivering the apps, services and experiences that are transforming business innovation around the globe. At the core of what we do are our people who deeply value execution, passion, integrity, customers, and community. Shape what’s possible today at http://careers.vmware.com.<p><br></p>Equal Employment Opportunity Statement: VMware is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind: VMware is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at VMware are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. VMware will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. VMware encourages applicants of all ages. Vmware will provide reasonable accommodation to employees who have protected disabilities consistent with local law.
description_json: Why will you enjoy this new opportunity?<p><br></p>Here at VMware, the Telco Cloud foundation development team is looking for a UI developer to join their distributed team.<p><br></p>This team builds User Interfaces for Telco Cloud products, including Uhana by VMware and the pioneering VMware RAN Intelligent Controller (RIC), which help our customers manage hundreds of thousands of devices and millions of subscribers. Scale and performance are central to everything we do; we use the latest tools and technologies, blending the best of Open Source with home-grown development to build powerful, easy-to-use, robust, and scalable telco-grade software.<p><br></p>The UI development team works closely with the backend and API teams, and with VMware’s world-class User Experience (UX) group, to build clean, modern, and usable user interfaces using the industry-leading VMware Clarity framework.<p><br></p>This position for an early career UI developer in the Telco Cloud foundation development team.<p><br></p>Success in the Role: What are the performance outcomes over the first 6-12 months you will work toward completing?<ul><li>Short-term (1-3 months)</li><ul><li>Establish development and test environments</li><li>Understand and be able to build and deploy the Uhana and RIC products</li><li>Be familiar with tools (JIRA, Confluence, Slack) and development processes, including those for design, coding and testing</li><li>Identify key personnel in the team and know who to go to when you have questions</li><li>Have committed code to resolve a few defects or small features, with guidance from senior team members</li></ul><li>Medium-term (3-6 months)</li><ul><li>Participate in a complete product release cycle</li><li>Help to complete a small project under guidance of a senior team member, including design review and assessment, coding, testing, and delivery</li><li>Actively participate in release and sprint planning activities</li><li>Identify areas of potential specialization</li></ul><li>Long-term (6-12 months)</li><ul><li>Become highly knowledgeable in a specific area of the UI</li><li>Have resolved moderately complex problems</li><li>Help complete a large project, under guidance of senior development staff, including participating in requirements analysis and estimation, through coding, testing, and delivery</li><li>Have established working relationships with senior development staff</li></ul></ul><p><br></p>The Work: What type of work will you be doing? title: Computer Vision Engineer (must be based in Chicago)
description: <strong>ABOUT US</strong>:<br><br>Braintrust is a user-owned talent network that connects you with great jobs with no fees or membership costs—so you keep 100% of what you earn.<br><br><strong>ABOUT THE HIRING PROCESS:<br><br></strong>When you join Braintrust, you will be invited to a screening process for Braintrust to learn more about your previous work experiences. Once completed, you will have access to the employer for this role and other top companies that seek high-quality talent. Apply to this job to kick off the process.<br><ul><li>JOB TYPE: Freelance, Contract Position (no agencies/C2C - see notes below)</li><li>LOCATION: Remote-United States only (TimeZone: PST/CIST | Full day overlap)</li><li>HOURLY RANGE: Our client is looking to pay $115 – $135/hr</li><li>ESTIMATED DURATION: 40h/week - Short term<br><br></li></ul><strong>THE OPPORTUNITY<br><br></strong><strong>About The Role<br></strong><ul><li>Design, Analyze and Propose metrics to measure projects impact and opportunity sizing in eCommerce Search Scenario.</li><li>Extract insights from data for improving current Machine learning ranking models that optimize for various business goals to power search at scale.</li><li>Prototype, optimize, and productionize large-scale product improvements that deliver key results.</li><li>Run A/B experiments to validate product improvements.</li><li>PrePost Analysis on A/B experiments</li><li>Work closely with software engineers, applied scientists, product managers, and designers.</li><li>Of course, this is just a sample of the kinds of work this role will require! You should assume that your role will encompass other tasks, too, and that your job duties and responsibilities may change from time to time at company's discretion, or otherwise applicable with local law.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Requirements<br></strong><ul><li>Supporting teams with data &amp; analysis: you will work with multidisciplinary teams (marketing, product, etc.) to provide insights and analytical support when needed; you will also distill insights and make recommendations backed up by data to relevant stakeholders growing our business.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Must-Haves<br></strong><ul><li>Strong SQL skills and experience with large datasets</li><li>Proficiency in Python, Scala, or similar languages</li><li>Experience with data visualization tools</li><li>Ability to communicate complex issues simply to diverse stakeholders</li><li>Master's degree in Statistics, Data Analytics, Computer Science or related field</li><li>Analytical thinking, problem-solving skills, and a passion for numbers</li><li>Proficient written communication in a remote team setting, familiarity with Slack and Google Docs</li><li>Eagerness to learn, natural curiosity, and attention to detail</li><li>Ability to take on and lead unconstrained problems and know when to seek help and how to deliver.</li><li>Strong written communication skills.<br><br></li></ul>Nice-to-Haves<br><ul><li>Experience in neural ML frameworks such as PyTorch, Keras, Tensorflow.</li><li>Have solid software engineering and coding skills, including CS fundamentals like data structures and algorithms.</li><li>Have experience working on large-scale, low-latency distributed systems. </li><li>Research skills to transform business challenges into machine learning tasks effectively. A proven track record in utilizing machine learning approaches to solve real-world problems.</li><li>Experience with / working in one of the following fields: deep learning, uplift modeling, fairness in recommender systems, reinforcement learning. </li></ul> <strong>What you’ll be working on<br><br></strong><strong>About The Team<br><br></strong>The Marketplace Optimization team is a part of the Search and Ads group, who are committed to refining search ranking quality for both buyers and sellers. We are responsible for the third path ranking of search results, which significantly shapes the overall customer search experience. The team is an eclectic mix of machine learning engineers, applied scientists, and a product manager. Collaborating intensively with software engineers and various product and enablement teams throughout the organization, we are involved in the creation and execution of advanced machine learning algorithms that consistently facilitate improved search results.<br><ul><li>We value respect, collaboration, and customer focus.</li><li>We believe in encouraging an inclusive and supportive environment where everyone's ideas are heard and valued.</li><li>We also believe in working closely with other teams and sharing ideas and insights to help drive innovation across the organization.</li><li>And above all, we are passionate about delivering value to our customers and improving their search experience.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Apply Now!<br><br></strong>Braintrust Job ID: 6642<br><br>C2C Candidates: This role is not available to C2C candidates working with an agency. If you are a professional contractor who has created an LLC/corp around their consulting practice, this is well aligned with Braintrust and we’d welcome your application.<br><br>Braintrust values the multitude of talents and perspectives that a diverse workforce brings. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.

title: UI Developer - Opportunity for Working Remotely
description: Airswift, on behalf of a Major Client in Illinois, is seeking a DevOps Specialist for a Direct Hire/Full-Time position. This role offers a Hybrid/Remote schedule with occasional office visits (once/twice a month), welcoming candidates from Greater Chicago and all of Illinois.<br><br>Responsibilities:<br><ul><li>Develop, integrate, and maintain critical business systems, including client management, business intelligence, and middleware. </li><li>Prototype, develop, and test software components, ensuring smooth operations of virtual cloud infrastructure. </li><li>Collaborate with third-party vendors, manage project timelines, and prioritize tasks. </li><li>Design and implement integration strategies for the management system and third-party applications. </li><li>Perform code reviews, testing, and execute test scripts for third-party solutions. </li><li>Provide system administration and support for management systems, cloud infrastructure, and interfaces. </li><li>Monitor performance, security, and industry developments to optimize system architecture. </li><li>Architect applications and cloud infrastructure, ensuring security best practices. </li><li>Plan and manage projects, communicate updates, and track licensing costs. <br><br></li></ul>Requirements:<br><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in Information Technology or Computer Science preferred (equivalent work experience considered). </li><li>Minimum 3 years of hands-on software development experience with the Microsoft stack. </li><li>Minimum 2 years of hands-on system administration experience with AWS and Microsoft Server platform. </li><li>Knowledge of web platforms and technologies including AWS, Salesforce CRM, DNS, Microsoft IIS, Microsoft Windows Server, Microsoft SQL Server, HTML, CSS, XHTML, XML, and Microsoft .NET. <br><br></li></ul>Desired Skills:<br><ul><li>Familiarity with secondary technologies such as Personify, DotNetNuke CMS, disaster recovery strategies, load balancing, Google Analytics, XSL, XSLT, and VB.Net. </li><li>Experience in designing/coding responsive web applications and mobile applications. </li><li>Strong problem-solving and critical-thinking skills with attention to performance and scalability. </li><li>Excellent communication and project management abilities. </li><li>Ability to work collaboratively, prioritize tasks, and adapt to a matrix management environment. </li><li>Working knowledge of web browsers and cross-platform compatibility. <br><br></li></ul>Join our client team as a DevOps Specialist and contribute to the success of critical business systems in a hybrid/remote work environment. Apply today!

title: Backend Engineer
description: Are you passionate about cutting-edge technology and process optimization? Join our innovative team at Synch-Solutions and be part of our Automation Program Portfolio as a UI Automation Developer! We are a dynamic and forward-thinking company focused on delivering exceptional automation projects. This is a 100% remote position with no travel required, offering full-time 1099/C2C engagement. Please note that due to the nature of our work with the public sector, applicants must be USA citizens.<br><br><strong><u>Role And Responsibilities<br><br></u></strong>Design, develop, and implement a wide range of process improvement tools and techniques, including Workflow, Robotic Process Automation (RPA), Optical Character Recognition (OCR), Natural Language Processing (NLP), and Machine Learning (ML) to meet end-to-end business requirements.<br><br>Collaborate with stakeholders to map existing processes, explore innovative technologies, and identify opportunities for process re-engineering, digitization, and automation.<br><br>Create and maintain the Solution Design Document (SDD) throughout the project lifecycle, including detailed RPA solution process flows, process and technical specifications.<br><br>Develop and document test procedures and scenarios for user acceptance testing.<br><br>Define and plan the development approach for larger projects/solutions, utilizing your object-oriented design skills.<br><br>Work within a project-based organization, delivering on defined project plans and constraints, while proactively communicating any identified project risks and issues to the project manager.<br><br>Support the creation and ongoing refinement of a tailored Framework that enables rapid and repeatable delivery of process improvements within our company.<br><br>Monitor, schedule, and optimize the balance load of developed solutions to meet agreed Service Level Agreements (SLAs) effectively with business units.<br><br>Investigate and analyze RPA incidents and process exceptions, applying a strategic approach to root cause analysis.<br><br>Ensure the completeness, effectiveness, and sustainability of the proposed solution implementation.<br><br>Collaborate with a dynamic team to refine and expand automation based on user feedback.<br><br><strong><u>Qualifications And Education Requirements<br><br></u></strong>Bachelor's degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Information Technology, Mechanical Engineering, Industrial Engineering, Business Computer, or related fields.<br><br>Minimum of 2 years of experience in a developer role, specializing in UiPath.<br><br>Knowledge or experience in VBA/SQL/HTML/JavaScript/automation software/workflow software/RPA software (e.g., BluePrism, UiPath, Kapow, Automation Anywhere, or others) would be advantageous.<br><br>Familiarity or experience with advanced Excel/MS Power BI/Tableau/QlikView.<br><br>Strong programming skills and knowledge of structured programming languages such as VBA, R, Python, Java, HTML, and ASP.NET.<br><br>Proficiency in DBMS knowledge, particularly MySQL and SQL Server.<br><br>Exposure to Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) methodologies.<br><br>Business process improvement and mapping skills, preferably with tools like MS Visio and ARIS.<br><br>Knowledge of project management, agile methodologies, and/or experience working in a project environment would be highly beneficial.<br><br>Excellent analytical and systematic problem-solving skills.<br><br>Ability to focus on the core fundamentals of a problem and drive towards optimal solutions without losing focus or deviating.<br><br>Strong drive and motivation to complete tasks efficiently.<br><br>Excellent prioritization skills aligned with business objectives.<br><br>Proficient written and verbal communication skills in both English and Thai.<br><br>Strong interpersonal skills, both as a team player and in independent work settings.<br><br>Proactive thinker with a "can-do" attitude.<br><br>Strong problem-solving ability, service-oriented mindset, and ability to perform under pressure.<br><br>Good interpersonal skills and the ability to coordinate with other teams and clients.<br><br>Strong ability to analyze and prioritize issues for effective problem resolution.<br><br>Join our talented team at Synch-Solutions and take your career in Robotic Process Automation (RPA) to new heights! We offer an exciting work environment, remote flexibility, and the opportunity to make a real impact. Apply today and be part of our journey towards innovation and excellence in process automation!<br><br>Employment Type: Contractor<br><br>Salary: $ 65.00 85.00 Per Hour

Join our innovative team at Synch-Solutions and be part of our Automation Program Portfolio as a UI Automation Developer! We are a dynamic and forward-thinking company focused on delivering exceptional automation projects. This is a 100% remote position with no travel required, offering full-time 1099/C2C engagement. Please note that due to the nature of our work with the public sector, applicants must be USA citizens.<br><br><strong><u>Role And Responsibilities<br><br></u></strong>Design, develop, and implement a title: DevOps Specialist
description: <strong>ABOUT US</strong>:<br><br>Braintrust is a user-owned talent network that connects you with great jobs with no fees or membership costs—so you keep 100% of what you earn.<br><br><strong>ABOUT THE HIRING PROCESS:<br><br></strong>When you join Braintrust, you will be invited to a screening process for Braintrust to learn more about your previous work experiences. Once completed, you will have access to the employer for this role and other top companies that seek high-quality talent. Apply to this job to kick off the process.<br><ul><li>JOB TYPE: Direct Hire/ FTE Position (no agencies/C2C - see notes below)</li><li>LOCATION: Remote - Work from anywhere (Time Zone: EST, PST/CIST, CST | Partial overlap)</li><li>SALARY RANGE: $45,000 – $65,000/yr</li><li>ESTIMATED DURATION: 40hr/week - Long term<br><br></li></ul><strong>THE OPPORTUNITY<br><br></strong><strong>Requirements<br><br></strong><strong>Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li>Experience with developing interactive, customer facing applications and websites; </li><li>Software development foundations: solid software design patterns and scalable web service APIs principles; </li><li>Experience with test-driven development; </li><li>Proficiency in software engineering tools; and </li><li>Ability to document requirements and specifications </li><li>BSc degree in Computer Science, Engineering or relevant field; </li><li>3-5 years’ experience in a similar position; </li><li>Required Technical skills: React, Vue, PHP, REST, JavaScript/Ajax/jQuery, MySQL, AWS, nginx, Apache Tomcat, Docker, Linux </li><li>Additional skills: WordPress, Python, shell scripting, git, Jenkins, Bamboo, Docker, AWS </li><li>DevOps certification is a big plus, </li><li>Previous Financial industry experience a plus. </li></ul> <strong><strong>What you’ll be working on<br><br></strong></strong><strong>Responsibilities<br></strong><ul><li>You will be responsible for overseeing the maintenance and development of applications within the FE international and LTV Fund portfolio </li><li>The role main business function is to support FE International and LTV Fund mission to build out high-quality, innovative and fully performing scalable software, complying with the highest coding standards </li><li>Design and execute full software development life cycle; </li><li>Write well-designed and testable code; </li><li>Work with a third party team of developers; </li><li>Produce specifications and determine operational feasibility; </li><li>Integrate software components into a fully functional software system; </li><li>Develop software verification plans and quality assurance procedures; </li><li>Document and maintain software functionality; </li><li>Troubleshoot, debug and upgrade existing systems; </li><li>Deploy programs and evaluate user feedback; </li><li>Comply with project plans and industry standards; </li><li>Ensure software is updated with latest features; and </li><li>Other ad-hoc software duties as required by the business. <br><br></li></ul><strong>Apply Now!<br><br></strong>Braintrust Job ID: 6653<br><br>C2C Candidates: This role is not available to C2C candidates working with an agency. If you are a professional contractor who has created an LLC/corp around their consulting practice, this is well aligned with Braintrust and we’d welcome your application.<br><br>Braintrust values the multitude of talents and perspectives that a diverse workforce brings. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.

title: UiPath Application Developer - Remote | WFH
description: <strong><span><span>Job Title: Business Analyst Resource II<br></span></span></strong><strong><span><span>Location: Northbrook, IL (Remote)<br></span></span></strong><strong><span><span>Job type: 9 months on W2 Contract<br></span></span></strong> <br><strong><span><span>Description:<br></span></span></strong><strong><span><span>Responsibilities:</span></span></strong><ul><li><span><span>Collaborate with and leverage analytical expertise to support marketing and other internal partners to prioritize, develop, and improve upon key reporting metrics and performance indicators around brand objectives to enable better and more informed business decisions.</span></span></li><li><span><span>Design and manage projects applying analytics techniques to conduct rigorous analyses to uncover new business opportunities and insights and to support the development of actionable strategic and tactical recommendations based on the findings.</span></span></li><li><span><span>Apply best practices to design, efficiently conduct, and strategically align ad hoc analyses as needed to support evolving business requirements and to provide timely business insights.</span></span></li><li><span><span>Collaborate with and mobilize other operational stakeholders to define, develop and maintain business rules and data models in alignment with internal policies and business needs.</span></span></li><li><span><span>Manage, and support collaboration with marketing sciences and other analytical, reporting, and business functions on promotional initiatives ROI assessments and other measurements of promotional effectiveness.</span></span></li><li><span><span>Maintain high degree of proficiency among data systems, programs, and software resources, support data quality control and acquisition and maintenance of ad hoc analytical environments, to ensure optimal and efficient achievement of department objectives.</span></span></li><li><span><span>Analyze pharmacy claims and other syndicated data to extract actionable insights using various analytics techniques.</span></span></li><li><span><span>Develop and execute on brand performance measurement plans.</span></span></li></ul> <br><strong><span><span>Required skills:</span></span></strong><ul><li><span><span>Bachelor’s degree in business related field or the sciences with courses focused on quantitative techniques.</span></span></li><li><span><span>Minimum 5 years of progressively expanding experience in analytics, including data manipulation, statistically rigorous analysis, and marketing analytics within the pharmaceutical or healthcare related industry.</span></span></li><li><span><span>Possess strong interpersonal skills and demonstrated ability to effectively interact with and influence all levels of employees including senior management.</span></span></li><li><span><span>Proven ability to thrive in fast-paced, team environment, adapt to changing priorities, and independently lead cross-functional projects of high complexity.</span></span></li><li><span><span>Demonstrated experience working with various business intelligence and data visualization tools.</span></span></li><li><span><span>Excellent skills in the following areas: project management, organization, written and verbal communication, accuracy, personal initiative, autonomy, and innovation.</span></span></li><li><span><span>Demonstrated ability in taking initiative to proactively evaluate existing sales strategies and recommend changes, when appropriate.</span></span></li><li><span><span>Minimum 3 years of experience applying statistics, modeling, and simulation techniques in complex analytical projects to deliver actionable solutions to business questions.</span></span></li><li><span><span>Knowledge of relational database concepts, proficiency with SQL, experience in R, SAS, or similar language</span></span></li><li><span><span>Proficiency in MS Excel and Power Point</span></span></li></ul> <br><strong><span><span>Preferred skills:</span></span></strong><ul><li><span><span>Experience with AWS ecosystem.</span></span></li><li><span><span>Ability to independently design, implement, and validate simulations and models in R, SAS or similar language.</span></span></li><li><span><span>Advanced degree in quantitative field or equivalent experience with strong business acumen</span></span></li><li><span><span>Experience working with Google Analytics or Adobe Analytics</span></span></li><li><span><span>Experience with visualization tools like Qlik View/Qlik Sense and/or Tableau</span></span></li><li><span><span>Experience in KPI and diagnostic metrics development</span></span></li><li><span><span>Experience in promotional analytics: HCP non-personal and/or Consumer</span></span></li><li><span><span>Experience in presenting business insights and providing recommendations.</span></span></li><li><span><span>Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to effectively interact with all levels of employees including senior management.</span></span></li></ul> <br> <br><br><br><br><br>#itzr3

title: Software Engineer
description: Location:<br><br>1901 Chestnut Ave<br><br>Glenview, Illinois, 60025<br><br>United States<br><br>Category:<br><br>Quality Assurance<br><br>Date Needed by:<br><br>5/22/2023<br><br><strong>Primary Duties and Responsibilities:<br><br></strong>You bring the motivation, teamwork, and integrity and we’ll provide the collaborative culture, professional development, and respect you deserve. And if you’re good at what you do, you’ll have a career at Wespath Benefits and Investments. Join our team in Information Technology – and, if you’d like, teams such as our DEI Council, Green Team on environmental sustainability, or our Change Management team – and make an impact through your work!<br><br>Wespath, recognized as a 2017-2022 Chicago’s Best and Brightest Companies to Work For® and a 2018-2022 National Best and Brightest Companies to Work For®, has an opportunity for a Software Quality Assurance Analyst that improves and maintains software quality by applying proven analytical and problem-solving skills to validate the implementation of software against functional and technical specifications and assisting other members of the QA team through each testing phase. The analyst leads or participates in software testing efforts and various other organizational improvement initiatives to identify opportunities for process and data improvement, integrity, quality. and customer service .<br><br>More specifically, as a Software Quality Assurance Analyst you will have the opportunity to:<br><ul><li> R eview and identify gaps and deficiencies in business requirements, technical specifications, designs, and testing documentation for completeness and testability </li><li> P articipate in software design reviews to provide input and identify potential problems </li><li> D evelops QA test plans and project testing estimates </li><li> D evelop test procedures, scenarios, cases, datasets, and scripts to use in testing software </li><li> T rack and report on test status progress across project initiatives </li><li> P articipate in cross-functional collaborative problem solving and defect management session and identify priority and impact of defect </li><li> P articipate in functional, regression and performance testing </li><li> C ommunicate test results to both technical and non-technical project team members </li><li> L ead and participate in system integration testing and user acceptance testing across organizational releases </li><li> C ontribute to the evolution of the testing tool suite and its evolution in order to maximize tool capabilities and increase testing team efficiencies </li><li> P roactively identify inefficiencies in system use from a control, technique, or process viewpoint and propose changes that may include process redesign and/or system enhancements </li><li> E nsure that the test bed has appropriate coverage of the functional requirements </li><li> U pdate the regression test bed </li><li> I dentify defects during test execution and provide detailed information so that the development team is easily able to recreate the defect </li><li> R epresent Wespath in the external user community <br><br></li></ul><strong> Software Quality Assurance Analyst Benefits: <br></strong><ul><li> Medical, dental, vision and well-being benefits from our HealthFlex Exchange on day one </li><li> 8 % employer contribution to retirement plan with an additional match up to 2% on day one </li><li> 2 2 days of PTO + 12 paid holidays </li><li> H ybrid work environment; able to work effectively whether in the office or in a remote location <br><br></li></ul>;<br><br><strong>Minimum Requirements/Qualifications:<br></strong><ul><li> Bachelor's degree degree in business administration, computer science, information systems, finance or in a related discipline or equivalent work experience </li><li> Three or more years of testing experience </li><li> Advanced knowledge and experience with Microsoft Office Suite <br><br></li></ul><strong> Preferred Requirements/Qualifications: <br></strong><ul><li> Experience with performance, load, and automated test scripting </li><li> E xperience with HP Quality Center </li><li> E x perience with retirement and health benefit administration </li><li> E xperience with Automated Testing is a plus </li><li> K nowledge of Agile development processes <br><br></li></ul>Wespath Benefits and Investments is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate in hiring.<br><br>
