Microsoft Office Suite <br><br></li></ul><strong> Preferred Requirements/Qualifications: <br></strong><ul><li> Experience with performance, load, and automated test scripting </li><li> E xperience with HP Quality Center </li><li> E x perience with retirement and health benefit administration </li><li> E xperience with Automated Testing is a plus </li><li> K nowledge of Agile development processes <br><br></li></ul>Wespath Benefits and Investments is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate in hiring.<br><br>

title: Dotnet Developer
description: Project Manager/Business Analyst '2013 Chicago<p><br></p><strong><u>Company Description</u></strong><p><br></p>RedMane Technology LLC is an application software consulting and systems integration company based in Chicago. We deliver software solutions for our clients throughout the United States and Canada by means of building new applications, implementing cloud and packaged systems, and/or modernizing legacy systems.<p><br></p>RedMane has earned an exemplary service reputation that prioritizes a highly collaborative culture. Our primary objective is to ensure the solutions we design and implement meet or exceed the needs of our clients for their mission critical systems.<p><br></p>The diverse and passionate teams within RedMane address complex, real world challenges. Technology is just our tool.<p><br></p>The Role<p><br></p>RedMane has a full-time opportunity for an experienced Project Manager/Business Analyst (PM/BA) as we continue to grow our Chicago-based practice. We are looking for people with aptitude, intelligence, and desire as this role is the primary point of contact with the client. This role will require effective communication and the ability to focus on high quality work under pressure in leading technical and non-technical audiences. The successful candidate will work directly with clients and internal staff to estimate, plan and manage projects to successful completion.<p><br></p>Our solution offerings include custom design, integrated solutions that leverage third-party software and COTS products, and highly configurable, low code case management solutions that that incorporate leading-edge technologies. These include cloud-based mobility, data analytics and visualizations, artificial intelligence, and machine learning.<p><br></p>As a Project Manager/Business Analyst, you will work in a collaborative environment within our project teams where you will track, manage and report upon scope, schedule, budget for client projects. This PM/BA role, frequent and clear communication is necessary to establish productive and balanced relationships with customer stakeholders and sponsors.<p><br></p>You will participate in project planning and assessment engagements where you will work closely with our customers to present and document options, recommendations, and roadmaps to support their long-term planning and strategy.<p><br></p>You will also work in a collaborative environment where you will play a key role in obtaining requirements from clients, lead and take part in JAD sessions and work with internal and external stakeholders.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities Include</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Create, update, and manage project schedule using Microsoft Project or other client-approved software. </li><li>Control and manage project scope, budget, activities, and expectations to ensure profitability of RedMane projects. </li><li>Regularly track, report, and analyze project status, including scheduling and conducting regular status meetings, and creating client-facing status reports. </li><li>Create and manage Risk, Change and Issues registers for the project. </li><li>Plan, schedule and manage project activities with clients. </li><li>Regularly manage, interact, and collaborate with RedMane project team members. </li><li>Plan and lead Joint Application Design (JAD) sessions </li><li>Ability to lead design sessions and workshops with clients to capture functional requirements. </li><li>Facilitate discussions and resolution of project-related issues and blockers if they arise. </li><li>Create monthly reports and forecasts to RedMane executive management of project status, schedule, milestones, and budget. </li><li>Facilitate, schedule, and plan Executive Steering Committee meetings for projects '2013 including creation of presentations and other material to effectively communicate project progress.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Skills &amp; Role Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p>The PM/BA candidate will need to have: <ul><li>7 years of project management and/or business analysis experience with increasing scope of responsibility. </li><li>Experience in crafting project proposals, developing work estimates and project schedules. </li><li>Experience in project planning and control of multi-year and multi-phase projects. </li><li>Experience with the identification and mitigation of project risk. </li><li>Proficiency with project management tools and software (e.g., Microsoft Project, Word, Excel, Visio, PowerPoint, SharePoint). </li><li>Strong interpersonal and management skills with an excellent attention to detail. </li><li>Experience managing projects involving data analytics, artificial intelligence, machine learning and IoT is a plus, but not required. </li><li>PMP certification is a plus, but not required.</li></ul><p><br></p>All professionals at RedMane are expected to possess these skills: <ul><li>A strong ethical foundation, capable of thriving in an environment and culture where honesty, integrity, and accountability are core values. </li><li>A collaborative spirit, a team orientation, and a willingness and desire to contribute to the success of others.</li></ul><p><br></p>'2003<p><br></p>Travel Requirements<p><br></p>The position may involve periodic travel to client locations within the US.<p><br></p>We Offer You<p><br></p>RedMane has an environment that offers challenging and interesting work. A place where you can have fun and express your talent and creativity. You will be working side by side with like-minded peers in a non-bureaucratic environment where sharing knowledge is the norm. Everyone at RedMane shares a passion for making a real difference for individuals, communities, and the world.<p><br></p>Additionally, we believe you should have fun and enjoy growing your career; we provide the supportive and empowering environment to make it happen. RedMane is very proud to offer employees professional and personal perks that include: <ul><li>A flexible work environment that includes hybridized locations and schedules with free catered lunches in the office three days a week.</li><li>Market based compensation with a full range of benefits including medical, dental, vision, 401(k), short and long-term disability insurance, etc. </li><li>A culture that promotes and fosters career growth through professional training and mentoring.</li><li>An employee wellness program that includes free access to professional fitness coaches, structured dietary/nutrition plans, weekly Pilates classes in the office, and events that range from 5k- 7s to triathlons. </li><li>Opportunities to give back to the community through our RedMane Community Impact Team which organizes events like Feed My Starving Children, Toy Drives, and other charitable activities.</li></ul>

title: FE International | Frontend Developer (w/ DevOps experience) [Remote]
description: ***Hybrid, 3 days onsite, 2 days remote***<p><br></p>A prestigious financial firm needs a DevOps Support Engineer. This engineer will focus on DevOps support, maintenance, and configuration of development environments in Kubernetes and AWS. This individual will need to possess skills with Java, Python, AWS, DevOps, CICD, Kubernetes, Kafka, Jenkins, Github, Ansible, etc.<p><br></p>Responsibilities:<p><br></p><ul><li>Enable development teams to self-service build and deployment processes through process automation.</li><li>Design and implement process improvements across the build, deployment, and monitoring of Clearing applications.</li><li>Support the maintenance and configuration of development environments in Kubernetes and AWS.</li><li>Develop and support terraform, ansible, Harness, and Jenkins jobs used to instantiate and manage development environments.</li></ul><p><br></p>Qualifications:<p><br></p><ul><li>BS degree in Computer Science, similar technical field, or equivalent experience</li><li>1+ years of experience in building large scale, data-centric solutions</li><li>3+ years of experience (recent) participating on a DevOps team or as product owner for DevOps team</li><li>Programming/scripting experience in languages like Java, Bash, Python or Go is required.</li><li>Knowledge and experience with Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) tools (examples - GitHub, Jenkins, Artifactory, Docker, Compose, K8s).</li><li>Java development experience is desirable.</li><li>Experience with distributed message brokers like Kafka, RabbitMQ, ActiveMQ, Amazon Kinesis, etc.</li><li>Experience with cloud technologies and migrations is required.</li><li>Experience preferred with AWS foundational services like VPCs, Security groups, EC2, RDS, S3 ACLs, KMS, AWS CLI and IAM etc.</li><li>Experience developing and delivering technical solutions using public cloud service providers like Amazon, Google, etc.</li><li>Familiarity with monitoring related tools and frameworks like Splunk, ElasticSearch, Prometheus, AppDynamics. Working knowledge of DevOps tools. Eg Terraform, Ansible, Jenkins, Kubernetes, Helm and CI/CD pipeline etc. is required.</li><li>Experience with RESTful APIs and JSON RPC. Experience following Git workflows.</li></ul>

title: Business Analyst Resource II
description: Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, gt.school. Have you got what it takes?<p><br></p>Do you take pleasure in looking at and interpreting data? Are you passionate about education and want a role in a startup that wants to revolutionize how technology is used to learn? If yes, keep on reading…<p><br></p>We’re looking for individuals who:<p><br></p><ul><li>Are strategic problem solvers who can quickly devise and implement solutions to address ad-hoc issues facing our students</li><li>Are excellent communicators; able to concisely and effectively describe processes in written playbooks, design engaging student communication, and keep other team members consistently updated with progress on projects. </li><li>Consider themselves to be consistent, high performers who rarely have ‘off-days’.</li><li>Understand the importance of revolutionizing the education space with cutting-edge technology.</li></ul><p><br></p>In this role, you’ll work directly with our EdTech company, gt.school. You’ll develop an expert understanding of the data we collect on students and become familiar with all the apps and systems we use to collect and store this information. You will build new edtech tools and operational processes, and restructure existing processes to be more efficient.<p><br></p>Not only will you gain valuable experience, but you’ll also receive regular coaching and training from a team of global tech experts and operations professionals. You’ll get constructive feedback on all of your work to help you develop and get a chance to meet daily with other team members to work collaboratively on projects.<p><br></p>Interested in a role that involves research, strategy, product development, and data science in the cutting-edge field of education and technology? Apply below.<p><br></p><strong><u>What You Will Be Doing</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Participating in daily stand-up calls to solve the most critical issues facing students in our program, other staff members such as Motivational Coaches, Academic Coaches, Program Directors, or the leadership team.</li><li>Converting important decisions made by leadership into work units that a junior Operations team can perform.</li><li>Creating robust processes that stand the test of time and capture all of the edge-cases to ensure maximum probability of success the first time around. </li><li>Troubleshooting issues facing our students due to data issues, human error, or automation error; quickly strategizing a bulletproof solution that solves the issue and prevents further recurrence in the future.</li><li>Working as a team to ensure progress is being made on key tasks by communicating with other operations analysts and managers to ensure no lapse in service for internal or external stakeholders.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>What You Won’t Be Doing</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Collecting data or performing administrative tasks - we have a junior operations analyst team to do this type of work.</li><li>Providing loose or generalized solutions that don’t actually get implemented.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Senior Data Scientist Key Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p>Same as “What you will be doing”, above.<p><br></p><strong><u>Basic Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Excellent written and verbal English communication skills</li><li>Proficient in Python or R (we will test this)</li><li>2+ years of work experience working in a technical field (science, technology, financial services, data science)</li><li>Bachelor’s degree from a top 20 US university or a top 100 global university.</li><li>Consistently able to work 8 hours per day, Monday through Friday, between 6AM and 6PM CST</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Nice-to-have Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Advanced in Python and Apps Script</li><li>Familiarity with Canvas (LMS)</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>About Gt.school</u></strong><p><br></p>gt.school is a stealth EdTech startup in Austin, Texas, the center of educational innovation in the US. Our unique approach leverages 50+ years of learning science, cutting-edge data analytics and high-performance life skills coaching. In doing so, we can help students learn 5x faster and unlock their full potential in both academics and in life. We are a remote-first company that hires globally via Crossover.<p><br></p>There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!<p><br></p><strong>Working with Crossover</strong><p><br></p>This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $30 USD/hour, which equates to $60,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.<p><br></p><strong>What to expect next:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.</li><li>Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Important!</strong> If you do not receive an email from us:<p><br></p><ul><li>First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.</li><li>Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.</li><li>Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.</li><li>If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.</li></ul> Crossover Job Code: LJ-4880-US-Chicago-SeniorDataScie.002<p><br></p>
industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Technology, Information and Internet

title: Software Quality Assurance Analyst
description: <strong><u>IAM SailPoint Developer</u></strong><p><br></p>Salary: $120k-$140k + 15% bonus<p><br></p>Location: Hybrid role in either location<p><br></p>Chicago, IL/Dallas, TX<p><br></p>*Open to providing sponsorship*<p><br></p>*Permanent placement role. This is not open to Contract, Contract to Hire, or C2C*<p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>5-7+ Years Identity Access Management (IAM) experience</li><li>Sailpoint Identity IQ development and administration</li><li>Development experience: Java, Javascript, Beanshell, SQL Queries</li><li>Working knowledge of GitHub, Postman or other similar industry standard developer tools.</li><li>Microsoft Active Directory and LDAP</li><li>Experience working in and developing solutions for a highly regulated environment or organization that leverages a security framework (such as NIST, COBIT, etc).</li><li>Experience with Multi-Factor authentication protocols and systems (Entrust, Duo, or similar).</li><li>Experience with Single-Sign on protocols (OIDC, OAuth2.0, SAML, SWA, etc) and systems (Okta, Ping, Siteminder, or similar).</li><li>Basic knowledge of Linux operating system administration.</li><li>Basic knowledge of Windows server and desktop operating systems</li><li>Basic knowledge of Amazon Web Services (AWS)</li><li>Basic knowledge of Controls, Risk Ranking/mapping, Remediation items and general IT audit</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Administration and configuration of our IAM products and processes with an emphasis on Sailpoint IIQ.</li><li>Developing custom integration, workflows and rules between tools using Agile methodologies.</li><li>Planning, implementation, enforcement and review of security policies, procedures, and controls specific to Identity Access Management.</li><li>Processing access requests and issue tickets for internal and external customers</li><li>Leading troubleshooting and resolution of system issues that might contribute to enterprise Production problems.</li><li>Managing assigned project work through all phases (design, build, test, cutover).</li><li>Report on controls, evidence gathering and control execution as related to the systems and processes this individual supports.</li></ul>
description_json: <strong><u>IAM SailPoint Developer</u></strong><p><br></p>Salary: $120k-$140k + 15% bonus<p><br></p>Location: Hybrid role in either location<p><br></p>Chicago, IL/Dallas, TX<p><br></p>*Open to providing sponsorship*<p><br></p>*Permanent placement role. This is not open to Contract, Contract to Hire, or C2C*<p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>5-7+ Years Identity Access Management (IAM) experience</li><li>Sailpoint Identity IQ development and administration</li><li>Development experience: Java, Javascript, Beanshell, SQL Queries</li><li>Working knowledge of GitHub, Postman or other similar industry standard developer tools.</li><li>Microsoft Active Directory and LDAP</li><li>Experience working in and developing solutions for a highly regulated environment or organization that leverages a security framework (such as NIST, COBIT, etc).</li><li>Experience with Multi-Factor authentication protocols and systems (Entrust, Duo, or similar).</li><li>Experience with Single-Sign on protocols (OIDC, OAuth2.0, SAML, SWA, etc) and systems (Okta, Ping, Siteminder, or similar).</li><li>Basic knowledge of Linux operating system administration.</li><li>Basic knowledge of Windows server and desktop operating systems</li><li>Basic knowledge of Amazon Web Services (AWS)</li><li>Basic knowledge of Controls, Risk Ranking/mapping, Remediation items and general IT audit</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Administration and configuration of our IAM products and processes with an emphasis on Sailpoint IIQ.</li><li>Developing custom integration, workflows and rules between tools using Agile methodologies.</li><li>Planning, implementation, enforcement and review of security policies, procedures, and controls specific to Identity Access Management.</li><li>Processing access requests and issue tickets for internal and external customers</li><li>Leading troubleshooting and resolution of system issues that might contribute to enterprise Production problems.</li><li>Managing assigned project work through all phases (design, build, test, cutover).</li><li>Report on controls, evidence gathering and control execution as related to the systems and processes this individual supports.</li></ul>

title: Project Manager- FBusiness Analyst
description: Location <strong>IL, Mt. Prospect<br><br></strong>Department <strong>Engineering<br><br></strong>Employment Type <strong>Full Time<br><br></strong><strong>Software Engineer<br><br></strong><strong>Crane Payment Innovations<br><br></strong><strong>Mount Prospect, IL<br><br></strong>Crane Payment Innovations is the leader in world class automated payment solutions. We partner with businesses to provide payment experiences that set new and innovative standards for consumer convenience, security and reliability. We are excited to explore new ways every day to improve how millions of people across the globe can make their payments in a way that fits with their lives. Our global engineers develop products and deliver innovative solutions in currency validation technologies, cash management systems, digital payment technologies, mobile applications, security and digital advertising. We offer a range of devices for bill and coin validation, cash recycling and dispensing systems, IoT applications for our enterprise-level connected products and services, and software applications to integrate sensory hardware to machines and networks.<br><br>At CPI you will become a valuable part of an inclusive culture of collaboration and innovation with the support of over 2,000 associates working in one of our 15 offices across the world. If you want to have a hands-on global impact on payment solutions, we want you to join our team as a Software Engineer. This is a full-time position based at our Mt. Prospect Office in the Chicagoland area.<br><br><strong><u>Primary Function<br><br></u></strong>The <strong>Software Engineer</strong> will design and develop software to support our existing coin or note counters. This individual will assist with all phases of the software development cycle.<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities And Duties<br><br></u></strong><strong>Technical skill sets:<br></strong><ul><li>Experienced in designing and testing new code in C/C++ for or Linux or Windows environment</li><li>Writing web-based applications using ASP, HTML5, JavaScript</li><li>Using installation tools to create and maintain Linux or Windows based installation packages</li><li>Provide support and development for automation test scripts</li><li>Utilizing version control system to manage product revisions: Git and ClearCase</li><li>Creating and maintaining issues using JIRA</li><li>Ability to troubleshoot and debug for root cause of system/subsystem failures</li><li>Experienced in adhering to an established engineering development process, – CPI EDP – (proof-of-concept, prototyping, design, integration/test, associated documentation)<br></li></ul><strong><u>Core Skillsets<br></u></strong><ul><li>Ability to work in a cross functional team environment</li><li>Good communications skillsets (verbal, written, presenting, etc.)</li><li>Computer skillsets (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Electrical Design ( IDEs ), etc</li><li>Self-Motivated – takes initiative to address issues, pursue new designs, identify cost reductions, researching of new parts</li><li>Innovative – Ability to design from a broad mandate statement, thinking out of the box, etc</li><li>Accountable – Assumes full responsibility of their designs or other designs which they have been assigned to maintain or debug<br></li></ul><strong><u>Value Added Skillsets<br></u></strong><ul><li>Familiarity with Kaizen methodology and Continuous Improvement Tools<br></li></ul><strong><u>Qualifications And Required Skills<br></u></strong><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree in Software Engineering or equivalent</li><li>Experience with creating architecture for Embedded Machines</li><li>4-7 years of experience in software development</li><li>Strong software/hardware debugging skillsets</li><li>Familiarity with test equipment such as oscilloscopes, digital analysers, IDEs, debug modules, DVM, data communication analysis tools, etc<br></li></ul><strong>Key Attributes for Success<br></strong><ul><li>High energy level, comfortable performing multifaceted projects in conjunction with day-to-day activities</li><li>Excellent influencing skills, analytical and problem-solving skills and the ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment</li><li>Ability to establish credibility and be decisive and able to recognize and support the organization's preferences and priorities</li><li>Results and people oriented with sound judgment—ability to balance other business considerations</li><li>Team player – able to work in a matrix organization</li><li>Excellent communication skills verbally and in writing</li><li>Up to 10% travel<br></li></ul><strong>We offer<br></strong><ul><li>Competitive salaries</li><li>Paid time off</li><li>Sick time off</li><li>Medical, dental, &amp; vision insurance</li><li>Flexible spending accounts</li><li>Life insurance and disability benefits</li><li>401K with Company contribution</li><li>Community involvement</li><li>Opportunities to travel and work at our global sites<br></li></ul><strong>Be a part of Crane Payment Innovations and Crane Co.<br><br></strong>CPI is a part of Crane Co., a diversified manufacturer of highly engineered industrial products. Founded in 1855, Crane Co provides products and solutions to customers in four business segments: Aerospace &amp; Electronics, Fluid Handling, Engineered Materials, and Payment &amp; Merchandising Systems. Crane has approximately 12,000 employees in North America, South America, Europe, Asia and Australia. Crane Co. is traded on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE:CR).<br><br>Crane Co. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, disability, military status, or national origin or any other characteristic protected under federal, state, or applicable local law.

title: DevOps Support Engineer
description: <strong>Role</strong>: Axiom Developer / IT – Application Architect<br><br><strong>Start date</strong>: June<br><br>Contract through April with possibility of FTE conversion<br><br>100% remote or local to Chicago<br><br>Our client, a Chicago based global financial institution, is looking for an Axiom SL Developer to join their team. Exciting opportunity for a candidate who has a strong Axiom background and looking for their next career move.<br><br>The successful candidate will support various projects for the Cash business unit, specifically 2023 GRS NA &amp; GRS EMEA strategic projects. Will play a key role in some of the development &amp; support activities related to these projects. For example, configure objects and reports in Axiom.<br><br><u><strong>Skills – must haves:</strong></u> <ul><li>AXIOM SL – developer (not tester)</li><ul><li>3 years minimum of Axiom SL controller view development experience </li></ul><li>IT development experience (6-8 years minimum) </li><li>Axiom database maintenance </li><li>Code development – develop data models, data sources, objects </li><li>Change management – will support SAT &amp; UAT &amp; into production, post production support, batch processing, and upgrade patches </li><li>Collaboration skills – Work across different teams (QAs and Business teams) </li><li>Experience configuring regulatory reports </li><li>Communication skills </li><li>Strong references <br><br></li></ul><u><strong>Nice to have:<br></strong></u><ul><li>Work in teams internally and with vendors, in the US and India </li><li>Financial services </li><li>Regulatory Reporting &amp; Data Warehousing </li><li>US regulatory reports knowledge / experience – FFIEC031, FFIEC041, FFIEC009 etc. <br><br></li></ul><em>Heitmeyer Consulting is an equal opportunity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to minority status, gender, disability, veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.</em>

title: Senior Data Scientist, gt.school (Remote) - $60,000/year USD
description: If you are a current Chamberlain Group employee, please click here to apply through your Workday account.<p><br></p>This role is responsible for applying basic knowledge to the design and development of embedded applications on hardware platforms. The focus in this role includes creation of technical specifications, application firmware design and development, and support for manufacturing and regulatory approval. Knowledge of basic software development practices and principles is required. An Engineer 2, Firmware must support their peers in day-to-day development activities and be able to troubleshoot platform defects of limited complexity. This role will be responsible for both individual and team based software development activities<p><br></p>Job Responsibilities:<p><br></p><ul><li>Design, develop, and implement application level firmware solutions to meet business needs</li><li>Work with stakeholders to understand functional requirements of systems to accurately develop designs, implementations and test cases</li><li>Design and develop application firmware using best practices that adhere to product specifications using an Agile development process</li><li>Create and maintain technical specifications as related to product development</li><li>Work with senior engineers to implement scalable designs and modular functional blocks that meet product requirements</li><li>Use design analysis techniques such as FMEA or rate monotonic analysis to validate software designs prior to implementation. Ability to accurately document an intended design is critical</li><li>Create unit test cases that accurately test interface functionality and responses to varied inputs both in and out of scope</li><li>Analyze, troubleshoot, and resolve firmware defects as found during bench, lab, and production QA testing</li><li>Apply software quality tools such as Lint, Understand, and other static and dynamic analysis tools to verify software releases meet quality and coding standards</li><li>Support regulatory engineering for FCC and other outside agency approval of end products</li><li>Support manufacturing on site during as needed for engineering and production builds</li><li>Manage own work to deliver according to project schedules; be accountable for delivery</li><li>Actively contribute to the adoption of software architecture, best practices, and technologies</li><li>Responsible for complying with the security requirements set forth by the Information Security team and the established ISO 27001 Security Roles, Responsibilities, and Authorities Document found in the ISMS Document Library</li><li>Comply with health and safety guidelines and rules; managers should also ensure compliance across their teams</li><li>Protect Chamberlain Group’s reputation by keeping information confidential</li><li>Maintain professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops, reading professional publications, establishing personal networks, and participating in professional societies</li><li>Contribute to the team effort by accomplishing related results and participating on projects as needed</li></ul><p><br></p>Job Requirements:<p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree in computer engineering, computer science, electrical engineering, related technical field or equivalent practical experience</li><li>An advanced degree in directly applicable area of study may substitute for up to two (2) years of experience</li><li>1+ years of job-related experience as defined in the Essential Duties and Responsibilities</li><li>Able to travel up to 10% - domestically and internationally</li></ul><p><br></p>Preferred Job Requirements:<p><br></p><ul><li>Ability to work within cross functional teams to create electro-mechanical products; strong analytical skills; effective communication skills; Oriented programming experience; TCP, UPD, HTTP, WebSockets, MQTT, or other connected protocols</li><li>Agile/Scrum experience</li></ul><p><br></p>We're an organization who values its human capital and provides support to assist its employees succeed.<p><br></p>Chamberlain Group is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. You will be considered for this position based upon your experience and education, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, ancestry; marital, disabled or veteran status. We are committed to creating and maintaining a workforce environment that is free from any form of discriminations or harassment.<p><br></p>Persons with disabilities who anticipate needing accommodations for any part of the application process may contact, in confidence Recruiting@Chamberlain.com.<p><br></p>NOTE: Staffing agencies, headhunters, recruiters, and/or placement agencies, please do not contact our hiring managers via email or phone or other methods.

title: Principal Data Scientist
description: <strong><u>Company Summary</u></strong><p><br></p>Sterling Site Access Solutions LLC is a national vertically integrated site access service provider to the North American Energy Infrastructure Marketplace. An Illinois based company, with facilities located across the country, including regional construction offices, distribution centers and world class manufacturing facilities. As a data driven company, Sterling provides complete turnkey ground protection products and services to the transmission &amp; distribution, renewables, civil and oil &amp; gas markets. Sterling is committed to developing our employees, providing best in class customer service and being responsible stewards of the environment.<p><br></p><strong><u>Position Overview</u></strong><p><br></p>Each Sales Operations Analyst will play a fundamental role in achieving Sterling's ambitious growth objectives. The Sales Operations Analyst is responsible for partnering with Account Management to ensure accurate funnel data and to drive a higher level of valid input into the demand planning process. The Sales Ops Analyst will be knowledgeable about strategic opportunities through win plans, margin analyses, and bid reviews. This individual will also actively participate in the development and execution of sales process enhancements and activities by providing vital input based on his/her interactions with scenario-based challenges positively and/or negatively.<p><br></p><strong><u>Essential Functions &amp; Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Consistently ensure that business is always conducted with integrity and that behavior aligns with Sterling's values.</li><li> Build positive rapport with assigned Account Managers; provide outstanding information and explanations about Account Managers opportunities, activities, and quotes.</li><li> Assist Account Managers with creating and maintaining opportunities with impeccable data accuracy throughout the life of opportunity, including closing procedures and parent / child management.</li><li> Stay informed of Account Manager's strategic opportunities from opportunity through execution. Assist in troubleshooting issues as necessary.</li><li> Regularly scheduled 1:1 meetings with Account Managers to ensure data accuracy of all opportunities, including matting detail, and to review and update the demand planning status of current opportunities through realistic Get percentages.</li><li> Work with Account Managers to prep for monthly focused asset owner and contractor meetings and drive correct data which will flow into the demand planning process.</li><li> Create margin analysis documents that will be used to drive pre-bid discussion and firm up estimates to improve our win percentage.</li><li> Schedule win plans, bid no-bid meetings, and bid-reviews based on set thresholds to maintain strong communication between sales and operations.</li><li> Identify new and existing accounts leads and opportunities by answering telephone and/or e-mail inquiries; verify, entering information and filter to appropriate salesperson, if applicable.</li><li> Take ownership and nurture new accounts that were initially leads and work to grow those accounts in collaboration with regional sales leadership.</li><li> Drive leads through the opportunity process to job creation. In this scenario, work with the PA, Logistics and other teams as required to ensure a consistently positive customer experience.</li><li> Attend periodic sales meetings and training where applicable.</li><li> Special projects as required.</li></ul> <strong> EDUCATION, TRAINING, CERTIFICATIONS &amp; EXPERIENCE </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> High school diploma or equivalent required. College degree preferred.</li><li> 2+ years inside sales experience or sales operation experience (incoming call preferred). Proven track record of successful sales experience preferred.</li><li> Advanced Excel Skills preferred.</li><li> Experience working with Customer-Relationship Manager (CRM) software preferred.</li></ul> <strong> SKILLS &amp; KNOWLEDGE </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Technical Understanding, Building Relationships, People Skills, Data Entry Skills, Customer Focus, Professionalism, Motivation for Sales team.</li><li> Effectively communicate in English - both orally and in writing. Strong interpersonal skills.</li><li> Excellent telephone manner.</li><li> Intermediate Microsoft Office skills.</li><li> Ability to multi-task, prioritize, and manage time effectively.</li><li> Ability to present and speak to individuals or groups.</li><li> Desire to obtain a robust understanding of the products and services the company has available.</li><li> Strong decision making and analytical abilities.</li><li> Strong listening and presentation skills. Strong knowledge of sales principles, methods, practices, and techniques.</li><li> Strong problem identification and objections resolution skills.</li><li> Able to build and maintain lasting relationships with internal &amp; external customers.</li><li> Able to perform intermediate calculations and mathematical figures.</li><li> Ability to work individually and as part of a team. High level of integrity and work ethic.</li><li> Ability to multi-task and adapt to changes quickly in a fast-paced environment both within a team or independently.</li></ul> <strong> ACKNOWLEDGEMENT: </strong> This job description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to the role.

Assist in troubleshooting issues as necessary.</li><li> Regularly scheduled 1:1 meetings with Account Managers to ensure data accuracy of all opportunities, including matting detail, and to review and update the demand planning status of current opportunities through realistic Get percentages.</li><li> Work with Account Managers to prep for monthly focused asset owner and contractor meetings and drive correct data which will flow into the demand planning process.</li><li> Create margin analysis documents that will be used to drive pre-bid discussion and firm up estimates to improve our win percentage.</li><li> Schedule win plans, bid no-bid meetings, and bid-reviews based on set thresholds to maintain strong communication between sales and operations.</li><li> Identify new and existing accounts leads and opportunities by answering telephone and/or e-mail inquiries; verify, entering information and filter to appropriate salesperson, if applicable.</li><li> Take ownership and nurture new accounts that were initially leads and work to grow those accounts in collaboration with regional sales leadership.</li><li> Drive leads through the opportunity process to job creation. In this scenario, work with the PA, Logistics and other teams as required to ensure a consistently positive customer experience.</li><li> Attend periodic sales meetings and training where applicable.</li><li> Special projects as required.</li></ul> <strong> EDUCATION, TRAINING, CERTIFICATIONS &amp; EXPERIENCE </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> High school diploma or equivalent required. College degree preferred.</li><li> 2+ years inside sales experience or sales operation experience (incoming call preferred). Proven track record of successful sales experience preferred.</li><li> Advanced Excel Skills preferred.</li><li> Experience working with Customer-Relationship Manager (CRM) software preferred.</li></ul> <strong> SKILLS &amp; KNOWLEDGE </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Technical Understanding, Building Relationships, People Skills, Data Entry Skills, Customer Focus, Professionalism, Motivation for Sales team.</li><li> Effectively communicate in English - both orally and in writing. Strong interpersonal skills.</li><li> Excellent telephone manner.</li><li> Intermediate Microsoft Office skills.</li><li> Ability to multi-task, prioritize, and manage time effectively.</li><li> Ability to present and speak to individuals or groups.</li><li> Desire to obtain a robust understanding of the products and services the company has available.</li><li> Strong decision making and analytical abilities.</li><li> Strong listening and presentation skills. Strong knowledge of sales principles, methods, practices, and techniques.</li><li> Strong problem identification and objections resolution skills.</li><li> Able to build and maintain lasting relationships with internal &amp; external customers.</li><li> Able to perform intermediate calculations and mathematical figures.</li><li> Ability to work individually and as part of a team. High level of integrity and work ethic.</li><li> Ability to multi-task and adapt to changes quickly in a fast-paced environment both within a team or independently.</li></ul> <strong> ACKNOWLEDGEMENT: </strong> This job description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to the role.

title: Axiom Developer
description: <strong>Overview<br><br></strong>StoneX is seeking an experienced, energetic, enthusiastic, and hard working .NET Engineer to develop applications for a wide variety of financial products, applying knowledge of full life cycle application development. Candidate will work independently, with individual responsibility for the quality and effectiveness of applications, while working in an environment of change and growth, with exposure to and learning of cutting-edge technology. Candidate must be able to apply knowledge of application design principles, practices, systems development and analysis. Candidate will also adhere to existing design/development/QA methodologies and analyze requirements and architect new software systems while maintaining the integrity of existing applications.<br><br><strong>Responsibilities<br></strong><ul><li> Software modeling and simulation Front end GUI design</li><li> Software testing and quality assurance</li><li> Evaluate and identify new technologies for implementation</li><li> Maintaining systems by monitoring and correcting software defects</li><li> Performance tuning, improvement, balancing, usability, automation.</li><li> Support, maintain and document software functionality</li><li> Integrate new software with existing systems</li><li> Software analysis, code analysis, requirements analysis, software review, identification of code metrics, system risk analysis, software reliability analysis</li><li> Working closely with other staff, such as project managers, systems analysts, and sales and marketing professionals</li><li> Consulting with colleagues concerning the maintenance and performance of software systems and asking questions to obtain information, clarify details and implement information</li><li> Problem-solving and thinking laterally as part of a team, or individually, to meet the needs of the project.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Qualifications<br><br></strong>## Qualifications:<br><ul><li> Successful candidates must have a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science/Information Systems</li><li> Must be authorized to work in the US for any employer.</li><li> Minimally 2-4 years of UI framework experience with React (preferred) or similar technologies.</li><li> 6+ years of professional front end, web, or mobile software developing with C#, .Net, or MVC frameworks.</li><li> Extensive client/server programming skills, specializing in Microsoft products and technologies</li><li> Solid skills in performing the entire software development life cycle including designing, coding and testing</li><li> Strong knowledge of object oriented principles and design</li><li> Excellent problem solving skills</li><li> Proven experience with containerization (Docker, Kubernetes)</li><li> Proven experience with cloud platforms (Azure)</li><li> Proven exposure to distributed messaging / streaming platforms (Apache Kafka)</li><li> Strong understanding in design, development and debugging of multithreading software projects</li><li> Must be able to learn, understand and apply new technologies, as well as mentor and train others in using new technologies.</li><li> Sought out for technical guidance; anticipates technical issues at the product level and makes architectural and design decisions to avoid them.</li><li> Preferred skills also include C / C++ / Win32</li></ul>

title: Sales Operations Analyst
description: <strong>Sports Betting Company Looking For a Front End Developer</strong><p><br></p>This Jobot Job is hosted by: Caitlin Johnson<p><br></p>Are you a fit? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button and sending us your resume.<p><br></p>Salary: $90,000 - $150,000 per year<p><br></p><strong>A bit about us:</strong><p><br></p>We are pushing the boundaries of AI. An exciting new AI company founded with the goal of democratizing state-of-the-art AI. The AI Acceleration Platform optimizes the biggest ML models to be smaller, faster, and cheaper so companies can easily access and scale towards the best performance. Imagine a day where large language models like T5 or GPT-3 are used everywhere - that's our vision. We are a team of ML engineers and researchers helping make ML more effective by implementing and advancing the latest research in AI for AI and hardware-software optimizations.<p><br></p>We are a spin-off from research at Harvard University conducted through support of the NSF, DARPA, Intel, IBM, ARM, Samsung, TSMC and others. Started with support from Harvard University Physical Sciences and Engineering Accelerator Award and Harvard Allston Venture Fund, we are backed by executives from top tech companies such as Google, Twitter, Yelp, etc. and VCs including three from the top 10 list.<p><br></p><strong>Why join us?</strong><p><br></p>We are a spin-off from research at Harvard University conducted through support of the NSF, DARPA, Intel, IBM, ARM, Samsung, TSMC and others. Started with support from Harvard University Physical Sciences and Engineering Accelerator Award and Harvard Allston Venture Fund, we are backed by executives from top tech companies such as Google, Twitter, Yelp, etc. and VCs including three from the top 10 list.<p><br></p><strong>Job Details</strong><p><br></p><strong>Requirements</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Computer Science degree or qualification in a related field</li><li> Minimum 2 years of experience related to this role</li><li> Solid experience in Javascript/HTML/CSS including ReactJS and NodeJS</li><li> Experience in NoSQL, REST and microservices architecture</li><li> Proficiency in written and spoken English</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Develop clean web interactions using React</li><li> Create and maintain API endpoints integrated with the system</li><li> Help design and build the tech stack to ensure high system scalability and reliability</li><li> Manage specification, development, testing and releasing of new features</li></ul><p><br></p>You Are a Good Fit If You Have<p><br></p><ul><li> Extensive experience in designing, developing, or maintaining scalable web services</li><li> Experience working on large-scale systems and enterprise software</li><li> Expertise in application, data, and infrastructure architecture disciplines</li><li> Familiarity with CI/CD tools and deployment processes</li><li> Understanding best practices and current trends.</li></ul><p><br></p>Strong Pluses<p><br></p><ul><li> Past experience working at a SaaS company</li><li> Experience working with Amazon Web Services</li></ul><p><br></p>Interested in hearing more? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button.

title: VMWare Firmware Engineer
description: <p><strong>ABOUT OUR CLIENT / ABOUT THE ROLE<br><br></strong></p><p>At Medix, we are dedicated to creating opportunities for talent in Information Technology. Our dedicated recruiters offer personalized service to make sure we truly understand your employment needs. We are currently seeking a System Engineer to join one of our top clients.<br><br></p><p>Who we are working with is an IT consulting firm headquartered in the Chicagoland area and they are looking to add an additional .NET Developer to their team to help in the development of their in-house configurable SaaS product and to focus on their new client implementation teams. The ideal candidate would have experience supporting a product like Salesforce or, a proprietary system that has then been implemented or sold to a client and at least 6+ years of experience in .NET development<br><br></p><p> <br><br></p><p><strong>Benefits<br><br></strong></p><p>The many perks tied to this position include but are not limited too: medical, dental, and vision coverage, retirement plans, PTO &amp; sick time, along with eligibility for yearly bonuses. <br><br></p><p><strong>Responsibilities<br><br></strong></p><ul><li>Working with product owners to remove obstacles, review design, and ensure releases meet the needs of stakeholders.</li><li>Software development when necessary including design and coding standards.</li><li>Leading technical product design sessions.</li><li>Leading the agile development process, including planning, scheduling, and assigning work; coordinating agile rituals; and supporting team members</li><li>Mentoring team members across design, coding practices, and software development policies and guidelines.</li><li>The .NET candidates will need some WPF and C# expertise, but the teams will be mainly focused on their new client implementation teams. </li></ul><p><strong>Qualifications<br><br></strong></p><ul><li>6+ years of experience in .Net Development</li><li>Experience in a commercial software development team</li><li>Supporting a product like Salesforce or a proprietary system that is then implemented/sold to a client</li><li>SQL</li><li>C#</li><li>Azure </li><li>ASP .Net</li></ul><p><strong>Nice to Have<br><br></strong></p><ul><li>8+ years of experience in software development as a full-stack developer.</li><li>2+ years of engineering leadership experience.</li><li>2+ architecting application, product, and/or platform solutions.</li><li>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field</li></ul>

title: Junior Java Developer
description: <strong>Company Overview<br><br></strong>At Motorola Solutions, we believe that everything starts with safety. It’s the constant that empowers people to confidently move forward. It can fill a flight or sell out a stadium. It can care for a patient or graduate a class.<br><br>As a global leader in public safety and enterprise security, we create and connect the technologies that help to keep people safe where they live, learn, work and play. Our integrated technology ecosystem unifies critical communications, video security and access control, and command center software, enabling collaboration in more powerful ways.<br><br>At Motorola Solutions, we’re ushering in a new era in public safety and security. Bring your passion, potential and talents to a career that matters.<br><br><strong>Department Overview<br><br></strong>Motorola Solutions is building talent pipelines to meet future hiring demands. This is a pipeline role, while there is not an immediate opening, we want to build relationships with prospective candidates like you. If your background is a match to our requirements, we’ll follow up with an exploratory conversation.<br><br><strong>Job Description<br><br></strong><strong>Must be a U.S. citizen with ability to obtain necessary security clearance as required by government contract. Some contracts may have higher-level clearance requirements.<br><br></strong>Candidates for this position are electrical, computer, or software engineers with strong programming skills who demonstrate curiosity, continuous learning, and an ability to adapt. Ideal candidates have a background in digital signal processing and Artificial Intelligence / Machine Learning along with diverse knowledge and a wide variety of interests, especially in cellular / wireless communications. Hands on experience in embedded software development is also beneficial.<br><br>You will be a member of a small (2-6 person) multi-disciplinary team and will be responsible for implementing and testing digital signal processing and AI/ML solutions for a variety of advanced Software Defined Radio (SDR) and other platforms. You must be a flexible, results-oriented problem-solver who requires minimal supervision and can multitask. Projects can vary greatly from one to the next, so you must thrive on variety and enjoy taking on new challenges. You will have the opportunity to create proof-of-concept and low-volume specialty communications products for government and private industry.<br><br>Daily Responsibilities:<br><ul><li>Responsible for design, implementation, and testing of complex embedded software applications for state-of-the-art small form factor SDR platforms</li><li>Participate in cutting edge artificial intelligence (AI) research and product development, focused on embedded, edge device wireless communication systems. </li><li>Develop solutions for real world systems, leveraging AI/ML algorithms for standalone products and to enhance existing Applied Technology offerings. </li><li>Regular interaction with customers for requirements capture, design support, and demonstrations</li><li>Meaningfully communicate with members of all engineering disciplines (hardware, RF, software, FPGA, etc) as well as management</li><li>Collaborate with multi-disciplinary product development teams to identify performance improvement opportunities and integrate trained models. </li><li>Hands-on interaction with product hardware for developing and debugging. <br><br></li></ul>Preferred Qualifications:<br><ul><li>Less than 5 years of experience in software development or AI/ML research and development</li><li>Experience with AI/ML frameworks (TensorFlow and Pytorch) and knowledge of neural network fundamentals. </li><li>Experience with GPU programming with CUDA, OpenCL and/or GPU-based software acceleration libraries</li><li>Understanding of real-time embedded software design and experience programming in Linux, C, C++, Python and other software languages and operating systems</li><li>Working knowledge of basic wireless communication theory</li><li>Experience with the implementation of digital signal processing blocks</li><li>Experience with digital signal processing system design and analysis using MATLAB</li><li>Projects can vary greatly from one to the next, so you must thrive on variety and enjoy taking on new challenges. </li><li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills. </li><li>Agile software development and/or Git/JIRA experience is a plus. <br><br></li></ul><strong>Basic Requirements<br></strong><ul><li>Must be a U.S. citizen with ability to obtain necessary security clearance as required by government contract. Some contracts may have higher-level clearance requirements. </li><li>Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or related technical field<br><br></li></ul><strong>Vaccine Requirement<br><br></strong>Motorola Solutions has implemented a voluntary COVID-19 vaccination policy. We strongly encourage all employees to be fully vaccinated. Additionally, certain local governments or Motorola Solutions' customers may have vaccine requirements that apply to some of our employees. These employees are required to submit proof of vaccination to Motorola Solutions and maintain compliance with these requirements.<br><br><strong>Travel Requirements<br><br></strong>None<br><br><strong>Relocation Provided<br><br></strong>None<br><br><strong>Position Type<br><br></strong>Experienced<br><br><strong>Referral Payment Plan<br><br></strong>No<br><br><strong>Our U.S. Benefits include:<br></strong><ul><li>Incentive Bonus Plans</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision benefits</li><li>401K with Company Match</li><li>9 Paid Holidays</li><li>Generous Paid Time Off Packages</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li><li>Paid Parental &amp; Family Leave</li><li>and more!<br><br></li></ul><em><strong>EEO Statement<br><br></strong></em>Motorola Solutions is an Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran's status, or, any other protected characteristic.<br><br>

title: .Net Developer
description: At CLA we create inspired careers.<br><br>We recognize that not everyone wants to grow their career in the same way. That’s why CLA exists to create opportunities. We promise to know you and help you.<br><br>CLA, one of the nation’s largest public accounting and professional services firm is currently seeking a<strong> Lead CRM Developer</strong> to join the growing IT organization team.<br><br><strong><u>Position Summary<br><br></u></strong>The <strong>Lead CRM Developer</strong> brings their understanding of CRM processes, technology and data to help optimize and expand our existing and future technology stack, processes and people. The lead brings in extensive knowledge and use of Dynamics as a CRM platform along with experience with enhancing functionality through familiarity and use of Microsoft’s Power Platform and Microsoft Dataverse to drive and extend CLA back-office functionality. Finally, the Senior CRM Developer aligns closely with the Product Owner of the Microsoft Dynamics CRM database.<br><br><strong><u>The Lead CRM Developer Will</u></strong><ul><li>Lead the development of the Microsoft Dynamics CRM database to support the marketing technology stack and business processes as directed by the Marketing Technology Manager and CRM Product Owner. </li><li>Review and create CRM customizations including:</li><ul><li>Form/entity updates</li><li>Business process flows</li><li>Plugins</li><li>Javascript/HTML</li><li>PowerApps solutions</li><li>Power Automate flows</li><li>Custom HTML interfaces (web resources)</li><li>Data integrations/migrations</li><li>SQL updates</li><li>And various reporting technologies like Power BI and SSRS</li><li> Own processes driven and dependent on the Microsoft Dynamics CRM database, including support, maintenance, documentation, enablement, and enhancements.</li><li> Troubleshoot data integrity, errors, and Microsoft Dynamics CRM performance issues. Pressure testing of development for scalable solutions.</li><li> Partner with Product Owner, marketing automation team, analysts, and Marketing Technology Manager for developing reporting and streamlined business processes.</li><li> Act as a lead for developers and provide oversite and recommendations on development.</li><li> Act as a change agent by identifying and implementing appropriate improvements ensuring processes are automated and can scale at an enterprise level. This also includes staying current with technology and cloud trends.</li><li>Translate and design solutions for business requirements / user stories based on direction from Product Owner<br></li></ul><strong><u>The Ideal Candidate Has<br></u></strong><ul><li> At least 10 years of experience with CRM systems, MS Dynamics preferred. Five plus years in a developer role.</li><li> Experience with implementing third-party integrations into and out Microsoft Dynamics CRM, including a marketing automation platform.<br></li></ul><strong>Education <br></strong><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in computer science, information technology, or related field required.<br></li></ul>Equal Opportunity Employer /AA Employer/Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities.<br><br>Click here to learn about your hiring rights.<br><br><strong>Wellness at CLA<br><br></strong>To support our CLA family members, we focus on their physical, financial, social, and emotional well-being and offer comprehensive benefit options that include health, dental, vision, 401k and much more.<br><br>To view a complete list of benefits click here.<br><br></ul>

title: Business Analyst II
description: <strong>ABOUT US</strong>:<br><br>Braintrust is a user-owned talent network that connects you with great jobs with no fees or membership costs—so you keep 100% of what you earn.<br><br><strong>ABOUT THE HIRING PROCESS:<br><br></strong>When you join Braintrust, you will be invited to a screening process for Braintrust to learn more about your previous work experiences. Once completed, you will have access to the employer for this role and other top companies that seek high-quality talent. Apply to this job to kick off the process.<br><ul><li>JOB TYPE: Direct Hire Position (no agencies/C2C - see notes below)</li><li>LOCATION: Remote - United States</li><li>SALARY: $125,000 – $160,000/yr</li><li>ESTIMATED DURATION: 40hr/week - Long term<br><br></li></ul><strong>THE OPPORTUNITY<br><br></strong><strong>Requirements<br><br></strong><strong>Required Qualifications <br></strong><ul><li>5+ years technical software experience </li><li>Proficiency with fundamental front-end languages such as HTML, CSS, and JavaScript</li><li>Proficiency with server-side languages such as PHP</li><li>Proficiency with database technology such as SQL Server and MySQL</li><li>Database design and management, including being up on the latest practices and associated versions</li><li>Strong understanding of software architecture, data structures, and computer science fundamentals </li><li>Strong security background (comfortable working with PII/sensitive data)</li><li>Experience with agile and fast-paced software development methodologies </li><li>Strong organizational, project management, and communication skills</li><li>Good problem-solving skills</li><li>Attention to detail<br><br></li></ul><strong>Preferred Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li>Prior experience working and communicating directly with clients</li><li>Laravel and Node.js experience helpful</li><li>Familiarity with CSS preprocessors, bundlers, and associated languages/syntaxes/libraries (e.g., Sass, Less, and webpack)</li><li>An eye for design and user experience</li><li>Technical literacy and hands-on experience across the software stack, infrastructure, and dev-ops</li><li>Knowledge of Enterprise HR systems (WorkDay, SuccessFactors, Oracle, SAP)</li><li>Proficiency with Git</li><li>Appreciation for clean and well documented code</li></ul> <strong><strong>What you’ll be working on<br><br></strong></strong>Full Stack Software Engineer, you will be working on the design, architecture, development, and innovation of customized HR software for some of the world’s most sophisticated companies. You will use PHP, SQL, JavaScript, and CSS to deploy software quickly to meet their needs. Our work is fast-paced, creative, and flexible–your days will be too! You will spend time problem solving with clients live, helping them see the range of what’s possible, building what they need, and working directly with HR experts. You will work alongside client team-members and thrive on the responsibility to own large projects from conceptualization to sunset.<br><br><strong>Responsibilities<br></strong><ul><li>Build the software development process from conception to deployment </li><li>Maintaining and upgrading the software following deployment </li><li>Managing the end-to-end life cycle for the production of software and applications </li><li>Modifying and testing changes to previously developed applications </li><li>Deliver high quality code in a fast and efficient manner </li><li>Must be fluent in all things PHP, MySQL, and Javascript </li><li>Develop front-end and back-end software using PHP/MySQL and HTML/Javascript/CSS with Vue.js or React.js </li><li>Identify and mitigate end-to-end security concerns </li><li>Ensuring the entire stack is designed and built for speed and scalability </li><li>Mentoring other engineers </li><li>Work across the organization to foster a culture of architecture that allows for iterative, autonomous development and future scaling. <br><br></li></ul><strong>Apply Now!<br><br></strong>Braintrust Job ID: 6496<br><br>C2C Candidates: This role is not available to C2C candidates working with an agency. If you are a professional contractor who has created an LLC/corp around their consulting practice, this is well aligned with Braintrust and we’d welcome your application.<br><br>Braintrust values the multitude of talents and perspectives that a diverse workforce brings. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.

title: Front End Developer
description: CNH Industrial is a world-class equipment and services company dedicated to advancing the noble work of agriculture and construction workers. Driven by our shared purpose of Breaking New Ground, we are passionate about bringing Innovation, Sustainability, and Productivity to all that we do. As a truly global company, CNH Industrial’s 37,000+ employees form part of a diverse and inclusive workplace, focused on empowering customers to grow, and build, a better world through our core brands: Case IH, STEYR, New Holland Agriculture, CASE, and New Holland Construction.<p><br></p>In Precision Technology, we make iron smarter. Our team members deliver innovative solutions helping our customers to be more productive, save time, lower costs, and to operate sustainably. From vehicle displays, application controls, steering solutions, digital services and telematics, to fully autonomous driverless technology, we develop solutions that solve challenges for customers around the world.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p>As an <strong>Embedded Software Engineer for Auto Guidance applications, </strong>you will become a contributing member of a team, focused on the development of Auto Guidance and GNSS embedded software applications that run on CNHi’s next-generation embedded controllers. The software you create will control various functions of CNHi tractors, sprayers, and harvesters and enable a wide range of Auto guidance features.<p><br><br></p><ul><li>Design, develop, test, and debug software components used for electronically controlled systems on various Agriculture &amp; Forestry products while working within a defined development framework and coding standards</li><li>Participate within a SAFe Agile-based software development team and collaborate with cross-functional product design teams developing various Precision Agriculture features</li><li>Participate in SAFe Agile daily standups, Sprint/PI Planning, Sprint Demos, Retros, and other Sprint Events</li><li>Utilize software tools and electronic instruments to troubleshoot and debug embedded system<br></li></ul><p><br></p>This role pays-$101,000-$146,000 plus any applicable bonus (Actual salaries will vary and will be based on various factors , such as skill, experience and qualification for the role.)<p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br><br></p><ul><li>Engineer with 2+ years of career experience, with Bachelors' degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Electrical Engineering. 1+ years’ experience with master’s degree. Or equivalent combination of education and experience.</li><li>2+ years of experience designing &amp; developing embedded / electronic systems from concept to release</li><li>Experience in Electrical and/or Software Engineering performing analysis, design, and testing for embedded software projects</li><li>Experience with Embedded C, C++ programming languages<br></li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br><br></p><ul><li>Experience Model Based Software Design, preferably MathWorks (Simulink/Stateflow/Real-Time Workshop)</li><li>Understanding of Automotive networking protocols such as CAN, J1939</li><li>Experience with embedded systems tools such as compilers, debuggers, simulators, etc.</li><li>Experience with software versioning, repository management, and package management tools</li><li>Experience with continuous integration development, using automated build and test practices</li><li>Experience in embedded systems design with preemptive, multitasking real-time operating systems</li><li>Experience in Embedded Software Development for mobile equipment applications</li><li>Experience with Electro-Hydraulic or vehicle control systems for on/off-highway vehicle systems</li><li>Experience with automated testing (LABview, CAPL, etc)</li><li>Team player who is self-motivated and can work with minimal supervision</li><li>Familiarity with Agile development, Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe), or similar methodologies</li><li>Familiarity with Java programming language</li><li>Prior experience with Linux OS (Ubuntu)<br></li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Company Benefits</strong><p><br></p>CNH Industrial offers a wide variety of benefits that not only encourages wellness and preventive care, but we also provide the right tools and programs to help you achieve it. Our benefits package includes medical, dental, vision, disability, and life insurance. Our industry leading 401k will support you in meeting your retirement objectives. Additional benefits include paid parental leave, flexible work policies, opportunities for self-development and paid leave for specific activities. Click here for more information!<p><br></p><strong> EEO </strong><p><br></p>US applicants: CNH Industrial is an equal opportunity employer. This company considers candidates regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status. Applicants can learn more about their rights by viewing the federal "EEO is the Law" poster and its supplement here . CNH Industrial participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S. You can view additional information here.<p><br></p>If you need reasonable accommodation with the application process, please contact us at narecruitingmailbox@cnhind.com.<p><br></p>Read about our company’s commitment to pay transparency by clicking this link: pay transparency notice .<p><br></p>Canada applicants: CNH Industrial is an equal opportunity employer. This company considers candidates regardless of race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, nationality, place of origin, disability, marital status, family status, age, or any other ground prohibited by applicable provincial human rights legislation.
