Our team members deliver innovative solutions helping our customers to be more productive, save time, lower costs, and to operate sustainably. From vehicle displays, application controls, steering solutions, digital services and telematics, to fully autonomous driverless technology, we develop solutions that solve challenges for customers around the world.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p>As an <strong>Embedded Software Engineer for Auto Guidance applications, </strong>you will become a contributing member of a team, focused on the development of Auto Guidance and GNSS embedded software applications that run on CNHi’s next-generation embedded controllers. The software you create will control various functions of CNHi tractors, sprayers, and harvesters and enable a wide range of Auto guidance features.<p><br><br></p><ul><li>Design, develop, test, and debug software components used for electronically controlled systems on various Agriculture &amp; Forestry products while working within a defined development framework and coding standards</li><li>Participate within a SAFe Agile-based software development team and collaborate with cross-functional product design teams developing various Precision Agriculture features</li><li>Participate in SAFe Agile daily standups, Sprint/PI Planning, Sprint Demos, Retros, and other Sprint Events</li><li>Utilize software tools and electronic instruments to troubleshoot and debug embedded system<br></li></ul><p><br></p>This role pays-$101,000-$146,000 plus any applicable bonus (Actual salaries will vary and will be based on various factors , such as skill, experience and qualification for the role.)<p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br><br></p><ul><li>Engineer with 2+ years of career experience, with Bachelors' degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Electrical Engineering. 1+ years’ experience with master’s degree. Or equivalent combination of education and experience.</li><li>2+ years of experience designing &amp; developing embedded / electronic systems from concept to release</li><li>Experience in Electrical and/or Software Engineering performing analysis, design, and testing for embedded software projects</li><li>Experience with Embedded C, C++ programming languages<br></li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br><br></p><ul><li>Experience Model Based Software Design, preferably MathWorks (Simulink/Stateflow/Real-Time Workshop)</li><li>Understanding of Automotive networking protocols such as CAN, J1939</li><li>Experience with embedded systems tools such as compilers, debuggers, simulators, etc.</li><li>Experience with software versioning, repository management, and package management tools</li><li>Experience with continuous integration development, using automated build and test practices</li><li>Experience in embedded systems design with preemptive, multitasking real-time operating systems</li><li>Experience in Embedded Software Development for mobile equipment applications</li><li>Experience with Electro-Hydraulic or vehicle control systems for on/off-highway vehicle systems</li><li>Experience with automated testing (LABview, CAPL, etc)</li><li>Team player who is self-motivated and can work with minimal supervision</li><li>Familiarity with Agile development, Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe), or similar methodologies</li><li>Familiarity with Java programming language</li><li>Prior experience with Linux OS (Ubuntu)<br></li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Company Benefits</strong><p><br></p>CNH Industrial offers a wide variety of benefits that not only encourages wellness and preventive care, but we also provide the right tools and programs to help you achieve it. Our benefits package includes medical, dental, vision, disability, and life insurance. Our industry leading 401k will support you in meeting your retirement objectives. Additional benefits include paid parental leave, flexible work policies, opportunities for self-development and paid leave for specific activities. Click here for more information!<p><br></p><strong> EEO </strong><p><br></p>US applicants: CNH Industrial is an equal opportunity employer. This company considers candidates regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status. Applicants can learn more about their rights by viewing the federal "EEO is the Law" poster and its supplement here . CNH Industrial participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S. You can view additional information here.<p><br></p>If you need reasonable accommodation with the application process, please contact us at narecruitingmailbox@cnhind.com.<p><br></p>Read about our company’s commitment to pay transparency by clicking this link: pay transparency notice .<p><br></p>Canada applicants: CNH Industrial is an equal opportunity employer. This company considers candidates regardless of race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, nationality, place of origin, disability, marital status, family status, age, or any other ground prohibited by applicable provincial human rights legislation.

title: .Net Developer
description: Support existing Commercial &amp; Planning Applications, including SOI, EOR, Queue, Legacy Order Entry. These applications are business critical as they are all related to Order Fulfillment. <strong>THIS POSITION IS REQUIRED TO BE ONSITE<br><br></strong><strong><u>Responsibilities<br><br></u></strong>Develop, support, modify, test &amp; implement various web and windows project and change requests. Individual needs to be an expert in the technology in order to complete the programming work quickly and cost effectively. Experience in the entire SDLC will be required as they will be working directly with business departments for requirements gathering and will create their own functional and technical specs and then continue on to the development, testing, implementation, and support. Daily activities will include being assigned maintenance change requests, working with the business areas to further refine the specifications for the request, creation of functional &amp; technical specs, testing (unit and business approval), implementing, and supporting the changes. There is a possibility to do new development/project work as well. They will design and implement a Microsoft Dev Ops solution in the web and windows area.<br><br><strong><u>Minimum Requirements<br></u></strong><ul><li>Extensive experience in the Microsoft Development stack: ASP.net, ASP.net Core, ASP.net Core Identity Security, MVC, SQL, C#, Bootstrap, Entity Framework, LINQ, JQuery, MS Visual Studio, JS, AJAX, TFS. </li><li>Excellent SQL Server skills including experience with SQL Server 2012, 2016 and 2019. </li><li>Deep understanding of T-SQL, complex Joins, Stored Procedures, and Triggers. </li><li>Deep understanding of the fundamental technologies of the web: HTTP, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and JSON. </li><li>Understanding of common Object-Oriented programing concepts. </li><li>Experience and understanding of the full SDLC including gathering business requirements, designing solutions, and working with stakeholders to test and implement the solutions you build. </li><li>Experience working on large enterprise applications. </li><li>Ability to work independently </li><li>Participation in at least two enterprise development projects </li><li>Office 365 Microsoft tools </li><li>Strong verbal and written communication skills </li><li>Experience designing and implementing Dev Ops in a production environment (at least 1 significant project).<br></li></ul><strong><u>Preferred Requirements<br></u></strong><ul><li>SSAS, Bootstrap, Classic ASP, VB6 </li><li>Two years or more project lead experience or direct business contact. </li><li>Experience with SQL Server Reporting Services, SQL Server Integration Services and Microsoft Power BI. </li><li>Microsoft Certified Professional with 8+ years of web/windows development experience </li><li>Manufacturing or Steel experience </li><li>Understanding of SAP S/4 HANA (1709 or higher) <br></li></ul><strong><u>Education Requirements<br></u></strong><ul><li>Relevant 4 year degree or equivalent experience <br></li></ul>Required Skills : title: Machine Learning Engineer (Clearable)
description: <ul><li>Flex Time - OT pay on top of competitive base salary|401K, profit sharing, and continuous growth opportunities<br><br><br></li></ul><strong>About Our Client<br><br></strong>My client is one the tech sector of a conglomeration of companies (other sects include accountancy and equipment leasing) and needs a strong candidate to help in a wide variety of forward-facing projects. The tech team works in 3 different businesses: 1) Enterprise development, 2) contracting out developers to clients depending on needs, and 3) implementations and integration. Most projects they have are in React and .NET with SQL servers. Due to the consultancy work, having a more diverse tech stack is a plus. The compensation for this role given the experience is a little on the lower end, but they make up for it in Flex Hours which pays OT for all time worked over the standard 8 hours/day. 8 hours/day on a $100k salary comes out to $100k/year, but 9 hours/day is 112,500 annually and so on. If you're ambitious to grow your career by working more than 40 hours a week, this job is for you.<br><br><strong>This role requires coming into the office 2 days a week.<br><br></strong><strong>The candidate for this role must be a US citizen or Green Card holder. Since this is an urgent hire, the client will not be able to provide visa sponsorship.<br><br></strong><strong>Job Description<br><br></strong>The successful Software Engineer will:<br><ul><li>Architect and develop custom enterprise applications using the Microsoft technology stack and the Angular (or React) framework.</li><li>Lead architecture discussions and documentation around application design and development.</li><li>Manage development teams and support of applications.</li><li>Deploy systems to various production and pre-production environments and troubleshoot issues.</li><li>Create technical documentation such as design documents, specifications, software architecture documents, and instructions.</li><li>Regularly communicate with product owners and interpret requirements.</li><li>Work in a team environment using agile development processes and deliver work on time and within budget.</li><li>Follow up with issues in an efficient manner, including working hand-in-hand with Quality Assurance, Project Management, and/or senior developers.</li><li>Regularly communicate project progress, issues, and risks to team and managers.</li><li>Handle code reviews and quality checks.</li><li>Continue to learn and adapt to new languages and technologies.<br><br></li></ul><strong>This role requires coming into the office 2 days a week.<br><br></strong><strong>The candidate for this role must be a US citizen or Green Card holder. Since this is an urgent hire, the client will not be able to provide visa sponsorship.<br><br></strong><em>MPI does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, or based on an individual's status in any group or class protected by applicable federal, state or local law. MPI encourages applications from minorities, women, the disabled, protected veterans and all other qualified applicants.<br><br></em><strong>The Successful Applicant<br><br></strong>The successful Software Engineer has:<br><ul><li>Bachelor's degree or higher in a related field.</li><li>Minimum of 5 years' working experience and strong understanding and exposure to Microsoft .NET. and React</li><li>Minimum of 5 years' working experience and strong understanding and exposure to MS SQL Server and SQL coding.</li><li>Experience in WPF would be a plus</li><li>Strong working experience in responsive website design.</li><li>Working experience in agile development and Microsoft DevOps (or other tools such as JIRA).</li><li>Microsoft Certifications in related areas is a plus.</li><li>Master's degree in technology-related areas is a plus.<br><br></li></ul><strong>This role requires coming into the office 2 days a week.<br><br></strong><strong>The candidate for this role must be a US citizen or Green Card holder. Since this is an urgent hire, the client will not be able to provide visa sponsorship.<br><br></strong><strong>What's On Offer<br><br></strong>What's on offer for a successful Software Engineer?<br><ul><li>Competitive salary ranging from $120K - $150K on the base (not including yearly bonus &amp; flex-time OT pay)</li><li>Flex Time - OT pay after the 40-hour workweek</li><li>Performance Bonus</li><li>Comprehensive Medical, Dental, Vision &amp; Basic Life Insurance.</li><li>401K and Profit Sharing (starting at 3%)</li><li>Continuing Education</li><li>Fitness Program</li><li>Emerging Tech</li><li>Short-term/Long-term disability coverage.</li><li>Flexible Time Off Program.<br><br></li></ul><strong>This role requires coming into the office 2 days a week.<br><br></strong><strong>The candidate for this role must be a US citizen or Green Card holder. Since this is an urgent hire, the client will not be able to provide visa sponsorship.<br><br></strong><strong>Contact: Emily Bodett<br><br></strong><strong>Quote job ref: JN-052023-6060324</strong>

title: Lead Dynamics CRM Developer
description: Description:<br>  <br>  Job Title: Exchange Traded Derivatives Operations Transformation and Change Analyst<br>  <br>  Who we are:<br>  <br>  Global Collateral Operations &amp; Exchange Traded Derivatives Operations (GCO &amp; ETD Ops) are responsible for the exchange of collateral to reduce counterparty credit risk and for the support of post-execution trade clearing and product lifecycle management. Our global team consists of a diverse pool of over 500 individuals spanning 16 cities across 7 countries. We provide front-to back support for a broad range of Clients (hedge funds, market makers, trading firms, advisers and investment banks), Global Market products and businesses including:<br>  • Futures and Options &amp; OTC Cleared (F&amp;O)<br>  • Prime Brokerage (PB)<br>  • Global Wealth &amp; Investment Management (GWIM)<br>  • OTC Bi-lateral Derivatives (OTC)<br>  <br>  ETD Operations supports:<br>  • Execution, clearing and allocation of trades and position transfers to the highest quality standards<br>  • Futures and Options position life cycle management including Corporate Action and Credit Event processing, Open Interest reporting and Exercise, Assignment and Deliveries<br>  • Daily Reconciliations and exception resolution, maintaining the integrity of the sub ledger for Listed and OTC Futures and Options product<br>  • Non-Financial Regulatory Reporting to Futures Exchanges and Regulators<br>  • Ensuring compliance with regulatory and industry mandates across 15 Legal Entities<br>  • Production of reports and information required to comply with regulatory requirements and internal control policies<br>  • Researching and resolving problems within the line of business<br>  • Day-to-day analysis, research, and resolution of varied problems<br>  <br>  The Team:<br>  <br>  The ETD Operations Clearing Infrastructure Solutions and Strategy team drives and facilitates the change agenda for Futures and Options and OTC Cleared Operations. The team works with ETD BAU teams based in Chicago, Charlotte, Chester, London and Singapore, other Operations teams, Front Office partners and Technology to deliver Enterprise and Regulatory change programs, new business ideas and operational excellence improvements ensuring cross product and efficient solutions are delivered with no impact to risk or stability. ETD Operations have embarked on an ambitious program to refresh their end-to-end technology platforms.<br>  <br>  Role Description:<br>  <br>  • Product high quality program reporting for Managing Director including capture and maintaining projects in *** program management tool. Present program status in existing governance routines<br>  • Work with BAU teams to identify and agree user requirements for strategic Cleared Derivatives architecture solutions<br>  • Work with BAU teams to understand impact of Regulatory change and inform design of strategic solutions for implementation<br>  • For funded projects track UAT status including schedules, resourcing, environments, scripts, and results reporting<br>  • Provide ad hoc support across Change book of work<br>  Core Skills:<br>  <br>  • Experience of having worked on a change initiative with strategic deliverables required<br>  • Confident communicator who can convey complex messages to a wide audience and is adept at negotiating and navigating at all levels across an organisation<br>  • Instance credibility across ETD Experience of Exchange Traded Derivatives Execution or Clearing Operations, or previously worked in a supporting BAU process<br>  • Experience of using an Exchange Traded Derivatives clearing platform beneficial but not essential<br>  • Experience in driving process forward independently whilst seeking steer and guidance as and when necessary<br>  • Candidate should be intellectually curious and understand what drives processes

title: RedCAT Systems - Full Stack Software Engineer - Direct Hire [Remote]
description: If you are a current Chamberlain Group employee, please click here to apply through your Workday account.<p><br></p><strong>Job Summary</strong><p><br></p>This role is responsible for applying skilled knowledge to the design and development of embedded applications on hardware platforms. The focus in this role includes creation of technical specifications, application firmware design and development, and support for manufacturing and regulatory approval. Knowledge of basic software development practices and principles is required. An Engineer 3, Firmware must support their peers in day-to-day development activities and be able to troubleshoot platform defects of average complexity. This role will be responsible for both individual and team based software development activities.<p><br></p><strong><u>Job Responsibilities: </u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Design, develop, and implement application level firmware solutions to meet business needs</li><li>Work with stakeholders to understand functional requirements of systems to accurately develop designs, implementations and test cases</li><li>Design and develop application firmware using best practices that adhere to product specifications using an Agile development process</li><li>Create and maintain technical specifications as related to product development</li><li>Work with senior engineers to implement scalable designs and modular functional blocks that meet product requirements</li><li>Use design analysis techniques such as FMEA or rate monotonic analysis to validate software designs prior to implementation. Ability to accurately document an intended design is critical</li><li>Create unit test cases that accurately test interface functionality and responses to varied inputs both in and out of scope</li><li>Analyze, troubleshoot, and resolve firmware defects as found during bench, lab, and production QA testing</li><li>Apply software quality tools such as Lint, Understand, and other static and dynamic analysis tools to verify software releases meet quality and coding standards</li><li>Support regulatory engineering for FCC and other outside agency approval of end products</li><li>Support manufacturing on site during as needed for engineering and production builds</li><li>Manage own work to deliver according to project schedules; be accountable for delivery</li><li>Actively contribute to the adoption of software architecture, best practices, and technologies</li><li>Responsible for complying with the security requirements set forth by the Information Security team and the established ISO 27001 Security Roles, Responsibilities, and Authorities Document found in the ISMS Document Library</li><li>Comply with health and safety guidelines and rules; managers should also ensure compliance across their teams</li><li>Protect CGI’s reputation by keeping information confidential</li><li>Maintain professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops, professional publications, establishing personal networks, and participating in professional societies</li><li>Contribute to the team effort by accomplishing related results and participating on projects as needed</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Job Requirements: </u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree in computer engineering, computer science, or electrical engineering and minimum of three (3) years of job-related experience strongly preferred; or minimum of seven (7) years of job-related experience as defined above in the Essential Functions section</li><li>An advanced degree in directly applicable area of study may substitute for up to two (2) years of experience</li><li>Flexibility to travel up to 10% of time; international travel required</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred Qualifications:</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Ability to work within a cross functional teams to create electro-mechanical products, understanding and participation in Scrum and Agile methodology; description_json: If you are a current Chamberlain Group employee, please click here to apply through your Workday account.<p><br></p><strong>Job Summary</strong><p><br></p>This role is responsible for applying skilled knowledge to the design and development of embedded applications on hardware platforms. The focus in this role includes creation of technical specifications, application firmware design and development, and support for manufacturing and regulatory approval. Knowledge of basic software development practices and principles is required. An Engineer 3, Firmware must support their peers in day-to-day development activities and be able to troubleshoot platform defects of average complexity. This role will be responsible for both individual and team based software development activities.<p><br></p><strong><u>Job Responsibilities: </u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Design, develop, and implement application level firmware solutions to meet business needs</li><li>Work with stakeholders to understand functional requirements of systems to accurately develop designs, implementations and test cases</li><li>Design and develop application firmware using best practices that adhere to product specifications using an Agile development process</li><li>Create and maintain technical specifications as related to product development</li><li>Work with senior engineers to implement scalable designs and modular functional blocks that meet product requirements</li><li>Use design analysis techniques such as FMEA or rate monotonic analysis to validate software designs prior to implementation. Ability to accurately document an intended design is critical</li><li>Create unit test cases that accurately test interface functionality and responses to varied inputs both in and out of scope</li><li>Analyze, troubleshoot, and resolve firmware defects as found during bench, lab, and production QA testing</li><li>Apply software quality tools such as Lint, Understand, and other static and dynamic analysis tools to verify software releases meet quality and coding standards</li><li>Support regulatory engineering for FCC and other outside agency approval of end products</li><li>Support manufacturing on site during as needed for engineering and production builds</li><li>Manage own work to deliver according to project schedules; be accountable for delivery</li><li>Actively contribute to the adoption of software architecture, best practices, and technologies</li><li>Responsible for complying with the security requirements set forth by the Information Security team and the established ISO 27001 Security Roles, Responsibilities, and Authorities Document found in the ISMS Document Library</li><li>Comply with health and safety guidelines and rules; managers should also ensure compliance across their teams</li><li>Protect CGI’s reputation by keeping information confidential</li><li>Maintain professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops, professional publications, establishing personal networks, and participating in professional societies</li><li>Contribute to the team effort by accomplishing related results and participating on projects as needed</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Job Requirements: </u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree in computer engineering, computer science, or electrical engineering and minimum of three (3) years of job-related experience strongly preferred; or minimum of seven (7) years of job-related experience as defined above in the Essential Functions section</li><li>An advanced degree in directly applicable area of study may substitute for up to two (2) years of experience</li><li>Flexibility to travel up to 10% of time; international travel required</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred Qualifications:</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Ability to work within a cross functional teams to create electro-mechanical products, understanding and participation in Scrum and Agile methodology; title: Embedded Software Engineer
description: <ul><li>Company with sports and technology at its core - with mobile and web apps|Fullstack opportunity using C#, ASP.NET, React with small team of 6 developers<br><br><br></li></ul><strong>About Our Client<br><br></strong>Our client was founded over 20 years ago in the Spectator Sports industry, gearing their platform to serve a wide array of youth sports organizations across the US. They're currently the leading provider of technology solutions for all of the youth sports teams in the US, operating web and mobile platforms with over 1M onboarded users. Their main challenge now is merging their technology to integrate with a company they acquired, while continuing to maintain operation of their platforms with minimal downtime. These are high impact projects that enrich the experiences of youth athletes, and simplify<br><br><strong>Job Description<br><br></strong>The Selected Software Developer will:<br><ul><li>Use React Native for all mobile development projects.</li><li>Remain up to date with development breakthroughs and follows best practices.</li><li>Use, rework, and adapt existing web applications for mobile apps.</li><li>Create and test software prototypes when needed.</li><li>Develop client displays and user interfaces in a Fullstack capacity.</li><li>Perform complete testing of web applications-unit and end-to-end automated testing, engaging users as necessary.</li><li>Develop SQL database-driven web interfaces.</li><li>Utilize front-end web technologies to create interactive user experiences with rich functionality.</li><li>Take charge of story development without needing micromanagement.<br><br></li></ul><em>MPI does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, or based on an individual's status in any group or class protected by applicable federal, state or local law. MPI encourages applications from minorities, women, the disabled, protected veterans and all other qualified applicants.<br><br></em><strong>The Successful Applicant<br><br></strong>The Successful Software Developer has:<br><ul><li>4+ years of Fullstack experience.</li><li>Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related field.</li><li>Boot camp certificate (with at least 2 additional years of experience).</li><li>Strong proficiency with React Native.</li><li>Exposure or experience working in C#/.NET is highly preferred but not required.</li><li>Experience using SQL databases - either relational and/or non-relational experience.</li><li>Experience working with REST APIs.</li><li>Strong attention to detail, always looking to create robust solutions that minimize excess redundancies.</li><li>Excellent troubleshooting and communication skills.</li><li>Clear documentation.</li><li>A desire to have an impact on the world with the software being developed.</li></ul><strong>What's on Offer<br><br></strong>What's on Offer for the Selected Software Developer?<br><ul><li>Base salary very open for the right candidate, in the range of 140k-180k depending on experience.</li><li>Affordable comprehensive healthcare plans, with more than 80% of out of pocket costs covered.</li><li>401k with 4% company match, no waiting period for matched contributions.</li><li>Unlimited Paid Time Off program, with no expectations, thresholds, or strings attached.</li><li>Person first model, i.e. you're a person before you're a developer allowing flexibility for when life just happens.</li><li>Hybrid in the office in Northbrook up to twice a week, can make exceptions as needed.</li><li>Dynamic culture, tech minded individuals looking to make a difference with their coding.</li><li>Mentorship, management, and leadership opportunities within.</li><li>Onboarding program to make the transition period run smoothly.</li><li>Optional outings to visit Chicago Sports teams, games, press events, networking events.<br></li></ul><strong>Contact: Emily Bodett<br><br></strong><strong>Quote job ref: JN-052023-6060336</strong>

title: .Net Web Developer
description: <ul><li>NET Software Engineer/Developer - Chicago</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Company Description</u></strong><p><br></p>'200BRedMane Technology LLC is an application software consulting and systems integration company based in Chicago. We deliver software solutions for our clients throughout the United States and Canada by means of building new applications, implementing cloud and packaged systems, and/or modernizing legacy systems.<p><br></p>RedMane has earned an exemplary service reputation that prioritizes a highly collaborative culture. Our primary objective is to ensure the solutions we design and implement meet or exceed the needs of our clients for their mission critical systems.<p><br></p>The diverse and passionate teams within RedMane address complex, real world challenges. Technology is just our tool.<p><br></p>The Role<p><br></p>RedMane has a full-time opportunity for a .NET software engineer/developer as we continue to grow our Chicago based practice.<p><br></p>The software engineer/developer will perform analysis, design, and development for our no code / low code, highly configurable SaaS product. This product incorporates leading-edge technologies, from cloud-based mobility to data visualizations and artificial intelligence. This role involves close coordination with the product owner and other key members of the product development organization. The software engineer/developer will work on a dynamic development team in an Agile/Scrum environment.<p><br></p><strong><u>Skills &amp; Role Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p>The .NET software engineer/developer will need to have:<p><br></p><ul><li>3- B years of experience in software development, preferably in a C- 3, JavaScript, .NET, and SQL Server environment. </li><li>2- B years of experience with Node.js, GoJs, Angular, or similar technologies. </li><li>Bachelor'2019s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or other field. </li><li>Strong attention to detail and problem-solving skills. </li><li>Highly self-motivated with the ability to work independently. </li><li>Proven ability to efficiently learn and apply new ideas and concepts. </li><li>Ability to organize time, staff, and projects efficiently.</li></ul><p><br></p>All professionals at RedMane are expected to possess these skills:<ul><li>A strong ethical foundation, capable of thriving in an environment and culture where honesty, integrity, and accountability are core values.</li><li>A collaborative spirit, a team orientation, and a willingness and desire to contribute to the success of others.</li></ul><p><br></p>We Offer You<p><br></p>RedMane has an environment that offers challenging and interesting work. A place where you can have fun and express your talent and creativity. You will be working side by side with like-minded peers in a non-bureaucratic environment where sharing knowledge is the norm. Everyone at RedMane shares a passion for making a real difference for individuals, communities, and the world.<p><br></p>Additionally, we believe you should have fun and enjoy growing your career; we provide the supportive and empowering environment to make it happen. RedMane is very proud to offer employees professional and personal perks that include:<ul><li>A flexible work environment that includes hybridized locations and schedules with free catered lunches in the office three days a week.</li><li>Market based compensation with a full range of benefits including medical, dental, vision, 401(k), short and long-term disability insurance, etc.</li><li>A culture that promotes and fosters career growth through professional training and mentoring.</li><li>An employee wellness program that includes free access to professional fitness coaches, structured dietary/nutrition plans, weekly Pilates classes in the office, and events that range from 5k- 7s to triathlons.</li><li>Opportunities to give back to the community through our RedMane Community Impact Team which organizes events like Feed My Starving Children, Toy Drives, and other charitable activities.</li></ul>

title: Business Analyst (Level III)
description: <strong>What’s so interesting about this role?<br><br></strong>The role of the SDET Engineer encompasses various responsibilities, including designing innovative automated test strategies and frameworks. They are also responsible for executing and automating tests to meet software testing requirements. Collaboration with engineering team members is essential for the SDET Engineer, as they work together to develop, update, and improve the test automation framework and infrastructure.<br><br>Furthermore, the SDET Engineer will carry out scheduled tests, provide reports on the test results, and effectively manage any identified defects. They will also perform regression testing for software fixes related to both new and existing features. Additionally, the SDET Engineer will assist the development team in reproducing and troubleshooting issues, while also developing new test automation solutions whenever required.<br><br><strong>What’s the job? <br></strong><ul><li>Champion the quality of the product and strive for team goals</li><li>Maintain client-automated testing tools and increase automated test coverage</li><li>Collaborate with coworkers to enhance existing client automation frameworks, compare alternative testing approaches, and build new systems</li><li>Manage Grindr’s cloud testing tools and collaborate with their support teams</li><li>Increase efficiency by listening to development feedback and ensuring test framework, execution, and reporting is streamlined and useful</li><li>Monitor, investigate, and identify problems during the development process, pair with client development to diagnose and test fixes</li><li>Contribute to the team’s agile effort by estimating, measuring and improving through active participation and providing feedback on quality issues</li><li>Coordinate and participate in discussions about holistic testing approaches with the development teams, so we have a balance of manual testing, UI automation testing, and unit testing coverage<br><br></li></ul><strong>What We’ll Love About You<br></strong><ul><li>Minimum 3 years of experience in a mobile SDET role</li><li>Experience with mobile automation frameworks; including Espresso (Android), XCUITest (iOS), or Appium</li><li>Strong programming skills in an object-oriented language (i.e. Kotlin, Swift, Java)</li><li>Significant experience automating repeated tasks and building test coverage with existing tools</li><li>Knowledge of test methodologies, writing test plans, creating test cases and debugging</li><li>Thorough understanding of the SDLC and tooling (GIT, branching/merging, build systems, CI tools and methodologies)</li><li>Experience with API testing or integration (REST APIs)</li><li>Ability to prioritize multiple tasks, be self-motivated, and be goal oriented is essential to excel in this role</li><li>Strong English verbal and written communication skills<br><br></li></ul><strong>We’ll really swoon if you have<br></strong><ul><li>Strong programming skills with Swift or Kotlin</li><li>Considerable experience with Espresso or XCUITest automation</li><li>Track record of delivering complex automation and new frameworks</li><li>Extensive experience with various types of testing including unit, system, integration, user acceptance, regression, usability and end-to-end testing<br><br></li></ul><strong>What You'll Love About Us<br></strong><ul><li>Mission and Impact: Grindr is the world-leading LGBTQ social networking service. Your role will impact the lives of millions of LGBTQ people around the world</li><li>Remote First: We have satellite offices in LA, NYC, and Chicago, and are remote first across the US and Canada. More than 30% of our employees work outside of cities where we have satellite offices</li><li>Family Insurance: Insurance premium coverage for health, dental, and vision for you and partial coverage for your dependents</li><li>Retirement Savings: Generous 401K plan with 6% match and immediate vest in the US</li><li>Queer-Inclusive Benefits: Industry-leading gender-affirming offerings with up to 90% cost coverage, access to Included Health, monthly stipends for HRT, and more</li><li>Additional Benefits: Flexible vacation policy, monthly stipends for cell phone, internet, wellness, and food, one-time home-office setup stipend, and company-sponsored events<br><br></li></ul><strong>About Grindr<br><br></strong>Our mission is to connect queer people with one another and the world. Since launching in 2009, Grindr has grown into the world’s largest social networking app for gay, bi, trans, and queer people. We have millions of daily users who use our location-based technology in almost every country in every corner of the planet.<br><br>As a newly public company, we proudly represent a modern LGBTQ lifestyle that’s expanding into new platforms. From social issues to original content, we’re continuing to blaze innovative paths with a meaningful impact for our community. At the heart of our work in this new chapter is a shared set of core values including user obsession, openness and exploration, a bias for action, and strong support of the LGBTQ community. We’re looking to build a team of talented, passionate, and open-minded people who believe in our mission, align with our values, and who are excited to work on a product obsessed with building meaningful connections for its user base.<br><br><strong><em>Grindr is an equal-opportunity employer<br><br></em></strong><em>To learn more about how we handle the personal data of applicants, visit our</em> <em>Employee and Candidate Privacy Policy</em><em>.<br><br></em><strong>About Grindr<br><br></strong>Since launching in 2009, Grindr has grown into the world’s largest social networking app for gay, bi, trans, and queer people. We have millions of daily users who use our location-based technology in almost every country in every corner of the planet.<br><br>Today, Grindr proudly represents a modern LGBTQ+ lifestyle that expands into new platforms. From social issues to original content, we continue to blaze innovative paths with a meaningful impact for our community. At Grindr, we create a safe space where you can discover, navigate, and get zero feet away from the queer world around you.<br><br>As of June 2020, Grindr has new owners with a track record of multiple successful Bay Area start-ups. The new leadership is demonstrating a renewed commitment to creating an experience for users that is safe, fun, and productive, as well as a positive &amp; uplifting company culture in which everyone can be their best selves. At the heart of Grindr’s mission in this new chapter is a shared set of core values including transparency, accountability, experimentation (failing fast), and strong allegiance to the LGBTQ+ community.<br><br><strong><em>Grindr is an equal-opportunity employer<br><br></em></strong><em>To learn more about how we handle the personal data of applicants, visit our</em> <em>Employee and Candidate Privacy Policy</em><em>.<br><br></em><em>Grindr is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices. This base pay range is for the U.S. and is not applicable to locations outside of the U.S. The actual base pay is dependent upon many factors, such as training, transferable skills, work experience, business needs, location, and market demands. The base pay range is subject to change and may be modified in the future. This role will also be eligible for equity and benefits.<br><br></em>Base Pay Range<br><br>$100,000—$160,000 USD
industry: Software Development and Technology, Information and Internet
description_json: <strong>What’s so interesting about this role?<br><br></strong>The role of the SDET Engineer encompasses various responsibilities, including designing innovative automated test strategies and frameworks. They are also responsible for executing and automating tests to meet software testing requirements. Collaboration with engineering team members is essential for the SDET Engineer, as they work together to develop, update, and improve the test automation framework and infrastructure.<br><br>Furthermore, the SDET Engineer will carry out scheduled tests, provide reports on the test results, and effectively manage any identified defects. They will also perform regression testing for software fixes related to both new and existing features. Additionally, the SDET Engineer will assist the development team in reproducing and troubleshooting issues, while also developing new test automation solutions whenever required.<br><br><strong>What’s the job? <br></strong><ul><li>Champion the quality of the product and strive for team goals</li><li>Maintain client-automated testing tools and increase automated test coverage</li><li>Collaborate with coworkers to enhance existing client automation frameworks, compare alternative testing approaches, and build new systems</li><li>Manage Grindr’s cloud testing tools and collaborate with their support teams</li><li>Increase efficiency by listening to development feedback and ensuring test framework, execution, and reporting is streamlined and useful</li><li>Monitor, investigate, and identify problems during the development process, pair with client development to diagnose and test fixes</li><li>Contribute to the team’s agile effort by estimating, measuring and improving through active participation and providing feedback on quality issues</li><li>Coordinate and participate in discussions about holistic testing approaches with the development teams, so we have a balance of manual testing, UI automation testing, and unit testing coverage<br><br></li></ul><strong>What We’ll Love About You<br></strong><ul><li>Minimum 3 years of experience in a mobile SDET role</li><li>Experience with mobile automation frameworks; including Espresso (Android), XCUITest (iOS), or Appium</li><li>Strong programming skills in an object-oriented language (i.e. Kotlin, Swift, Java)</li><li>Significant experience automating repeated tasks and building test coverage with existing tools</li><li>Knowledge of test methodologies, writing test plans, creating test cases and debugging</li><li>Thorough understanding of the SDLC and tooling (GIT, branching/merging, build systems, CI tools and methodologies)</li><li>Experience with API testing or integration (REST APIs)</li><li>Ability to prioritize multiple tasks, be self-motivated, and be goal oriented is essential to excel in this role</li><li>Strong English verbal and written communication skills<br><br></li></ul><strong>We’ll really swoon if you have<br></strong><ul><li>Strong programming skills with Swift or Kotlin</li><li>Considerable experience with Espresso or XCUITest automation</li><li>Track record of delivering complex automation and new frameworks</li><li>Extensive experience with various types of testing including unit, system, integration, user acceptance, regression, usability and end-to-end testing<br><br></li></ul><strong>What You'll Love About Us<br></strong><ul><li>Mission and Impact: Grindr is the world-leading LGBTQ social networking service. Your role will impact the lives of millions of LGBTQ people around the world</li><li>Remote First: We have satellite offices in LA, NYC, and Chicago, and are remote first across the US and Canada. More than 30% of our employees work outside of cities where we have satellite offices</li><li>Family Insurance: Insurance premium coverage for health, dental, and vision for you and partial coverage for your dependents</li><li>Retirement Savings: Generous 401K plan with 6% match and immediate vest in the US</li><li>Queer-Inclusive Benefits: Industry-leading gender-affirming offerings with up to 90% cost coverage, access to Included Health, monthly stipends for HRT, and more</li><li>Additional Benefits: Flexible vacation policy, monthly stipends for cell phone, internet, wellness, and food, one-time home-office setup stipend, and company-sponsored events<br><br></li></ul><strong>About Grindr<br><br></strong>Our mission is to connect queer people with one another and the world. Since launching in 2009, Grindr has grown into the world’s largest social networking app for gay, bi, trans, and queer people. We have millions of daily users who use our location-based technology in almost every country in every corner of the planet.<br><br>As a newly public company, we proudly represent a modern LGBTQ lifestyle that’s expanding into new platforms. From social issues to original content, we’re continuing to blaze innovative paths with a meaningful impact for our community. At the heart of our work in this new chapter is a shared set of core values including user obsession, openness and exploration, a bias for action, and strong support of the LGBTQ community. We’re looking to build a team of talented, passionate, and open-minded people who believe in our mission, align with our values, and who are excited to work on a product obsessed with building meaningful connections for its user base.<br><br><strong><em>Grindr is an equal-opportunity employer<br><br></em></strong><em>To learn more about how we handle the personal data of applicants, visit our</em> <em>Employee and Candidate Privacy Policy</em><em>.<br><br></em><strong>About Grindr<br><br></strong>Since launching in 2009, Grindr has grown into the world’s largest social networking app for gay, bi, trans, and queer people. We have millions of daily users who use our location-based technology in almost every country in every corner of the planet.<br><br>Today, Grindr proudly represents a modern LGBTQ+ lifestyle that expands into new platforms. From social issues to original content, we continue to blaze innovative paths with a meaningful impact for our community. At Grindr, we create a safe space where you can discover, navigate, and get zero feet away from the queer world around you.<br><br>As of June 2020, Grindr has new owners with a track record of multiple successful Bay Area start-ups. The new leadership is demonstrating a renewed commitment to creating an experience for users that is safe, fun, and productive, as well as a positive &amp; uplifting company culture in which everyone can be their best selves. At the heart of Grindr’s mission in this new chapter is a shared set of core values including transparency, accountability, experimentation (failing fast), and strong allegiance to the LGBTQ+ community.<br><br><strong><em>Grindr is an equal-opportunity employer<br><br></em></strong><em>To learn more about how we handle the personal data of applicants, visit our</em> <em>Employee and Candidate Privacy Policy</em><em>.<br><br></em><em>Grindr is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices. This base pay range is for the U.S. and is not applicable to locations outside of the U.S. The actual base pay is dependent upon many factors, such as training, transferable skills, work experience, business needs, location, and market demands. The base pay range is subject to change and may be modified in the future. This role will also be eligible for equity and benefits.<br><br></em>Base Pay Range<br><br>$100,000—$160,000 USD

title: React Native Mobile Developer - Hybrid
description: Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, gt.school. Have you got what it takes?<p><br></p>Do you take pleasure in looking at and interpreting data? Are you passionate about education and want a role in a startup that wants to revolutionize how technology is used to learn? If yes, keep on reading…<p><br></p>We’re looking for individuals who:<p><br></p><ul><li>Are strategic problem solvers who can quickly devise and implement solutions to address ad-hoc issues facing our students</li><li>Are excellent communicators; able to concisely and effectively describe processes in written playbooks, design engaging student communication, and keep other team members consistently updated with progress on projects. </li><li>Consider themselves to be consistent, high performers who rarely have ‘off-days’.</li><li>Understand the importance of revolutionizing the education space with cutting-edge technology.</li></ul><p><br></p>In this role, you’ll work directly with our EdTech company, gt.school. You’ll develop an expert understanding of the data we collect on students and become familiar with all the apps and systems we use to collect and store this information. You will build new edtech tools and operational processes, and restructure existing processes to be more efficient.<p><br></p>Not only will you gain valuable experience, but you’ll also receive regular coaching and training from a team of global tech experts and operations professionals. You’ll get constructive feedback on all of your work to help you develop and get a chance to meet daily with other team members to work collaboratively on projects.<p><br></p>Interested in a role that involves research, strategy, product development, and data science in the cutting-edge field of education and technology? Apply below.<p><br></p><strong><u>What You Will Be Doing</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Participating in daily stand-up calls to solve the most critical issues facing students in our program, other staff members such as Motivational Coaches, Academic Coaches, Program Directors, or the leadership team.</li><li>Converting important decisions made by leadership into work units that a junior Operations team can perform.</li><li>Creating robust processes that stand the test of time and capture all of the edge-cases to ensure maximum probability of success the first time around. </li><li>Troubleshooting issues facing our students due to data issues, human error, or automation error; quickly strategizing a bulletproof solution that solves the issue and prevents further recurrence in the future.</li><li>Working as a team to ensure progress is being made on key tasks by communicating with other operations analysts and managers to ensure no lapse in service for internal or external stakeholders.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>What You Won’t Be Doing</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Collecting data or performing administrative tasks - we have a junior operations analyst team to do this type of work.</li><li>Providing loose or generalized solutions that don’t actually get implemented.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Senior Software Engineer Key Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p>Same as “What you will be doing”, above.<p><br></p><strong><u>Basic Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Excellent written and verbal English communication skills</li><li>Proficient in Python or R (we will test this)</li><li>2+ years of work experience working in a technical field (science, technology, financial services, data science)</li><li>Bachelor’s degree from a top 20 US university or a top 100 global university.</li><li>Consistently able to work 8 hours per day, Monday through Friday, between 6AM and 6PM CST</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Nice-to-have Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Advanced in Python and Apps Script</li><li>Familiarity with Canvas (LMS)</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>About Gt.school</u></strong><p><br></p>gt.school is a stealth EdTech startup in Austin, Texas, the center of educational innovation in the US. Our unique approach leverages 50+ years of learning science, cutting-edge data analytics and high-performance life skills coaching. In doing so, we can help students learn 5x faster and unlock their full potential in both academics and in life. We are a remote-first company that hires globally via Crossover.<p><br></p>There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!<p><br></p><strong>Working with Crossover</strong><p><br></p>This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $30 USD/hour, which equates to $60,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.<p><br></p><strong>What to expect next:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.</li><li>Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Important!</strong> If you do not receive an email from us:<p><br></p><ul><li>First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.</li><li>Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.</li><li>Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.</li><li>If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.</li></ul> Crossover Job Code: LJ-4880-US-Chicago-SeniorSoftware.001<p><br></p>

Act as customer advocate and liaison back into Cardinal Health organization with teams such as Sales, Customer Service, Pricing, Operations, Credit &amp; Collections.</p><p></p><p><strong><span>OptiFreight™</span></strong><span> <strong>Logistics</strong> is the leading provider of Inbound, Outbound, and Less than Truckload (LTL) Shipping and freight management services for the Healthcare sector.</span></p><p></p><p><strong><em><span>Accountabilities   </span></em></strong> </p><ul><li><span>Oversee assigned OptiFreight customer(s) as it pertains to shipping, logistics, and general service needs for East Coast Territory. </span></li><li><span>Bridge relationships between the customer and internal Cardinal Health teams to ensure flawless service </span></li><li><span>Manage customer expectations and requirements through proactive account review, facilitating issue resolution, and keeping customer informed of key initiatives </span></li><li><span>Track, measure, and report key performance indicators monthly </span></li><li><span>Build and maintain long-term trusted relationships with customer to support retention and growth of the account  </span></li></ul><p></p><p><strong><em><span>Qualifications</span></em></strong> </p><ul><li><span>Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience, preferred </span></li><li><span>Direct customer facing experience preferred </span></li><li><span>Strong communication skills </span></li><li><span>Demonstrated ability to work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment  </span></li><li><span>Highly motivated, creative, able to operate effectively within a team  </span></li></ul><p></p><p><strong><em><span>What is expected of you and others at this level:</span></em></strong> </p><ul><li><span>Applies working knowledge in the application of concepts, principles, and technical capabilities to perform varied resolve </span></li><li><span>Applies judgment to assist in customer situations </span></li><li><span>Receives general guidance may receive more detailed instruction on new projects
